title: Neighborhood:Residents Control Future of Bronx's Silver Beach
description: Silver Beach is a waterside community tucked into the eastern tip of the Throgs Neck section of the Bronx where residents seem satisfiedwith apparent justificationthat they have found an ideal way to preserve and improve their neighborhood.

title: Quick Henry, the Fix
description: WASHINGTON  Kepone may kill me and pesticides are upsetting my balance of nature. Sugarcoated cereal flakes will be the ruination of my children, but if Captain Crunch doesn't corrupt the younger generation, those other plasticwrapped supermarket products will. The Concorde, a malign alliance with the aerosolspray can, is endangering my ionosphere. This will probably lead to cancer, unless the additives in my morning rasher of bacon do me in first.

title: Stand of the Prime Minister on Links Seems to Soften
description: TEHERAN, Iran, March 1Despite scandals and grievances involving United States concerns doing business here, Iran is still eager to buy United States goods, according to Prime Minister Amir Abbas Hoveida.

description: WASHINGTON, March 1The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether appeals court judges who are reviewing obscenity convictions must themselves look at the alleged]y obscene materials before they rule.

description: WASHINGTON, March 1President Ford sent to Congress today his plan to consolidate 24 educational programs into a $3.3 billion block grant to the states.

title: Laughing Gas Puzzle
description: Two Boston doctors have reported in The Journal of the American Medical Association that nitrous oxidebetter known as laughing gas"is effective in rapidly easing the pain of heart attacks. Apparently this is one case where American medicine has learned from the Soviet Union.

title: Italy Reopens Foreign Money Market
description: ROME, March 1 Italy opened its foreign exchange markets today for the first time in nearly six weeks after receiving assurance of $1.94 billion worth of loans to replenish the country's depleted coffers and shore up the troubled lira.

title: No Curfew on Planning
description: What New York needs now, in addition to money, is planning in the broadest possible sense. A growing attitude that this is something for more halcyon times misunderstands what planning is all about; it confuses cosmetics and the luxury of Olympian goals with preservation and promotion of the city's basic assets and amenities.

title: PickIt Winner (209) Takes Horse Race and a Lot of Luck

title: CITY MAY PUT OFF BIG BUDGET CUTS UNTIL THIRD YEAR
description: The Beame administration was reported yesterday to be considering deferral of the larger part of the budget cuts it is facing to the final year of the threeyear austerity plan, in the hope that changes in the national Administration and economy might mitigate some of the city's fiscal pains.

title: Hundreds of Birds Killed By Pacific Ocean Oil Spili
description: SEATTLE, March 1 (AP)An oil spill killed hundreds of sea birds along a 250mile stretch of Pacific Ocean beach in Wash ington and Oregon during the weekend, the Coast GUard said today.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: THE ONLY GAME IN TOWN: Cleon Jones, who was released by the Mots last summer, at batting practice at the Chicago White Sox training camp in Sarasota. Fla., yesterday. The camp, opened by Bill Veeck, is the only one of 24 to start as negotiations between the owners and players continued. Meanwhile, in the Bronx, tickets went on sale at Yankee Stadium, where the Yankees are scheduledto open April 15. Page 27.

title: N.F.L. Pension Talks Canceled
description: National Football League owners canceled a meeting yesterday of the league's retirement board and threatened termination of the N.F.L. pension plan following reports a planned $11.1 million suit, by the N.F.L. Players Association. Pete Rozelle, the commissioner, who is also chairman of the retirement board, received a letter signed by the Buffalo Bills owner, Ralph Wilson, one of the four club owners on the board, in which the clubs questioned whether the pension plan might have to be scrapped.

title: Talks With Western Companies Set to Open Tomorrow
description: TEHERAN, Iran, March 1Iran's crucial negotiations with the Western oil companies that buy most of its oil are to resume here Wednesday when the companies representatives are expected to reply to positions taken earlier by Iran, wellplaced informants reported today.

title: Brezhnev's Bouquets Seem to Say His Star Is Rising
description: MOSCOW, March 1He has been hailed as the most outstanding political figure of our epoch, a bright and inspiring example of selfless service, a passionate fighter for Communism and a son of the people.

description: WASHINGTON, March 1The House of Representatives today approved, 298 to 45, legislation that would enable New York City employee pension funds to purchase $2.5 billion of city securities.

title: Research Center for Retarded Imperiled
description: BORDENTOWN, March 1The Edward R. Johnstone Research and Training Center, the first stateoperated facility for research on mental retardation, is in jeopardy.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Three Long Island men were indicted by a Nassau County grand jury on multiple counts of seconddegree larceny for allegedly swindling 26 real estate investors out of $1.233 million by misrepresenting the price of 1,417 acres of rural farmland in Warren and Camden Counties New Jersey. The defendants pleaded not guilty at arraignment and were released without bail, pending trial. They were identified as Dr. Eugene Rodin, a 63yearold physician, of Sands Point; Kenneth E. Boklan, 44, a lawyer, Cold Spring Harbor, and Seymour Vogel, 44, a real estate broker, of Woodmere.

title: Ethiopian Church ExHead Is Reported Under Arrest
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 1 (AP)The deposed had of the Ethiopian Orthodox Church, Patriarch Abuna Theophilos, and several of his bishops have been arrested by the Ethiopian military government, the AllAfrica Conference of Churches said today.

title: Business Briefs
description: Gerald Tsai Jr., chairman of the Tsai Financial Corporation, in a further diversification step, announced yesterday that Tsai Financial was acquiring the Pennsylvania Group, a Philadelphia brokerage firm. Tsai Financial is already the parent company of G. Tsai & Company, a member broker of the New York Stock Exchange. Mr. Tsai will become chairman of the Pennsylvania Group while Anthony A. Buford Jr. will remain as president.

title: Will Scouts Play an Encore Of the Saints Swan Song?
description: There are no longer any angels left in professional hockey. The Minnesota Fighting Saints of the World Hockey Association found that out the hard way over the weekend, and the Kansas City Scouts of the NaCorral H 5 ckey League have been served notice to that effect by Clarence Campbell, league president.

title: COURT VOIDS A SUIT AGAINST THE VOICE
description: Justice Abraham J. Gellinoff of State Supreme Court yesterday dismissed a $5 million libel suit brought by Justice Dominic S. Rinaldi against The Village Voice, but denied motions to dismiss by two other defendants and ordered a trial of the issues.

title: White Sox Only Team to Open Camp
description: SARASOTA, Fla., March 1 The old American institution of spring training, besieged by labor warfare, made its customary appearance today in only one of the 24 oamps, scattered across th Sun Beltthe Chicago White Sox camp operated by Bill Veeck, the happy rebel of baseball.

title: Boeing's Net Rises 7% On a Sales Gain of 3%
description: The Boeing Company reported yesterday an increase of 7.3 percent in fourthquarter earnings on a sales gain of 3 percent. For all of last year the earnings rose 5.4 percent, while sales dipped 0.3 percent from 1974.

title: Edward Saphir, Law Aide To Appellate Justices, 81
description: Edward Saphir, who retired in 1965. as a law assistant to the justices of the Appellate Division of the State Supreme Court's Second Department in Brooklyn, died yesterday at his home in Brooklyn. He was 81 years old.

title: SWISS GROUP SETS U.S URANIAM DEAL
description: A company owned by a group of Swiss utilities has agreed in principle to acquire the 25 percent interest of the United States Steel Corporation in two uranium ventures in Texas. The sale will he for $72 million and is subject to rights of first refusal by other participants in the venture. The Atlantic Richfield Company is the chief participant in the operation with a 50 percent interest. An additional 25 percent interest is owned by the Dalco Oil Company, a subsidiary of the Sabine Royalty Company of Dallas. The interests of Dalco and Atlantic Richfield are not offered in the deal.

title: Warren Was Reportedly Told Of C.I.A. Efforts to Kill Castro
description: WASHINGTON, March 1 (AP)The Senate Select Committee on intelligence has evidence that Earl Warren knew of attemptS by the Central Intelligence Agency to kill Fidel Castro, the Cuban Prime Minister, but not until three years after the Warren Commission finished investigating the assassination, on Nov. 22, 1963, of President Kennedy, wellinformed sources said today.

title: Soviet Mission Here Protests Riverdale Shooting
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 1The Soviet mission to the United Nations, in a protest made public today, has requested effective steps to identify and punish those responsible in a shooting incident at its residence in Riverdale last Friday.

title: AMBITIOUS PROGRAM FOR FIORI MUSICALI
description: On the evidence of its Carnegie Recital Hall concert on Sunday night, the lofty ambitions of Fiori Musicali far outstrip its modest level of achievement.

title: Totaled Woman
description: Although Cinderella and the Prince lived happily ever after, their marriage was not without incident, as we learn from the following fragment of the Prince's autobiography.

title: Spy Said He'd Kill Himself If Exposed, Then Did So
description: DALLAS, March 1A Dallas newspaper said tonight that Norman J. Rees warned its officials only hours before press time Saturday night that he would kill himself if the paper ran a story exposing his alleged doubleagent spying activities for the Soviet Union and the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: India Bans the Publication Of Report U.S. Shelves Aid
description: NEW DELHI, March 1 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Indian authorities today banned publication of a report that the United States had shelved aid to India because of the public hostility of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Laurin, 64, Reduces His Training Stable
description: Lucien Laurin, the man who saddled Secretariat, confirmed yesterday that he had resigned as trainer for Meadow Stable. The resignation is penevea to have been ac cepted last Saturday in. Florida during a meeting between Laurin and Mrs. Helen (Penny) Tweedy, whose Meadow Stable silks Secretariat carried to a sweep of the Triple Crown races in 1973. A lazy winter of doing nothing at his vacation home in Key Largo, Fla., apparently convinced the 64yearold trainer that it was time to start easing up. In recent years, he has been training as many as 70 horses, more than half of the% for Meadow Stable.

title: Spy Said He'd Kill Himself If Exposed, Then Did So
description: DALLAS, March 1A Dallas newspaper said tonight that Norman J. Rees warned its officials only hours before press time Saturday night that he would kill himself if the paper ran an article exposing his alleged doubleagent spying activities for the Soviet Union and the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Angolan lmplies He Might Help Rebels in 2 Other African Lands
description: BRAZZAVILLE, Congo, March 1 (Reuters)The head of Angola's leftwing government suggested yesterday that his country would support nationalist guerrillas fighting for independence in Rhodesia and SouthWest Africa.

title: Jean Martinon, Conductor, Dead at 66
description: PARIS, March 1Jean Martinon, the internationally known conductor, died here today after a long illness. He was 66 years old.

title: Multiple Sclerosis Linked To Virus by Teams in U.S.
description: Research involving three husbandandwife teams working independently here and in Philadelphia has come up with strong clues linking a small virus with multiple sclerosis, an incurable disease that cripples hundreds of thousands of people worldwide beginning in middle age.

title: BIG BOARD SEEKS CARLISLE AGAIN
description: The New York Stock Exchange, which announced plans last January to purchase Carlisle de Coppet & Company the nation's last remaining oddlot brokerage firm, was reported yesterday to have quietly re  opened negotiations with Carlisle over the proposed purchase.

title: Saving Italy
description: How to Defend the Lira While Losing Italy may prove the title of the drama opening in Rome now that a new Government, backed by currencysupport loans from its European and American allies, has reopened the foreign exchange markets after a sixweek closing.

title: WILLIAM HAMILTON
description: William Herbert Hamilton, a realestate broker here for 50 years, died Sunday in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived at 251 East 51st Street. He also had homes in Rumson, N.J., and Edgartown, Mass.

title: STOCKS BUOYED BY A LATE RIM
description: The stock market staged a late rally yesterday to finish modestly higher despite signs that the Federal Reserve Board had adopted a slightly tighter monetary policy.

title: Wallace and Carter Slates Here Are Challenged by Two Rivals
description: The Jackson  for  President team challenged yesterday the validity of every New York delegate slate filed in support of George C. Wallace and 24 of the 35 slates filed for Jimmy Carter.

title: Abortion Foe Has Solid Core of Support
description: BOSTON, March 1If been planning the Massachusetts primary so as to make Ellen McCormack's campaign most effective, said James Kilthe Boston tactician behind the Long Island woman's antiabortion Presidential campaign, we'd have done several things.

title: Nicklaus Victor by 3 Strokes
description: LAUDERHILL, Fla., March 1Jack Nicklaus did not merely win the Tournament Players Championship today he blitzed it. This is a measure of how he demolished the opposition: 3. C. Snead, who had been tied with Nicklaus going into today's final round, shot 68 today and Nicklaus beat him by three shots.

title: ROSS D. HILL DIES; EXBANK OFFICIAL
description: Ross D. Hill, who retired in 1974 as president of the Union Dime Savings Bank after an association of 46 years, died Sunday in St. John's Hospital, Yonkers. He was 63 years old and lived in Hartsdale, N. Y.

title: Obituary 5  No Title
description: Obituary 5  No Title

title: EVIDENCE RULED OUT IN THE HARRIS CASE
description: LOS ANGELES, March 1 (UPI)A Superior Court Judge ruled today that evidence seized in the San Francisco hideout of William and Emily Harris, could not he used against them in their trial on robbery, kidnapping and assault charges. Judge Mark Brandler said the evidence was seized illegally because agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation did not have search warrants when they entered the Harrises apartment after the survivors of the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army were captured last Sept. 18.

title: Bicentennial Aide Backed
description: WASHINGTON, March 1 (AP) The Senate confirmed today the appointment of Jean McKee, of New York to be deputy administrator of the American Revolution Bicentennial Administration.

title: Question of Death Of Victim Upsets Murder Conviction
description: A man cannot be charged with murder when there is no proof that his alleged victim was alive at the time the murderous act was committed, the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn held yesterday.

title: Yugoslav Lawyer on Trial For Sharing Client's View
description: VALJEVO, Yugoslavia, March 1A Yugoslav lawyer known for his defense of political dissidents was himself placed on trial today, charged with agreeing with the views of one of his clients. But the case INPS adjourned and its future course is not clear.

title: SENATE TAKES UP OKLAHOMA FIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, March 1The Senate, which spent seven weeks last year in a futile effort to decide a disputed New Hampshire Senate election, moved today toward trying to decide whether Senator Henry L. Bellmon, a Republican, really won his election in Oklahoma nearly 16 months ago.

title: Leiber and Stoller Get Musical Tribute At the 92d St. Y
description: Jerry Leiber and Mike Stoller, currently celebrating their 25th anniversary as one of the most successful songwriting teams in popular music, are so indissoluble that separation apparently occasions acute unease.

title: KATHARI'NE CAULKINS
description: Katharine White Caulkins, wife of Dan Platt Caulkins, retired banker, died Sunday in Hobe Sound, Fla. She was 72 years old and lived in Washington and in Bedford Village, N.Y.

title: Multiple Sclerosis Linked To Virus by Teams in U.S.
description: Research involving three husbandandwife teams working independently here and in Philadelphia has come up with strong clues linking a small virus with multiple sclerosis, an incurable disease that cripples hundreds of thousands of people worldwide beginning in middle age.

title: Juvenile Justice in State In Disarray, Official Says
description: A writer says she sought the prosecution of two teenage pursesnatchers but was talked out of it by an official in the Family Court.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ON THE HOUSE Something new has been added at one of the bestknown structures in town, the venerable (1911) central building of the New York Public Library: free guided tours and a new tour and visitor information desk, both staffed by trained, civicminded volunteers. The new services will be in operation on Tuesdays and Wednesdays, with the desk open from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. and the tours scheduled for 11 A.M. and 2 P.M.

title: A Teamsters Local Forced to Disclose Pension Fund Data
description: CHICAGO, March 2 (UPI)A Federal district judge ruled today that a teamster union local must disclose pension fund financial documents under an antifraud provision of the Federal securities laws. The decision could force similar disclosures from other teamster funds across the country.

title: Wisconsin Employees Strike
description: KENOSHA, Wis., March 2 (AP) About 475 Kenosha County employees had had been without a conrtact since Jan. 1 were on strike for a second day today. The walkout was approved at a rally yesterday.

title: Nestle Increasing Wholesale Prices Of Soluble Coffee
description: The Nesti Company announced yesterday that it had raised wholesale prices for its soluble coffees by 2 to 2 cents an ounce, A spokesman for the General Foods Corporation said his company was studying the move.

title: MINISTER KILLED BY A POLICEMAN
description: SPRING VALLEY, N. Y., March 2A prominent Rockland County minister who personally responded to a burglary alarm in his church was shot and killed by a policeman investigating the same alarm last night.

title: Blue Ribbon Panel Proposes an Independent Organization to Oversee the Nation's Medical System
description: A blue ribbon panel proposed yesterday creation of an independent, private organization, composed of individuals from a wide variety of backgrounds, to oversee the nation's medical system and to help correct its problems. The organization Would be known as the National Commission on Medical Education, Manpower and Services.

title: GenericDrug Bill Backed
description: HARTFORD, March 22 (UPI)! A controversial measure allowing Connecticut pharmacists to substitute cheaper generic drugs in brandname prescriptions was endorsed by a consumer group today. Brandname drugs can cost as much as 300 percent more than the same drug purchased under its generic name, the Connecticut Citizens Action Group told the legislative General Law Committee.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, MARCH 3, 1976

title: Genteel Head of H.R.A.
description: When Mayor Beame turned to a mildmannered, softspoken actuary and retired insurance executive, J. Henry Smith, to take charge of the city's immense welfare problems, Mr. Smith's selection.  and acceptancecame as no surprise to his associates who know him as a doer, a moneywise businessman with a social conscience. Mr. Smith, whose appointment as Human Resources Administrator was announced yesterday, spent most of his career with the Equitable Life Assurance Society before stepping down as its chairman last April. Outside his professional field, he made a reputation for himself as a man willing to contribute his considerable expertise and influence to help overcome social ills and grinding poverty.

title: Preparing a Sumptuous Heriing Table: It's Not Work, It's Play
description: Speaking of kitchen kitch, Paul Sandblom said as he thumbed his way through a fat, wellworn volume, a Swedish cookbook titled Prinsessornas. That, he said, translates as The Three Princesses Cook Book and refers to Princess Astrid of Belgium, Princess Martha of Norway and Princess Margaretha of Denmark. All of them were of Swedish parentage. The book was written by Jenny Akerstrom and published in 1929.

title: A List of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: People and Business
description: The resignation of Howard P. Goldberg as president of Ohrbach's Inc. was announced yesterday by the specialtystore group.

title: BILLS SEEK TO GIVE CHECK PRIVILEGES TO SAVINGS BANKS
description: ALBANY, March 2The State Banking Department today asked the Legislature to give checkingaccount privileges to the state's savings banks. Unless legislative action is taken, the banks will have to close 165,000 socalled now accounts under a court order on March 31.

title: New York Colt Hitting Derby Trail
description: A notice on the wall of The Frenchman's Cafeteria in the Belmont Park barn area warns stablehands: Eat Your Betting Money but Never Bet Your Eating Money. At nearby Barn 60, though, it apyesterday that a number of Tracks stablehands were getting ready to ignore The Frenchman's advice and tap out on a 3yearold colt named Lord Henribee.

title: UNITED AIR PLANS LAYOFFS IN STAFF
description: United Air Lines Inc., the nation's largest air carrier, announced yesterday that because of lingering effects of a 16day strike in December, 350 employees would be laid off on March 27.

title: Children Abuzz With Answers (and Questions) at Hebrew School Blessing Bee
description: Spelling bees everybody knows about, from a to z. But only a minority knows about blessing bees, competitions to recall appropriate blessings, from man to God.

title: Ill Juror Delays Kapp Testimony
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 2The second day of Joe Kapp's antitrust trial against the National Football League was consumed by choosing a juror to replace one who had become ill, and a threehour opening statement by one of Kapp's attorneys, Charles Hanger.

title: Giants Purchased By Lurie, Herseth
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 2 (AP)The National League owners approved sale of the San Francisco Giants today to Robert Lurie and a surprise partner, Bud Herseth of Phoenix, Ariz., who will keep the franchise in San Francisco

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: First Democrat Since 1870 Elected in Upstate District
description: OLEAN, N.Y., March 2 (AP) Mayor Stanley Lundine of Jamestown was elected Representative from New York State's 39th Congressional District tonight, the first Democrat to be sent to Congress from this Southern Tier region in 106 years.

title: Publisher Quits Weekend Sports
description: Garey Symington, publisher of Weekend Sports magazine for about a month, quit yesterday charging the comspany with gross misrepresentation.

title: AMEX STOCKS UP; INDEX ADDS 0.56
description: Advances led declines by a comfortable margin yeaterday in moderate trading on the American Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market.

title: Cure for HouSing Ills
description: Mayor Beanie has recommended that a compliant City Council extend without change New York's creaky rentcontrol law, with all its manifest inequities.

title: Pact in Eastchester Ends 6Week Teachers Strike
description: EASTCHESTER, N.Y., March 2A sixweek teachers strike, one of the longest in state history, ended here today after teachers ratified a threeyear contract with the Board of Education.

title: New Political Universe
description: BOSTON, March 2The returns from Massachusetts vote tonight showed bow much the Democratic political universe had changed in just four years.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Concert: Staffan Scheja
description: Talented young pianists nowadays spend precious years trying their luck on the international contest circuit, where a brilliant technique is the first, and, too often, the only, ingredient of success. Some contest veterans take longer than others to get beyond this phase, but unless a pianist can put it behind him his career can soon become a dazzling bore.

title: For Every Akoholic, Three or Four Others Are Direct Victims Who Need Help
description: This excerpt from a letter written recently to President Ford by a young girl was read at a conference entitled Our Nation's Drinking Problem: Its Impact on Society, held by the National Council of Women in the United States.

title: GUN CONTROL BILL PUT ON THE SHELF
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 The House Judiciary Committee voted today to return its gun control bill to subcommittee for revisions  a move that will probably kill any chance of firearms control in this Congress.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Highway deaths in 1975 declined to the lowest level in 13 years, figures compiled by the State Department of Motor Vehicles showed. A report made public yesterday by the Governor's office showed that 2,487 persons died in traffic accidents last year, compared with 2,664 in 1974a decrease of 6.6 percent. The rate of deaths per 100 million miles traveled was 3.8, down from 4.1 the previous year, the report said.

title: BANK OF AMERICA EXPANDS REPORT
description: The BankAmerica Corporation, which recently announced plans for greater voluntary disclosure of financial results, released its annual report yesterday. The company said the report has more information than its predecessors.

title: U.S. Ends Firestone And Goodyear Suits
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The Justice Department today dropped lawsuits intended to break up the Goodyear and Firestone tire companies after officials concluded they could not prove charges of an at tempted illegal monopoly.

title: Miss Hearst Disputed
description: Patricia Hearst's testimony that she had participated in a bank robbery without knowing if her gup was loaded or in working condition was contradicted by an electronics technician. Page 73.

title: Mayor and Mouse Open One Times Square
description: Mayor Beanie, three leading songwriters and Mickey Mouse joined in a celebration yesterday of the opening of the former Allied Chemical Tower on Times ???.

title: Israeli, in Mexico, Notes An Accord, Some Regrets
description: MEXICO CITY, March 2Foreign Minister Vigal Allon of Israel said today that he felt certain Mexico no longer equated Zionism with racism, but he regretted that the Mexican Government had authorized the Palestine Liberation Organization to open an information office here.

title: Cash Prices
description: Tuesday, March 2, 1976

title: Rhodesia: Last Chance?
description: On every occasion when major upheavals elsewhere in southern Africa have underscored the perilous situation of Rhodesia's white minority Government, Prime Minister Ian Smith has abruptly switched from diehard defiance to tactical flexibility. But each time, when put to the test of realistic negotiations looking toward majority rule in his country where blacks outnumber whites by 24 to 1, Mr. Smith has backed off, often with an assertion that there will be no black Government in Rhodesia in his lifetime.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Italian Warns U.S. Not to Ignore Bid For Lockheed Data
description: ROME, March 2A senior cabinet member warned today that relations between Italy and the United States could be jeopardized if the American, Government refused to comply with Italy's request for information regarding recent bribery allegations.

title: Radio
description: 67:25 A.M., WNYCFM. Hebrides Overture, Mendelssohn; Water Music Suite, Handel; Piano Concerto No. 2, Weber; Symphony in G, Wanski.

title: JOBLESSNESS IS UP T0 122% IN CITY
description: The city's economy weaxenea considerably in January as unemployment rose from 11.5 to 12.2 percent, the highest level since World War II, and the number of jobs fell to the lowest January levels since 1950, the State Labor Department reported yesterday.

title: GUN CONTROL BILL PUT ON THE SHELE
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 The House Judiciary Committee voted today to return its gun control bill to subcommittee for revisions  a move that will probably kill arty chance of firearms control in this Congress.

title: New Welfare Chief
description: Of all the city's many mismanaged agencies, none compares in inefficiency with the Human Resources Administration. By any yardstick of waste or confusion, it is a disaster areaat colossal cost in Federal, state and municipal funds.

title: The Annual Medical Agony
description: The Bethesda, Md., campus of the National Institutes of Health lacks only one facility to help mankind cure disease: an official lamentation center to which whitecoated researchers and welltailored lobbyists can return each spring when the President's budget comes out.

title: U.S. Ends Firestone And Goodyear Suits
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The Justice Department today dropped lawsuits intended to break up the Goodyear and Firestobe tire companies after officials concluded they could not prove charges of an attempted illegal monopoly.

title: Track Coach to Retire
description: HOUSTON, March 2 (AP) Johnny Morriss said today he planned to retire at the end of the season after 22 years as head track coach at the University of Houston.

title: STALEY WILL BUY 4 SWIFT PLANTS
description: The A. E. Staley Manufacturing Company said yesterday in Decatur. Ill., that it had agreed to purchase four soybean processing plants from Swift & Comoanv, a subsidiary of Esmark Inc., for about $65 million. They are at Fostoria, Ohio; Champaign, Ill.; Frankfort, Ind., and Des Moines. Staley operates a soybean processing plant and soybean oil refinery at Decatur.

title: Japanese, Too, Are Dreaming Of a Little House With a Garden
description: MARBORI SHII HAITSU, Japan, Feb. 27The houses are new and clean and arranged in tidy rows. Toppled tricycles lie strewn about. Cars are washed in driveways next to wellkept lawns and flower gardens behind frontyard fences.

title: Levine Buys Film Rights To William Goldman Novel
description: Motion picture rights to Magic, a forthcoming novel by William Goldman, have been acquired by Joseph E. Levine, who reported yesterday that he had paid $1 million for them.

title: BACTERIA VIEWED AS POWER SOURCE
description: The progress made in understanding how some bacteria convert sunlight into chemical energy without help from chlorophyll has been sufficent to encourage hope that the process may eventually be used as a power source.

title: ENERGY DATA UNIT URGED IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, March 2Several Democratic senators, questioning the reliability of the Federal Energy Administration, want to create an independent energy statistics agency that would be an arm of Congress outside the executive branch.

title: Red Smith
description: By granting a parole to George M. Steinbrenner 3d, Bowie Kuhn has shown once again what scholars knew all alongthat baseball's supreme being is not only allwise but also allmerciful. After all, this is not the high commissioner's first display of lenience. When he learned that Denny McLain was moonlighting as a bookmaker, he excused it as an aberration and suspended the pitcher for only that half of the season for which Denny had already drawn his pay, and later he forgave McLain for toting a handgun around the American League, for stiffing 86 creditors for $400,000 and even for pouring ice water down the necks of Watson Spoelstra and Jim Hawkins, Detroit sports writers. Clemency is all the rage these days among men in authority, and although Bowie didn't give Steinbrenner a full pardon he did follow Judge John Sirica's example and shortened the sentence.

title: Fiscal Policy Appraised
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The long Congressional hearings on the state of the economy and the appropriate Government policies for dealing with it are now almost at anend, and a conclusion of sorts has emerged. This conclusion is that President Ford's fiscal policy spending, revenue and the deficit for the fiscal year 1977 is needlessly, perhaps dangerously, restrictive, particularly as it applies to next year, despite a deficit of $43 billion.

title: Young Germans Worried By Shortage of Colleges
description: BONN, March 2Difficulties at school drove a 12yearold student to his death in Grobenzell, the report buried inside the Silddeutsche Zeitung began. He hanged himself with a belt from the curtain rods in his room. The student, who was on the average satisfactory, had had difficulty with English recently and had been scolded by Ihis mother.

title: Market Place
description: The exceptionally strong stock market this year appears to have surprised many major institutional investors.

title: Castro And the Election
description: WASHINGTON, March 2  Fidel Castro has always been fascinated by U. S. Presidential politicsparticularly by the role of the Kennedys and their personal sorrows and political ambitionsand either consciously or unconsciously, he may play a decisive role in the Florida primary election.

title: Women Take Happily to Selling Real Estate
description: The Metropolitan Life Insurance Company had two women agents in 1883. New York Life Insurance appointed its first one in 1889.

title: Rare Show of Johann Liss's Art
description: CLEVELANDWhat might be called a connoisseur's exhibitionof great interest to specialists in the field, but difficult (if not impossible) for the public to grasp and enjoyhas become a rarity in American art museums.

title: Leading Seoul Dissidents Ask Resignation of President Park
description: SEOUL, South Korea, March 2A group of South Korea's most prominent political dissidents have issued a statement here asking the Government to rescind the emergency decree and restore all political (freedoms that have been restricted under the 1972 Constitution.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: WASHINGTON, March 2A multimillion dollar advertising campaign to induce consumers to eat more eggs is about to be hatched.

title: BRIG. GEN.S.G. CONLEY
description: Brig. Gen. Samuel G. Conley, who commanded the 274th Infantry Combat Team of the 70th Division in the final offensive in Germany in World War II, died Thursday in Seattle, where he was living. He was 77 years old.

title: Jackson Lays Result to Coalition
description: BOSTON, Wednesday, March 34When Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington said he Was going to Win in the crowded Massachusetts Democratic Presidential primary election, a lot of people laughed.

title: IMMUNITY UPHELD FOR PROSECUTORS
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (AP) The Supreme Court said today that state prosecutors were immune from civil damage suits even if they deliberately violated the civil rights of defendants.

title: RESCUE IS NEAR FOR STATE UNITS
description: ALBANY, March 2Governor Carey's office said toddy that it had nearly completed a longgawaited $2.6 billion package of financing arrangements to rescue the state construction ??? from economic collapse.

title: Subpoena Dropped
description: The office of Maurice H. Nadjari, the Special State Prosecutor, has withdrawn a subpoena seeking the appearance of Civil Court Judge Anthony J. Mercorella before a special Manhattan grand jury investigating allegations of corruption is the State Liquor Authority and the Alcoholic Beverage Control Board. Page 41.

title: GOLD
description: ??? world gold ??? Tuesday. London: Morning fixing $131.53, down ??? afternoon fixing 5131.40, down $0.90.

title: Prices Finish Near Day's Best Level Volume Rises
description: Stock prices moved up steadily yesterday, closing near their best levels of the session on a pickup in trading volume.

title: As Blacks Train Near Border, Whites In Rhodesia Say It Can't Happen Here
description: UMTALI, RHODESIA, March 1This Rhodesian town nestled among some of the greenest hills of Africa on the border with Mozambique has plenty to worry about.

title: FORD TOPS REAGAN
description: BOSTON, Wednesday, March 3Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington won the Massachusetts Democratic primary yesterday as voters went to the polls in relatively light numbers amid snow, sleet and cold.

title: Troubled lran Celebrates Reign of Shah's Father
description: TEHERAN. Iran, March 2Stung by criticism, shaken by scandals, short of funds, Iran's leadership is taking solace in playing up the achievements of the previous Shah, known here as Riza Shah the Great.

title: Unilever Profit Is Up in Quarter but Off for Year
description: The Unilever Group, one of the world's 10 largest industrial enterprises; continued its sharp recovery in fourth  quarter earnings, but the annual net was down 20.6 percent from the 1974 profit, the company said yesterday.

title: Notes on People
description: A sudden and imminent fall of the West would not much surprise Aleksandr Solzhenitsyncertainly not as much as would a change of regime in the Soviet Union, the novelist said in London during a BBC interview marking the second anniversary of his exile. Tyranny in his homeland has been strengthened by the fact that the West has given up all its world positionsthe speed of your capitulations has rapidly overtaken the pace of our moral regeneration, he said. Mr. Solzhenitsyn's speculations were particularly gloomy concerning prospects for peace. The Soviet Union's economy is on such a war footing that even if it were the unanimous opinion of all members of the Politburo not to start a war, this would no longer be in their power.

title: AFRICAN REBELS HINT AT CUBA BID
description: WASHINGTON, March 2A spokesman for nationalist guerrillas fighting white minority rule of SouthWest Africa says that his group is prepared to invite Cuban forces to help it.

title: A Bicentennial Boon for Soccer
description: In this Bicentennial year the United States will battle England againin soccer.

title: Deputy Sheriff Killed In Courthouse Explosion
description: POINT PLEASANT; W. Va., March 2 (AP)A deputy sheriff was killed and 12 other persons were injured, two critically, when an explosion ripped through the Mason County Courthouse and jail late today, the adthorities said.

title: BILLS SEEK TO GIVE CHECK PRIVILEGES TO SAVINGS BANKS
description: ALBANY, March 2 The State tanking Department today asked the Legislature to give checkingaccount privileges to the state's savings banks. Unless legislative action is taken, the banks will have to close 165,000 socalled now accounts under a court order on March 31.

title: United States, Pusher
description: The arms race between the United States and the Soviet Union accounts for 60 percent of the world's military expenditures, which are now pushing $300 billion a year; but the other 40 percent may prove to be more dangerous.

title: Partial Decontrol
description: It is naive to consider rent administration alone responsible for housing decay and disinvestment; nor will move toward simplification and phaseout alone engender housing revitalization. But it is not possible to conceive of an upturn, particularly for the bestlocated units the older housing stock, unless incentives are restored.

title: Long Island Shippers Face a 30% Rate Rise With Advent of Conrail
description: A month before the absorption tion of the bankrupt Northeast) Railroads into the quasiFederal Consolidated Rail Corporation, the new carrier has already confronted Long Island shippers with a 30 percent increase in freight rates.

title: Japanese, Too, Are Dreaming Of a Little House With a Garden
description: MARBORI SHII HAITSU Japan, Feb. 27The houses are new and clean and arranged in tidy rows. Toppled tricycles lie strewn about. Cars are washed in driveways next to wellkept lawns and flower gardens behind frontyard fences.

title: Jail Sentences Commuted For 8 Teachers in Strike
description: ALBANY, March 2, (AP)Governor Carey today commuted the sentences of eight Orchard Park schoolteachers serving 30day jail terms because of a strike against that Erie County school district.

title: Sweeping Inquiry Planned In House Spy Report Leak
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The House Ethics committee requested $350,000 today to pay for its investigation of the leaking of the Pike intelligence report. It prepared to hire a staff of about 20 outside consultants headed by a former inspector of the Federal Bureau of Investigaion to conduct the detective and legal work.

title: TIMES POLL SAMPLED 1,097 IN BAY STATE
description: The New York Times/CBS News poll is based on interviews with a random sampling of Massachusetts voters as they left the polls yesterday. Fifteen voting precincts throughout the state were selected and, within each precinct, each voter had an equal chance of selection.

title: ED PRICE, COACHED FOOTBALL AT TEXAS
description: Ed Price, former football coach at the University of Texas, died Monday at his home in Austin, Tex. He was 67 years old.

title: High Court Limits Press's Protection Against Libel Suits
description: WASHINGTON, March 2A divided Supreme Court cut back today on the broad protection that the Court, on First Amendment grounds, has given the press against libel suits brought by socalled public figures.

title: Going out Guide
description: COME CLOSER Downtown workers aware of many cultural and entertainment events in lower Manhattan but wanting specifics might approach that new doubledecker, opentopped English bus, hung with colorful banners and stocked with information. Starting today, during the lunchtime period the bus will be parked at a different site, ranging from City Hall to the World Trade Center, Wall Street and moving down to the South Street Seaport and Battery Park; all on weekdays, with the schedule repeated every two weeks. The idea is for the vehicle to serve as a central information outlet and to remind downtowners of the rich variety of diversions.

title: Pentagon Is Accused of Selling Plane to NATO Too Cheaply
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The Defense Department ran into objections today that it was proposing to sell a controversial radar command plane to European allies at a bargain basement prite.

title: U.S. Apparently Steps Up Move on Corporate Gifts
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The Securities and Exchange Commission has apparently intensified its campaign against wrongdoing by suing a company that failed to disclose a relatively small fund for political contributions. The commission, in moving late last week against the Missouri Public Service Company, sought to emphasize its view thateven what might be considered nonmaterial amounts to a multimilliondollar corporation must be reported.

title: JOBLESSNESS IS UP TO 12.2% IN CITY
description: The city's economy weakened considerably in January as unemployment rose from 11.5 to 12.2 percent, the highest level since World War II, and the number of jobs fell to the lowest January levels since 1950, the State Labor Department reported yesterday.

title: Opposition Is Reported On City U. Entry Plans
description: Members of the Board of Higher Education reportedly have expressed misgivings about new admissions standards proposed for the City University by Robert J. Kibbee, the Chancellor, that would emphasize high school academic performance.

title: Hofstra, Temple Victors
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., March 2Hofstra, the team that almost everybody forgot took a step toward qualifying for the National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament tonight by defeating Bucknell, 7758, in the opening round of the East Coast Conference playoffs.

title: Cost of Fishing Ban On Hudson Is Called Much Exaggerated
description: ALBANY, March 2John S. Dyson, the state's combative Commissioner of Commerce, renewed his running battle today with Ogden R. Reid, the Commissioner of Environmental Conservation, charging that Mr. Reid had overstated the financial loss of the closing last week of the Hudson River to commercial fishing.

title: Nadjari Rescinds Mercorella's Subpoena
description: The office of Maurice H. Nadjari, the Special State Prosecutor, has quietly withdrawn a subpoena seeking the appearance of Civil Court Judge Anthony J. Mercorella before a special Manhattan grand jury investigating allegations of corruption in the State Liquor Authority and the Alcoholic Beverage Control Board.

title: UConn Tops Fairfield
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., March 2 (AP)Joe Whelton sank two free throws with five seconds left for a 7270 victory by the University of Connecticut over Fairfield tonight that ended the Huskies regular season at 169 and Fairfield's at 1214.

title: 2D BOND EXCHANGE WEIGHED BY M.A.C.
description: The Municipal Assistance Corporation is thinking about making a second offer to exchange its bonds for city notes that were placed under a moratorium last fall.

title: Paris Hospital Strike Ends
description: PARIS, March 2Employees of the American Hospital of Paris ended a monthlong strike today over announced staff cutbacks in their numbers. Resumption of work followed a promise by management to sit down to Mid a solution to the problem acceptable to both sides.

title: A RICESOY BLEND FOR THE POOR SET
description: A new blend of rice and soy protein containing the highest quality protein now available will soon be marketed worldwide by two American food companies, Nabisco Inc. and Riviana Foods Inc.

title: Obituary 5  No Title
description: Obituary 5 No Title

title: Arrest of Scotland Yard Officers Again Puts Chief in Public's Eye
description: LONDON, March 2The recent arrest of a dozen senior Scotland Yard detectives on charges of taking bribesthe largest such arrest here in many yearshas once again focused public attention on this city's innovative, elegant, tough and controversial police chief, Sir Robert Mark.

title: Miriam Urdang, Professor Of Education at Queens. 57
description: Miriam E. Urdang, associate professor of education at Queens College, died Monday at Lenox Hill Hospital. She was 57 years old and lived at 50 King Street.

title: When It Comes to Being Chintzy, This Family Doesn't Mean Slipcovers
description: OLD GREENWICH, Conn.An orange and yellow Master Charge sign glows in a front window of Beverly and Walter. Mathews's house here on Rocky Point Road.

title: Updating Cashmeres
description: After summer comes fall and Chester Weinberg already has some ideas about how women should get themselves together for that time. Men too, for that matter.

title: Dividends
description: Dividends

title: STRIKE IS AVERTED AT NURSING HOME
description: The nursinghome union and the Metropolitan New York Nursing Home Association reached agreement last night in their wage dispute and averted a strike threatened for today against 91 nursing homes in the city.

title: State Department Denies Reagan Assertion on Canal
description: WASHINGTON, March (UPI)The State Department described as completely untrue today a charge by Ronald Reagan that it had secretly agreed to turn the Panama Canal over to Panama.

title: Business Briefs
description: The financially troubled IDS Realty Trust, a Minnesotabased real estate investment trust, said yesterday that one of its bank creditors, the First National Bank of St. Paul, had demanded immediate payment of a note in the amount of $10 million. The trust said it would not pay the note and if the bank insisted that it, the trust, might seek the protection of bankruptcy courts.

title: People in Sports
description: Fred Lynn, the Boston Red Sox outfielder who won both the rookieoftheyear and mostvaluableplayer awards last season, is dickering for a threeyear contract valued at $1.3 million.

title: Food Prices Here Drop
description: The cost of feeding a family of four in New York City dropped 1.2 percent last week, falling 88 cents as a result of special sales of meat and eggs in many food stores, the City Department of Consumer Affairs reported yesterday.

title: U.S. IS TOLD TO CALL LEAD A POLLUTANT
description: A Federal judge has ordered the Environmental Protection Agency to list lead as a pollutant with adverse effect on public health under provisions of the 1970 Clean Air Act.

title: NIXON WILL FILE REPORT ON CHINA
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The White House disclosed today that former President Rich??? M. Nixon planned to file a written report with the State Department on the substance of his eightday visit to China.

title: Dolly Dawn, Singer Of Swing, Adopts A Different Style
description: When a collection of recordings made by George Hall's Orchestra in the 1930's was reissued a year ago as part of the new Bluebird reissue series, the most provocative point of the album was the revelation that Dolly Dawn, who sang with the band, was a much better singer than she had been credited as being at the time. As a result of this reissue, Miss Dawn, whose career continued into the 1950's, began a tentative series of moves back into activity that have culminated at the Cookery, University Place at Eighth Street, where she will be appearing for several months with Marty Napoleon on piano and Bucky Calabrese on bass.

title: About Real Estate
description: The venerable institution that sells pretzels on the corner of 14th Street at Union Square, just outside the now closed S. Klein department store, calls herself Ida, the Pretzel Lady.

title: A Plethora Of Pots
description: Pots, pots, millions of potsby neophytes, imaginative amateurs, competent professionals and all manner of experimenters. One can find such ceramic creations in virtually any nook or cranny that hangs up a sign and calls itself a crafts shop.

title: An Array of Tantalizing Ways to Load the Traditional Herring Table (Cont'd)
description: SHARP SAUCE

title: Basketball AllAmerica
description: FIRST TEAM

title: CORRECTION
description: The Notes on People column in yesterday's New York Times reported incorrectly that the annual Frederick Douglass Awards are sponsored by the National Urban League. The awards are sponsored by the New York Urban League.

title: Carey Urges Neighbors Not to Downgrade New York
description: In the name of regional selfinterest, Governor Carey yesterday urged Connecticut and New Jersey not to seek new businesses by criticizing New York so that the three states were reduced to pulling the bread from each other's mouths.

title: Adjusting to Europe
description: What kind of Western Europe will emerge in the 1980's? What kind of a role will the United States play there? What kind of social and political entity will emerge from the changes taking place? Some of the changes are visible, like those in Portugal and Spain, and some are more subtle and more speculative, like those in France and Italy. Some have already occurred, like those in Scandinavia, where the absence of outside danger has made possible the luxury of ambitious social reforms.

title: Quarantine Put on Commune
description: VIOLA, W. Va., March 2 (UPI)A Hare Krishna reIligious cult commune was placed under strict quarantine by state officials today because of a hepatitis outbreak that caused the death of a college professor and illness to several other persons. The commune is on a 1,000acre site in Marshall County in the state's northern panhandle. The death of Dr. Kenneth M. Plummer of West Virginia Wesleyan College was attributed to the discase.

title: Environmental Groups Ask Ban On Uranium Shipment to India
description: WASHINGTON, March 2Three environmental groups asked the Nuclear Regulatory Commission today to bar the export of 40,000 pounds of uranium to India on the ground that this shipment would be inimical to the interests of the United States and could endanger the health and safety of the public.

title: WINE TALK
description: Events take place so fast in the California wine country that often it can be difficult to keep pace. First, prices were climbing up and up. That was three or four years ago, when wine drinkers around the country first began to discover what many Californians had known for years: that the state's best wineries could produce extraordinary wines.

title: Carter Winsin in Vermont
description: Jimmy Carter won the Democratic Presidential primary in Vermont yesterday, with almost half the votes in a fivecandidate race. President Ford was the only Republican on the ballot, with Ronald Reagan receiving a writein from about one G.O.P. voter in five. Page 17.

title: Driver Is Killed as Truck Strikes Bus on Turnpike
description: RIDGEFIELD PARK, March 2 One person was killed and 18 injured this morning when a tractor trailer, out of control after avoiding an unidentified vehicle that cut into its path, slammed into the side of a Manhattanbound commuter bus at the northern end of the New Jersey Turnpike.

title: INJURY IS RULED IN FLATWARE CASE
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The International Trade Commission ruled by a 51 vote late last night that the domestic industry producing stainless steel flatware was being injured by competition from imports, but one again the commission failed to agree on remedy.

title: Role of Cuban Soldier in Angola
description: The Soviet Union has used Cuban troops in Africa and the Middle East basically because they have a high level of training for combat in third world environments familiarity with Soviet weapons, physical toughness and a tradition of successful guerrilla warfare. According to United States military and political analysts, the relatively small Cuban Army of about 90,000 men must now be considered a possible source of other Communist expeditionary forces in climatic, geographical and military situations similar to that in Angola.

title: UNIONWORKERSTALK AT STEVENS MEETING
description: The Textile Workers Union which for 12 years has been trying to organize the plants of J. P. Stevens & Company, the country's second largest textile manufacturer, yesterday sent a delegation of workers holding 11 common shares of Stevens stock to the company'l annual meeting here.

title: William Van Dusen Dies at 74; ExOfficial at Eastern Air Lines
description: William Van Dusen, vice president of public relations for Eastern Air Lines for 14 years until he retired in 1965, died yesterday in a Miami hospital. tie was 74 years old and lived in Coral Gables, Fla.

title: BusTruck Crash
description: A tractortrailer driver was killed and 18 bus riders were injured in Ridgefield Park, N. J., yesterday morning when the truck, out of control after avoiding an unidentified vehicle that cut into its path, slammed into the side of a Manhattanbound commuter bus near the Interstate 80 interchange of the New Jersey Turnpike, Page 41.

title: Byrne Asks Backing For Bills to Spend Fiscal 76 Surplus
description: TRENTON, March 2Governor Byrne urged the Assembly today to approve bills that would provide $16.5 million in onetime payments to state workers and $3.6 million for a continuation of essential services to Medicaid recipients.

title: Bergen Catholic Awaits Place in Scholastic League
description: ORADELL, March 2A 10year struggle by Bergen Catholic High School to gain membership in the Northern New Jersey Interscholastic Leaguea struggle involving civil rights, the energy crisis and rising school taxesmay be near climax.

title: Aussie Cup Tennis Shifted to June 20
description: BRISBANE, Australia, March 2 (AP)A heavy rain and windstorm washed out play today in the Davis Cup Eastern Zone tennis final, with Australia leading New Zealand 21 and two singles matches left.

title: Gazzara Wins Special Vote For State Senate in Queens
description: State Assemblyman Anthony V. Gazzara, Democrat of Queens, yesterday won a special election for State Senator from the 14th District, defeating Frank A. LaPina, his RepublicanConservative opponent.

title: U.S. Acts on Angola
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (Reulers)The State Department announced formally today it had ended its embargo on com mercial shipments to Angola hut insisted that it was not prepared to extend diplomatic recognition to the new Luanda Government.

title: Dixon Is Confirmed
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (AP) The Senate confirmed today George H, Dixon of Minnesota as Deputy Secretary of the Treasury.

title: Events Today
description: Events Today

title: Foreign Exchange
description: Foreign Exchange

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Both sides in a threatened strike by Transport of New Jersey bus drivers resumed their efforts yesterday to reach a contract settlement to avert a walkout. An official of the Amalgamated Transit Union said a meeting was planned between union negotiators and bargainers for the company, which serves 450,000 riders daily in 20 of New Jersey's 21 counties.

title: Zamblans Urged to Prepare
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, March 2 (AP)  The Times of Zambia, owned by Zambia's governing party, calle don the nation today to prepare for war following recent Rhodesian hot put. suit incursions into Mozambique.

title: It Was June in February And Busting Out All Over
description: The roughwinged swallow has been seen in Cold Spring Harbor, ForSter's tern is back at Fire Island, and the Chardonnay grape vines are budding in vineyards near Newburgh. Spring has not just arrived, it has barged in unannounced.

title: Estimate Board to Rule on Easing of Tax Allowing Commodore Transformation
description: The first venture under the city's new taxabatement program to stimulate business investment in New Yorka $100 million proposal for converting the aging Commodore Hotel into a new, glassfaced Regency Hyatt convention hotelwill be submitted for approval to the Board of Estimate tomorrow by the city's Economic Development Administration.

title: About New York
description: Sanford D. Garelik was in his office, surrounded by charts. They were red, orange and blue, and more or less unintelligible unless you knew how to read them. Mr. Garelik knew how to read them, and so he was smiling. When Mr. Garelik was president of the City Council he hardly ever smiled, and sometimes he seemed sunken in gloom, as if City Hall were a sepulcher and he wanted to say Kaddish. Now Mr. Garelik is once again a cop. He smiles.

title: Sir Thomas Spencer Is Dead; Telecommunications Executive
description: Sir Thomas George Spencer, a retired British telecommunications executive, died Sunday in London. He was 88 years old.

title: What the Tie Rack Business Needs Is Someone Like Rube Goldberg
description: If a quick inspection of some of the city's better known stores is a valid guide, manwho can fly to the moon and smash atomsruns out of smarts when it comes to tie racks.

title: Russians Leading Skating
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, March 2 (AP)The Soviet Union's Olympic pairs champions, Irina Rodnina and Aleksandr Zaitsev, turned in a nearflawless performance in the short program today in pursuit of their fourth title in the world figure skating championships.

title: Carter Leads Wallace in the South, Poll Indicates
description: ATLANTA, March 2A public opinion poll conducted in seven Southern states and released here today indicates that former Georgia Gov. Jimmy Carter has overtaken Alabama Gov. George C. Wallace in popularity in this area.

title: Melissa Hayden fo Quit Skidmore in a Dispute
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS. N.Y., March 2 (AP)Melissa Hayden, the retired prima ballerina, is resigning her artistinresidence position at Skidmore College in a dispute over college policy, said Donald Coleman, her husband.

title: Loughlin Wins Track
description: John Dowicyan of Sacred Heart in Yonkers won the halfmile with a time of 1 minute 57.3 seconds and Bishop Loughlin retained the team title Monday in the Christian Brothers scholastic indoor track and field championships at the 102d Engineers Armory.

title: Recital
description: Witold Malcuzynski made his New York debut in 1942 and appeared here with a fair frequency thereafter. But in recent years his performances here have dropped off radically: There was a nineyear gap between 1963 and 1972, and a threeyear break between 1973 and Monday night at Carnegie Hall.

title: Giscard: I Bicentennial Tourist
description: PARIS  When France's President Valery Giscard d'Estaing visits the United States next May it will by no means be the first time he comes to Americanor, for that matter, the first time the family name is heard in our country. A collateral ancestor, Count Charles d'Estaing, commanded the first French expedition supporting the Thirteen Colonies in their revolution against Britain.

title: Labor Federation Gains Accord On Revised Compensation Plan
description: ALBANY, March 2  The State Labor Federation disclosed today that it had reached agreement with representatives of the state's industries and insurance companies on a revision of workmen's compensation that would increase the maximum benefit from $125 to $215 a week.

title: Some Armenian Dishes
description: PRIEST'S SOUP (Vartabedi Aboor)

title: Juan Carlos Warns He'd Invoke Powers In Spanish Unrest
description: MADRID, March 2 King Juan Carlos indicated tonight that he was prepared to assume special powers so that the profound reforms that the country requires could be carried out.

title: Lona Drops Finale
description: NEW ROCHELLE, March 2 (AP)Bill Lynn scored 27 points to pace Georgetown to a 7668 victory over Iona, which closed out the season with a 1016 mark.

title: 25 Years Ago All Hailed Columbia Five.(210) as Toast of Town
description: Tom Powers, president of a spring manufacturing company in Cincinnati, said I thought everybody forgot about us.

title: About Education
description: Many students seem to be reasoning that if jobs are scarce only the bestqualified are going to find it easy to be hired. Thus, the tight job market is helping to create a booming demand for admission to graduate schools of business.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: Obituary 4 No Title

title: Theater: Lemon Sky
description: For seven years, the T. Schreiber Studio, an Off Off Broadway company under the direction of Terry Schreiber, has been quietly putting on plays and attracting audiences. The company received recognition early this season with a new play, John Bishop's The Trip Back Down (optioned for Broadway).

title: Petition Bids U.S. Change Ignition Lock Standards
description: The Massachusetts Consumers Council has filed a petition with the Federal Department of Transportation in an effort to improve the standards for automobile ignition locks. Doris Pote, the chairman of the council, called the present ignition lock standards a dismal failure and a major factor in the state's high theft rate  more than three times the national average.

title: Carter Winsinvermont
description: Jimmy Carter won the Democratic Presidential primary in Vermont yesterday, with almost half the votes in a fivecandidate race. President Ford was the only Republican on the ballot, with Ronald Reagan receiving a writein from about one G.O.P. voter in six. Page 17.

title: Federal Funds Rate Is Pushed Below the 5% Level
description: The Government securities market, which had been falling since Friday afternoon, rebounded late yesterday after the Federal Reserve helped push the Federal funds rate  thebasic interest rate in the money market  back down below 5 percent. The Treasury helped the recovery by announcing that it would borrow no additional money in Monday's $6.1 billion, sale of bills.

title: Seattle Victor by 109105
description: Almost as if someone had given a command to halt, the Knicks offense stopped last night in the fourth quarter.

title: New Move for First Boston
description: The investment banking firm of the First Boston Corporation said yesterday that, subject to stockholders approval at the annual meeting April 21, the First Boston Corporation would become a subsidiary of a newly formed holding company to be known as First Boston Inc. A spogesman said the holding company would give the firm greater flexibility and added that there were no present plans for acquisitions or any extension of its activities into areas not related to its present business.

title: CORRECTION
description: The Notes on People column in yesterday's New York Times reported incorrectly that the annual Frederick Douglass Awards are sponsored by the National Urban League. The awards are sponsored by the New York Urban League.

title: Mahovlich Hits 600Goal Mark
description: TORONTO, March 2 (UPI) Frank Mahovlich netted two to become only the third major league hockey player to pass the 600goal plateau tonight as the Toronto Toros beat the Quebec Nordiques, 52, in the World Hockey Association.

title: Bridge:
description: Thousands of teams throughout North America are gradually being eliminated in the Grand National teams, the only grassroots event starting at the club level and ending with a national title. In New York, eight teams survive, and the eventual winner will play for the zonal title, competing with the New England champions and the winners of a heterogeneous area including New Jersey, North Jersey, Westchester, the Hudson Valley and Albany.

title: Albany Briefly Revives NameontheBallot Bill
description: ALBANY, March 2  A bill to put the names of presidential aspirants on primary ballots, which most observers thought had been the victim of partisan politics last week, was briefly resuscitated today, apparently only to be victimized again.

title: Obituary 6  No Title
description: Obituary 6 No Title

title: Secret U.S. Pacts Reported by Sadal
description: WASHINGTON, March 2President Anwar elSadat of Egypt claims that as part of last September's Sinai accord with Israel he concluded secret agreements in which the United States pledged that Israel would not attack Syria and that every effort would be made to insure Palestinian participation in a Middle East settlement.

title: DAVID KAPP DIES; RECORDS LEADER
description: David Kapp, a retired recording industry executive and an originator of cast albums for Broadway musicals, died Monday at Doctors Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived at 45 Sutton Place South.

title: Miss Hearst Disputed
description: Patricia Hearses testimony that she had participated in a bank robbery without knowing if her gun was loaded or in working condition was contradicted by an electronics technician Page 73.

title: Black Lung Aid Is Voted In House for Coal Miners
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The Democratic majority in the House of Representatives overrode Republican objections today and passed a liberalization of workmen's compensation benefits for coal miners exposed to lungdamaging dust.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Feb. 13 editorial and Feb. 15 amplification on the Federal judges pay suit is welcome. The dollar has been mere fiat money since 1971; it has been devalued twice and permitted to depreciate along with other currencies. Monetary nominalism, the idea that the dollar is always a dollar or an arbitrary constant, has little place in sensible discussions of this problem.

title: BRIBE REQUESTS IN HAM ALLEGED
description: WASHINGTON, March 2Executives of a Dallas real estate development company told a Congressional subcommittee today that after they refused to pay bribes totaling $250,000 to Haitian officials they were forced to give up their initial $3 million investment in the development of a free port in Haiti.

title: CONSUMER GOODS A KREMLIN ISSUE
description: MOSCOW, March 2The upper echelons of the Communist Party are evidently at odds with some segments of the governmental bureaucracy over how much emphasis should be placed on producing consu mer goods.

title: Columbia Appoints Likins To Head Engineering School
description: Columbia University has appointed Peter W. Likins, an expert on the dynamics of spacecraft and urban vehicles, as dean of its School of Engineering and Applied Sciences.

title: Hugo Oalmar Jr., Chairman Of U.S. Polo Association
description: Hugo Dalmar Jr., chairman and former president of the United States Polo Association, died Sunday of cancer at a hospital in. Chicago. He was 49 years old and lived in Evanston.

title: High Court Limits Press's Protection Against Libel Suits
description: WASHINGTON, March 2A divided Supreme Court cut back today on the broad protection that the Court, on First Amendment grounds, has given the press against libel suits brought by socalled public figures.

title: Bubbling Brown Sugar Boils at ANTA
description: This really is the musical season for the golden oldies. Last night at the ANTA Theater, Bubbling Brown Sugar came to the boilafter a little warming upand although it purports to be a musical history of Harlem it is really rather a thin, but acceptable excuse for a bunmusical revue. Book by Loften Mitchell, based on a concept by Rosetta LeNoire; settings by Clarke Dunham; lighting by Barry Arnold; costumes by Bernard Johnson; prolections by Lucie D. Grosvenor and Clarke Dunham; sound by Joel S. Fichman; hair styles by Stanley James and Gene Sheppard; choral arrangements by Chapman Roberts; music and lyrics by Eubie Blake, Duke Ellington, Billie Holiday, Andy Razaf, Cab Calloway, Earl (Fatha) Hines, W. C. Handy, Noble Sissle, Thomas (Fats) Waller, Alexander Roberts and Bert Williams; musical direction by Danny ???; choreography and musical staging by Billy Wilson; directed by Robert M. Cooper; production stage manager, Sam Ellis. Presented by J. Lloyd Grant, Richard Bell, Robert M. Cooper, Ashton Springer, In association with Moe Septee Inc., the Media House Production. At the ANTA Theater, 52d street, west of Broadway.

title: Remembering Some Indomitable Black Women
description: WASHINGTON, March 2'Even black history hasn't given black women their proper place, Louise Hutchinson said. She is director of research for the Anacostia Neighborhood Museum, which has been trying to fill in the gaps.

title: Sweeping Inquiry Planned In House Spy Report Leak
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The House ethics committee requested $350,000 today to pay for its investigation of the leaking of the Pike intelligence report. It prepared to hire a staff of about 20 outside consultants headed by a former inspector of the Federal Bureau of Investigation to conduct the detective and legal work.

title: Unilever Quarter Gain
description: The Unilever Group's fourthquarter earnings climbed by 72.6 percent from the year before but the profit for all of 1975 was off 20.6 perecent. Page 55.

title: 3 RHODESIANS DIE IN GUERRILLA FIGHT
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, March 2 The Rhodesian military command announced here today that black guerrillas based In neighboring Mozambique crossed into eastern Rhodesia last Sunday and killed three members of an allblack paramilitary force.

title: New Political Universe
description: BOSTON, March 2The reurns from Massachusetts vote tonight showed how much the Democratic political universe had changed in just four years. of the apparent four top finishers in the state Analysis that was Senator George McGovern's best in 1972, only Representative Morris K. Udall of Arizona is a liberal. The others Senator Henry M. Jackson of. Washington, Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama and former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgiarange from moderate to conservative.

title: Oregonian, Deported in 1960 As Red, Returns From Finland
description: HELSINKI, Finland, March 2 (UPI)A Finnishborn resident of Oregon who was deported in 1960 on charges of subversion flew back home today with the formal status of a defector from Communism.

title: British Are Pessimistic
description: LONDON, March 2Foreign Secretary James Callaghan made a pessimistic report to the House of Commons today about the chances that Prime Minister Smith would accept an early transfer of power to the black majority.

title: Tanzania: An Emerging Nation Makes Strides Through Sports
description: Scarcity is the major fact of life for the poorer countries of Africa: the only thing they have plenty of is problems. The needs are so many and the resources so few that the development of sports programs seems, at first thought, almost frivolous.

title: Ilie Nastase Joins Millionaires Club
description: Ilie Nastase, who couldn't win a popularity contest, except in his native Rumania, has fought and downed his way into the exclusive tennis millionaires club. By trouncing. Ken Rosewall in the $320,000 Avis Challenge. Cup series in Hawaii, he joined Rosewall, Rod Laver, Jimmy Connors and Arthur Ashe as the players who had earned $1 million or more in the sport.

title: FORD SEEN NAMING LAIRD, CONNALLY
description: WASHINGTON, March 2President Ford is expected to name Melvin R. Laird, John ??? Connally and Leslie C. Arends, all powerful Republicans, to his Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board in a reorganization of the board and an expansion of Its membership.

title: Nationwide Survey Finds Retailers Lack Array of Merchandise Formerly Offered
description: In a trend that has become more pronounced in recent years, consumers across the nation are finding that stores do not have the merchandise depth or array for which they were known in the past.

title: Planning Parley Called Neglectful of Minorities
description: Representative Herman Badillo and Eleanor Holmes Norton, head of the city's Human Rights Commission, charged yesterday that a conference dealing with regional planning in the New YorkNew JerseyConnecticut area ignored issues and concerns facing urban minorities.

title: Paris: What Giscard Wants on Site of Les Halles
description: PARISEver since Valery Giscard d'Estaing, in one of his earliest presidential gestures, vetoed the construction of a hugeinternational commerce center on the site once occupied by Les Halles, it has been known that the future look of that privileged area in the heart of Paris would be shaped at Elysee Palace. We did not know, however, what that look would be.

title: Futures Prices Decline For Wheat and Sugar
description: The rains came to some of the winter wheat belt, including western Nebraska, eastern Colorado and northcentral Kansas. The precipitation, also consisting of some snow, was not the large amount needed by the droughtstricken fields, but the National Weather Serviceand some private forecasters predicted that more rain was on the way later this week.

title: WATER PANEL ASKS DELAY ON CONTROLS
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (AP)  The national Commission on Water Quality voted today to recommend a delay of five to 10 years in the 1983 requirement for the control of water pollution.

title: Township to Withhold Utility Payments
description: Hamilton Township last night became the latest community in the state to withhold payment of utility bills in protest against increasing gas and electric rates.

title: Dolmas, Kebabs and Pilaf With a Subtle Difference
description: In the steady stream of new cookbooks published each year, only a few stand out as being truly fascinating or exceptional. One newcomer in that rarefied category is Armenian Cooking Today, a labor of love written by Alice Antreassian as a fundraising effort for the Armenian Diocese of America.

title: 2D BOND EXCHANGE WEIGHED BY M.A.C.
description: The Municipal Assistance Corporation is thinking about making a second offer to exchange its bonds for city notes that were placed under a moratorium last fall

title: Undefeated Rutgers Helps Jersey Forget Its Worries
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., March 2  New Jerseyans were diverted today from rising prices, tax prbblems and crime statistics; they had an allwinning basketball team, which ended its regular season last night with a 26.0 wonlost record.

title: Obituary 7  No Title
description: Obituary 7 No Title

title: Musick for the Generall Peace, A Baroque Ensemble, in Debut
description: In 17thcentury England there was a quarterly called Musick for the Generall Peace, which printed sundry compositions of the period. Now Musick for the Generall Peace has emerged as a Bostonbased ensemble devoted to returning such works to currency on original Baroque instruments (or reconstructions thereof).

title: Advertising
description: How does this sound to you? You buy an hour's time on television for $50, do your own programming (or no programming) and then sell off as much of the hour as you want for commercials.

title: Wallace Pressing the Abortion Issue
description: MIAMI, March 2Campaigners for Gov. George C. Wallace are calling priests and bishops around Florida in an effort to attract a strong Roman Catholic vote in next Tuesday's Presidential primary.

title: Data Link Adverse Health Effects to Air Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, March 2New evidence suggesting that persons working in areas subject to severe air pollution may suffer adverse health effects has been obtained by members of a House committee drafting a cleanair bill.

title: Moscow vs. Parties of the West
description: MOSCOW, March 2The Independent stance taken by a handful of European Communist parties at the Soviet party's 25th Congress threatens to do more than just challenge Moscow's claim to leadership of the world Communist movement. It also contains the seeds of a skepticism that could undermine the deological premises that the Soviet Union advances to justify its ambitious foreign policy, continued hegemony over Eastern Europe and authoritarian controls at home.

title: Inquiry Into 11 Hospital Deaths Names 2 Nurses as Key Figures
description: DETROIT, March 2 (AP)Two nurses have been named in legal documents as key figures in an investigation into a series of breathing failures among patients at Ann Arbor's Veterans Administration Hospital.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Anwar elSadat of Egypt said at a news conference in Kuwait that he concluded secret agreements as part of the Sinai accord last September in which the United States pledged that Israel would not attack Syria and that every effort would be made to insure Palestinian participation in a Middle East settlement. Neither of theseagreements was made public at subsequent Congressional hearings. Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger told a Senate committee on Oct. 7 that the Administration had provided all that the United States regarded as legally binding. [Page 1,Column 1.]

title: A Witness Contradicts Miss Hearst on Gun
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 2 A 32yearold electronics technician called as the Government's first rebuttal witness gave testimony today that contradicted Patricia Hearses story that she participated in a bank robbery without knowing if her gun was loaded or in working condition.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: New Bond Issues

title: Caroy Is Parade Marshal
