For all practical purposes, Jim Ryun was through on Sept. 8, 1972, when he lay sprawled on the track in Munich with spike wounds on both ankles while Kipchoge Keino raced on to win his opening heat in the Olympic 1.500 meters.

title: A Village That Taught The World How to Ski
description: Alpine ski resorts acquire reputations in a natural way. Gstaad is for unobtrusively rich folk, a sheltered spot where William F. Buckley Jr. and John Kenneth Galbraith reevaluate the Treaty of Trent. S. Moritz used to be the winter spa where titled wealth melded with the glitzier variety that jetted in with film stars and beautiful people. Today the place belongs to the Shah of Iran and his bodyguards. Zermatt, with its Matterhorn and mountaineering tradition, with its prohibition of cars, is for the hearty and wholesome who still believe in Heidi. In tiny Klosters, it is quite acceptable to be Brigitte Bardot, but it is far preferable to be Irwin Shaw.

title: The Businessman Versus the Journalist
description: Our country is 200 years old. We have enjoyed the fruits of the free market system for two centuries, as we have benefited from freedom of the press for two centuries. Yet, here we are, business and the news media, like two strange dogs circling each other warily, suspicious of each other's intentions.

title: One Family's Unavoidable Deficit
description: Dick Kuhl was born in Council Bluffs, Iowa, in 1935, the year Social Security became law. His father, William, a worker in a grocery store's meat department earned $13 a week, all takehome pay.

title: Ashe, Connors Win Singles, Clinch World Cup for U.S.
description: HARTFORD, March 6It's over. Game, set, World Cup. Arthur Ashe and Jimmy Connorsthe No. 1 and No. 2 male tennis players in the worldtook both ends of a singles doubleheader today and clinched the fourofsevenmatch World Cup competition for the United States against Australia. It was the first time since 1971 and the second time in the sevenyear history of the event that the Americans triumphed.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: To most amateurs, using flash means using a single, small, portable unit that can be carried around in a camera bag. These units operate on batteries and are thus capable of providing the photographer with a pocket studio that is adequate for many indoor pictures.

title: Options:
description: An investor in the stock market who sold 1,000 Shares of Disney stock at $60 each would typically pay a commission to his broker of roughly $550.

title: Rodino: Alone in the Corridors of Power
description: WASHINGTON THRONGS of newsmen no longer surround him as he makes his way, unimpeded by competing microphones and unilluminated by onceomnipresent television lights, through the Capitol's corridors. The fatigue is gone, too, the bonewearying 20hour days that landed him in the IntensiveCare Unit of Bethesda Naval Hospital. The agonizing uncertainty, the conflicting pressures, the selfdoubtall are things of the past.

title: Charles Lederer Dead at 65; The Stage and Screen Writer
description: Charles Lederer, the stage and screen writer, died Friday at the University of California Hospital in Los Angeles. He was 65 years old and lived in Bellaire, Calif.

title: Nuptials April 24 For Devon King, D. L. Billings 2d
description: Mr. and Mrs. Victor Henry King of New Canaan, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Devon DeGalia King, to David Lane Billings 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Evans Billings of Morristown, N.J., and Tuckers Town, Bermuda.

title: The President's Mistress
description: In a more innocent time than ours it was said that the surest way to bestsellerdom was to write a book called The President's Doctor's Dog. A more likely version of the old formula today might be The President's Mistress's Perversion. Patrick

title: Peggy Rounick Engaged
description: Herbert Rounick and Sonya Rounick, both of New York, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Peggy Ann Rounick, to Michael Roaman of Palm Beach, Fla., son of Mr. and Mrs. Alan Roaman of Hollywood, Fla.

title: CHESS
description: Mating attacks, unless they catch the opponent totally by surprise, do not often end in checkmate; the alert defender can be expected to sacrifice material to put off that odious finish.

title: Madrid to Relax Curbs On Political Associations
description: MADRID, March 6  The Spanish Government, after denouncing recent violence as an effort to hinder political change, approved last night a bill providing for freedom of political association.

title: PEOPLE
description: RETURNING from an enjoyable semester of research to the grim budgetary problems now facing the university is like plunging into a pool of icy water. With those words, Dr. John S. Toll summed up his feelings about resuming his duties as president of the State University Center at Stony Brook after a fourandahalfmonth sabbatical. Dr. Toll's sabbatical, his first in a decade at Stony Brook, took him to Denmark, where he bicycled to work every day at the NORDICA Institute of Theoretical Physics of the Niels Bohr Institute in Copenhagen. Although he spent 12 hours a day doing research, Dr. Toll enjoyed weekend excursions with his wife, Deborah, and their children, Dacia, 3 and Carolyn, 1. After a pleasant European visit, Dr. Toll says he now meets Stony Brook's problems with what he calls a new enthusiasm. It helps to get a perspective on university problems if you back away for a while, he says.

title: The JoffreySurviving Against the Odds
description: It's hard to believe, but the City Center Joffrey Ballet, that freshfaced baby of the ballet world which opens a fiveweek season on Wednesday at the City Center 55th Street Theater, has now been with us 20 years. I always wanted a company, and I never doubted I'd have one some day, its founder and director, 45  year  old Robert Joffrey, says. I wanted to pick dancers and reper toire. I remember, when I was an 11yearold ballet student in Seattle, making up a whole cast for Sleeping Beauty, which I had never seen. Fonteyn, Ulanova and Chauvire were all in my cast. Toscanini was going to conduct. But my teacher, Mary Ann Wells, said to me: Before you have a company, you must learn to dance, so put that idea away.

title: Home Clinic
description: In an effort to catch up on the backlog of unanswered questions, most of the Home Improvement Column this week is again being devoted to Questions and Answers. Many of the letters published here ask questions similar to those posed by other readers whose actual letters may not appear here, but who will, nevertheless, find their answers printed below. Renders sending in questions about lime repair problems should address them to: Home Improvement Department. The New York Times. New York. N.Y. 10036. Only those questions of general interest will he answered here.

title: Progress Seen On Ganges Pact
description: WASHINGTON, March 6Bangladesh and India took a step toward resolving a major problem over joint use of the Ganges River waters in a meeting here this week, diplomats of both nations reported.

title: Cat Stevens Sings Judicious Program In Complex Setting
description: Cat Stevens personally has a very simple approach to his music  his own songs, own acoustic guitar and piano (not electric). However, the singer appeared in a complex setting at Madison Square Garden on Friday before a sellout crowd. There were his large backup band, a decorative tent over the stage (one of the more stylish in rockandroll), films shown during parts of his performance and a magician busy making things disappear and sawing the lady in half.

title: A Word in Favor Of Meditation in Schools
description: THE furor created by teaching Transcendental Meditation courses in New Jersey public schools has led me to some thoughts that I wish to share, I tend to agree with the critics of the program that the public schools are not the place for initiation ceremonies, incensetitled rooms and bowing before the statue of the Guru Hey. However, meditation is also effective without its mystical trappings, as has been pointed out by Dr. Herbert Benson of the Harvard Medical School and others.

title: Pucker Up, America The Kiss Is Chic
description: Jenny kissed me'Leigh Hunt was so excited, he wrote a poem about it. Well, I don't think it's anything to brag about. These days, Jenny kisses me and so do Bob and Carol and Ted and Alice. And so do a lot of strangers. As when a woman I know slightly introduces her husband. Before I get a chance to say How do you do? the gent leans over and kisses me.

title: Wallace Tactics Appear to Indicate Possible Acceptance of a Role in a Third Party
description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 6Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama has been leaving the impression in the 1976 Presidential campaign that he is totally committed to an effort to win the Democratic nomination and has no interest in a third party effort.

title: Hamill Wins Ice Crown
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, March 6 (AP)Dorothy Hamill of the United States, a 19year old Olympic champion, won the women's world figure skating championship today. She is the first American to win the title in eight years.

title: Nadjari Says Murtagh Blocked a Retrial
description: Maurice H. Nadjari, the state's special anticorruption prosecutor, testified yesterday that John M. Murtagh, the late State Supreme Court justice, had blocked the retrial of the former president of the City Tax Commission after the justice's conduct in the first trial was criticized on appeal.

title: 3 Armed Libyans Seized at Rome
description: ROME, March 6 (Reuters)Three young Libyans were arrested today in possession of automatic weapons and a hand grenade at Fiumicino International Airport, scene of carnage in an Arab attack in 1973.

title: Fordham Bright Spot: Spirited Female Five
description: Stormy weather has overshadowed the sunshine on Fordham University's campus in recent weeks. Fordham's men's basketball team finished the season with a 719

title: Little Peru Spends Big For Arms
description: LONDONWhen the subject of arms purchases by poor countries comes up and criticism is made of governments who spend money on defense which could otherwise go to feed and house their citizens, the military Government of Peru is often singled out as being particularly blameworthy.

title: Again, Signs in the Air That the Democrats Plan a Bloc Party
description: The early Democratic primaries have demonstrated once again the emphasis on building blocs of voters, or, as Henry Jackson exulted after the Massachusetts primary, putting together the grand coalition. Accommodations rather than programs become the objectives.

title: Carole Kahn Married
description: Carole Kahn, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harold L. Kahn of Lido Beach, L.I., was married last evening to Richard Todd Singer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Myron Singer of Hewlett, L.I. The ceremony was performed in Temple Israel in Lawrence, L.I., by Rabbi Joel Zion.

title: Frank A. Ayer, Engineer, Specialist in Copper Mining
description: Frank A. Ayer, a former consulting mining engineer here, died yesterday In New Rochelle, N.Y. He was 89 years old and lived in Pelham Manor, N.Y.

title: 81 Shot Victor at Aqueduct
description: National Flag won the $55,500 Swift Stakes yesterday at Aqueduct, but don't start touting him for the Kentucky Derby. He isn't nominated.

title: Letters More on The search
description: Betty Jean Lifton said that by late adolescence ... virtually all adopters feel a sense of genealogical bewilderment. Her article (The search, Jan. 25) implied that an adoptee who is not oh. sessed with the mystery of his or her origins is really just repressing these normal curiosities.

title: Swede Describes a Visit to Site Of Alleged Cambodia Bombing
description: PEKING, March 6 (Agence FrancePresse)Sweden's Ambassador to Peking, who with other diplomats was taken to the Cambodian town of Siem Reap to see damage that the Phnom Penh Government said was caused by American bombers last month, said here today that something has happened in Siem Reap, but I don't know what and I don't know when.

title: CONTROLS ON N.S.A. REPORTED SOUGHT
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 The staff of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence will recommend legislation requiring that the National Security Agency obtain a courtordered warrant before it makes an American citizen a subject of electronic eavesdropping, sources familiar with the committee's final report said today.

title: Making Order Out of Chaos for the Convention
description: NATIONAL conventions are the endall of party politics in this country, the World Series of the Presidential nomination races. As such, they can be tumultuous and boring, unpredictable and exciting, full of hoopla and deadly serious. But for hundreds upon hundreds of prospective delegates from states like New Jersey, a national convention is an ego trip, a comingout party celebrated once every four years. It is the one big chance to get away from clubhouses and courthouses, with their daytoday politics, and take part in the tumult and the shouting, the glamour of basking in the national spotlight for four days.

title: Miss Sacks Plans To Marry Lawyer
description: Marilynn Sacks, a school psychologist, plans to be married in August to Joel H. Friedman, a lawyer with the Brooklyn regional office of the National Labor Relations Board.

title: Single Pension Plan Proposed fOr City and State
description: A uniform retirement plan for state and municipal employees, to replace the various existing pension systems at substantial savings for the city and state, is to be made public on Tuesday by the State Pension Commission.

title: Nixon Bar Inquiry
description: Since the summer of 1973 the Association of the Bar of the City of New York has been Investigating whether to recommend the disbarment of former President Richard M. Nixon in New York State. His conduct in the Watergate affair is under scrutiny.

title: East Frisia Complains Of Neglect
description: NORDERNEY, West GermanyQuestion: Why would everybody go to East Frisia at the end of the world?

title: 6,000 Katangese Militiamen, Under 3 Flags in 14 Years, Face Repatriation to Zaire From Angola
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 6Six thousand African militiamen, who in the last 14 years have fought under three banners, are completing the latest chapter in their remarkable wanderings. They appear to be lost again even though they were on the winning side.

title: Florida's Rapidly Growing Electorate Is a Major Import
description: ORLANDO, Fla.The extraordinary thing about Florida and the dominant political fact in the state that holds the third major Presidential primary of 1976 on Tuesday, growth. In 1950, Florida had 2.5 million people; last year, there were eight million. By 1980 it will probably be the nation's seventh largest state. Its population has increased by more people than live in the whole of Nebraska.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Overpayments of more than $2.7 million by the Metropolitan. Transportation Authority to the bankrupt Penn Central company, uncovered in an audit by State Comptroller Arthur Levitt, are being recovered by the authority. Mr. Levitt said the excessive charges were for use of railroad personnel and equipment to make capital improvements, with most of the cost paid by the state.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: So it's going to be Zubin Mehta. On Feb. 25 the New York Philharmonic made the announcement: starting September, 1978, Mehta will become the music director of the Philharmonic, taking over from Pierre Boulez.

title: Wayne County And Tuff Darts Play at CBGB's
description: Wayne County has been something of a fixture on the New York rock underground circuit for the last couple of years, modifying his act slightly from the pure raunch of yore but still far too outrageous for commercial acceptability. Thursday through last night he's been at CBGB's on the Bowery, and his performance suggests the need for disciplineartistic discipline, that is.

title: THE SILVERMAN STRATEGY
description: The corner office on the 38th floor of the American Broadcasting Company's corporate home on the Avenue of the Americas looks directly out across 53d Street at the far more imposing glassandgranite building of the Columbia Broadcasting System. Only a few hundred feet separate the two buildings but, by other measures, the distance between the two companies is enormous.

title: Seven BeautiesA Cartoon Trying to Be a Tragedy
description: How did the world get like this? We all get killed and nobody says anything, philosophizes lady  killing concentration  camp inmate Pasqualino Frafuso (Giancarlo Giannini), in Seven Beauties, the Italian filmmaker Una Wertmller's newest triumph. (Critics have called it everything from a masterpiece to a monumental classic to a magnificent achievement to the Eureka film.)

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, MARCH 7, 1976

title: Jockey's Streak Halted at Eight at Bowie
description: Bill Passmore won the first two races at Bowie Race Course today, extending to eight his streak of consecutive winners.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Ever since the Bomb was invented, men have worried about its illegal use. . . . Suppose such a lethal instrument got into the wrong hands. This concern resulted in a spate of novels, the most famous of which was FailSafe. And they still come, these novels that have the world teetering on a thin edge. As witness NORTH STAR CRUSADE by William Katz (Putnam's, $7.95) and THE SEVEN OF SWORDS by R.E. Harrington (Putnam's, $7.95).

title: Upsala's OneMan Band
description: HE had just risen from a sickbed for the interview, he said cheerfully. He did look a little pale from his bout with the flu, but he settled into a chair and burrowed into a stuffed briefcase to come up with a record, some scattered concert notices and sheets of music.

title: Moira MacAvoy Engaged to Wed
description: Thomas C. MacAvoy, president of the Corning Glass Works, and Mrs. MacAvoy of Corning, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Moira Anne MacAvoy, to George Howard Brown, son of Mr. and Mrs. George H. Brown of Rumson, N. J.

title: What's Doing in GREATER MIAMI
description: THE AMBIENCEGreater Miami (Dade County), the nation's largest subtropical metropolitan area, is twice the size of Rhode Island. It encompasses 2,052 square miles of which 354 square miles are under water. The copulation of Greater Miami's 27 municipalities among them Miami, Miami Beach, Coral Gables, Surfside, Hialeah and Homestead  is 1.5 million. About onethird are Latins, who in the last decade have given certain areas a distinct Hispanic flavor. Miami's air is pure, its waters largely unpolluted, its sunlight bright, its color scheme predominantly blue, green and yellow.

title: Judith Gansberg Plans Bridal On May 30 to Robert Burger
description: Judith Gansberg, a television film scriptwriter and producer in Washington, and Robert Burger, a former Navy lieutenant, plant to be married May 30 at Temple Beth Shnlom in Clifton. N. J.

title: ISRAEL AGAIN ASKS PERSHING MISSILE
description: The Israeli Government, despite resistance by the United States Defense Department, Is again asking that Pershing missiles be included in military aid.

title: Rutgers vs. Passaic, 1920's
description: THE Rutgers basketball team is said to have made everyone in New Jersey forget his troubles, but pardon us old Passaicites if we yawn a little. The 26 regularseason games won by the Scarlet Knights isn't bad for what it is, but what is it next to the 159 consecutive victories rolled up by the Passaic High School Indians of the early 20's?

title: GARDENING
description: JAPANESE maples from Japan and Korea are handsome and very variable shrubs or small trees well suited to small yards in New Jersey. They are treasured for their dense and beautiful foliage on horizontal, or even weeping, branches that produce interesting mounded plant forms.

title: Slavic Showcase
description: WHEN it comes to theater, Port Jefferson is about as far OffBroadway as playing can be. Yet, for five years now scores of East European dramatists, actors and directors have come to this picturesque Suffolk village to make their American debuts in an auditorium that once offered bingo games.

title: Women Who Guard the Corners
description: JOAN Schultz is often mistaken for a policewoman. That is because she wears a smart, starched blue uniform on the job. She looks authoritative, even stern, and motorists sometimes stop and ask her for assistance. Officer ... they begin. It is true that what Mrs. Schultz does for a living involves a bit of police work. In fact, her salary is paid by the Suffolk County Police Department. But she is not a policewoman. She is a schoolcrossing guard.

title: Introducing Shirley Braverman
description: Shirley is an oldfashioned girl in an oldfashioned time and these are firstperson recollections of her 12th year, growing up in Brooklyn during the 1940's. Unlike modern heroines. she is obedient; spying or lying is not her style. She unashamedly shows affection for her parents. Enjoys being a girl and dressing up in Mother's discarded clothes. Admires her teacher. Her ambition: to be spelling champion of Brooklyn.

title: Ruffled Feathers In the Canaries
description: He couldn't take any more. Nat Gilbert (as we'll call him), his wife and their two teenage daughters had been sent to three rooms in two days, all of them too small or otherwise unacceptable. So Nat stumbled down to the tourist reception desk, lay back in a chair, closed his eyes, clutched his chest and muttered, I don't feel so good. Minutes later, he was being driven to an acceptable room. He also won the Golden Paella award for the Best Acting Performance by a Male American Touristand believe me, the competition was fierce.

title: Bold Prices for Bald Eagles
description: It's a bird, it's extravagant it's the latest Bicentennial commemoration.

title: 10,000 in France Attend Funeral Of a Winegrower Killed in Clash
description: ARQUETTESENVAL, France, March 6  More than 10,000 people gathered on the hillside of this tiny Languedoc village today for the burial of Emile Pouytes, a 52yearold winegrower who was killed Thursday in a gun battle beween angry winegrowers and policemen.

title: Teng Reported Accused Of Mishandling Military
description: PEKING, March 6 (Reuters)China's criticized senior Deputy Prime Minister, Teng Hsiaoping, has been accused of mishandling military affairs in new wallposters pasted up at Peking University, informed sources said today.

title: Chased From Africa, Adrift and Jobless in Portugal
description: LISBONThey are still coming here in droves from what was oncePortuguese Africa, entire families with all their worldly belongings in plastic bags and tin trunks, and no place to go.

title: Preventing Prison Suicides
description: ABOUT 30 percent of flew Jersey's prison population will consider or attempt suicide during their incarceration, according to a psychiatrist who has written a new manual on the problem.

title: Footnote on a guru
description: Alan Watts was busy promoting his idea at the Playboy Writers' Conclave in 1971, smiling and gabbing and holding Hugh Hefner's sleeve, and in that voice and those accents which mixed Bacchus and unction, public school Englishman and Sausalito drug guru, he said, Let me moderate a Playboy interview between the Pope and Hefner. . . . Hefner was pulling away. The Vicar of Christ and the Vicar of AntiChristimagine such a meeting, with me in between, moderating! Hefner was looking for a polite exit. The leader of the Church and the Leader of the New Morality. . . .

title: Househusbanding, or Suburban Mania
description: WHAT in hell am I doing here? The first time I asked myself that question, I was standing in a formal military parade at Fort Dix while an automated general pinned a piece of cheap metal on the tunic of a fool who had needlessly exposed himself to enemy fire in Korea.

title: Obituary 3  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Wood, Field, Stream: Fish Management
description: NEW ORLEANSHow will we manage marine game and food fish so that they are not exploited to near extinction?

title: Scarlett, Rhett, And a Cast Of Thousands
description: There have been so many Hollywood books recently that one may well wonder who needs this account of the filming of Gone With the Wind. But the first few pages dispel any doubt. Here is the inside story of how producers were made and broken, how stars were made, and how Margaret Mitchell's 1936 bestselling novel was turned into a monumental movie in 1939 and became one of the greatest boxoffice successes of all time. Roland Flamini has done a splendid Job of amassing all the details and organizing them into a readable, entertaining book. It is not only informative, it Is fun, stuffed with anecdotes, personality conflicts, power conflicts, scandals, gossip, cliffhanging financing, friendships, love Affairs, feuds and Jealousies. It relies heavily on the news stories of the time, Louella Parsons's column, correspondence with Margaret Mitchell and personal accounts, but it never stumbles into voyeurism.

title: ARGENTINA RAISES PRICES SHARPLY
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 6The emergency program to curb inflation announced last night by the Argentine Government began today with an avalanche of price increases for public service': and products supplied by state enterprises, as well as for some consumer goods that had virtually disappeared from stores.

title: TV Recycles The Entertainer as Entertainment
description: One evening a couple of years ago, Marvin Hamlisch, the young musical adapter of the film score for The Sting and composer of the Broadway hit A Chorus Line, was seized by an idea. He happened to be attending a Hollywood dinner given by the Entertainment Hall of Fame at which a tape recording of the voice of Sir Laurence Olivier was playedOlivier had not been able to be present to accept an honor from the organization. Hearing Olivier's voice, Hamlisch was reminded of the English actor's performance in John Osborne's 1957 play The Entertainer. Suddenly, it occurred to him that a remake of Osborne's play, which used the story of a British music hall performer on the skids as a symbol for the decline of British power, might be just what he had been looking for: another vehicle that would give him a chance to write songs that are intrinsic to a story.

title: Sally Olhausen Is Married to Newsman
description: Sally Aiken Olhauscn, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph H. Olhausen of Far Hills, N.J., was married yesterday afternoon to William Glen Mathewson Jr., correspondent in London for The Wall Street Journal.

title: POLITICS
description: The Democratic Presidential primary next month will provide a test of strength not only for the various Presidential candidates but also for the Democratic organizations In Nassau and Suffolk.

title: Eugenie A. Diserio to Wed May 23
description: Mr. and Mrs. Eugene A. Diserio of New Canaan, Conn., and Rumson, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Eugenie A. Diserio, to T. Steven Alexander of Plano, Texas.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: ALTHOUGH the problem of windows sweating and fogging up in the winter is one that some homeowners have long been familiar with, the exceptionally cold weather we have recently experienced has brought a virtual flood of mail from homeowners (and apartment dwellers) who want to know what causes this condensation and what, if anything, they can do about it.

title: Julie A. Diehl Sets August Nuptials.
description: Mr. and Mrs, Val B. Diehl of Westfield, N. J., formerly of Mill Hill, London, have made known the engagement of their daughter, Julie Ann Diehl, to Robert M. Verklin Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Verklin of Pittsburgh. The wedding is planned for August.

title: Stephanie L. Saunders Is Wed To Gregory Fouch, Economist
description: The Dutch Reformed Church in Bronxville, N. Y., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Stephanie Lynne Saunders, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stephan L. Saunders of Crestwood, N. Y., to Gregory George Fouch, son of Mr. and Mrs. George E. Fouch of Washington, formerly of Bronxville.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: THE Long Island Expressway, our own insular Alcan Highway still frightens me after all these years, not because it is too fast, obviously, but because I never know how it is going to behave. Most other roads are rather predictable thoroughfares? Hempstead Turnpike? Red lights at each intersection: they see you coming and turn on before you can get clear. The lights are run by experts and you can rely on a slow passage.

title: GARDENING
description: THE casual flower show visitor attends a spring show expecting to see attractive flowers and gardens, which signify the coming of spring. The gardener attends a show expecting this and much more. He is looking for new plants, new ideas and gardening information that can be put to work in his own garden. Flora '76, the spring flower show that opened yesterday at the Nassau Veterans Memorial Coliseum, in Uniondale, will serve both audiences.

title: Racial Animosity Turns to Violence in Pensacola, Fla., on Issue of Calling High School Teams Rebels
description: PENSACOLA, Fla., March 6Years of racial animosity in this Florida panhandle city have erupted into violence in recent weeks on the issue of whether athletic teams at a local high school will be called the Rebels or the Raiders.

title: The Fine Art of Excellence in Printmaking
description: 5 Skidmore Place in West Islip, began life as a fiveroom gardener's cottage on a big estate. Outwardly it has changed not at all, but as an address it is known throughout the world as the headquarters of what is, by general consent, the best of all print workshops: Universal Limited Art Editions.

title: New Products
description: By using a faucet attachment recently introduced for use on kitchen sink faucets, anyone can now save as much as 50 percent on the amount of water consumed, and in the process also save on the amount of hot water used (thus cutting down on fuel bills). Called Rainbow. the attachment consists of a swivel spray head with a builtin valve that attaches easily to the end of the faucet spout. The onoff valve in this head is connected by a tube to a footpedal so that water only flows when the pedal is depressed. Releasing the pedal stops the flow. Thus one can adjust the temperature by regulating hot and cold while the pedal is depressed. After this each press on the pedal delivers water at the preset temperature, leaving the user's hands free to wash dishes, asks. Made by Conservocon, Inc., 191 Edgewater Street, Staten Island, N.Y. 10305, the Rainbow sells for under $9 and is made of a tough plastic that is resistant to detergents and corrosion.

title: The Nation
description: Two important statistics have provided additional evidence that the economy is continuing to recover from recession with bad inflation. In February, the Wholesale Price Index declined by fivetenths of 1 percent, and the unemployment rate fell by 2 percent, to 7.6 percent.

title: Iran's Grand Library
description: EAST NORWICH PLANS for the Pahlavi National Library of Iran  the Shah's vission of an instrument to help stamp out Illiteracy in his country and a librarian's dream of an institution to usher in a new age of aggressive librarianship  have been completed here under circumstances as austere as the library will some day be grand.

title: Sunday Observer
description: New York is a city of dogs. There are more than a million in all walks of life. Most of these walks go right past my house, which makes for a great deal of cursing on dark nights. Guests who come to dinner usually refuse invitations to come back. I am illdisposed to dogs in cities though I am careful not to say so, since the dogs have numerical strength and owners obviously capable of great ruthlessness.

title: Robin McCann To Be a Bride
description: Robin Elizabeth McCann, a Syracuse University senior, plans to be married in August to Bryce Lawrence Holland Jr., a graduate student at the University of Pennsylvania and grandson of George T. Delacorte of New York, the book publisher and philanthropist.

title: Economics Endangering the Area's Improved Environment
description: Hundreds of tons of soot drop silently on the New York metropolitan area each year, along with large amounts sulfur dioxide, oxides of nitrogen, carbon monoxide and other less palpable pollutants. They not only drive up laundry bills, inspire residents to keep windows shut even on balmy days, and inflame eyes and throats, but also are suspected of causing some respiratory illnesses.

title: Nancy Berkey Harrison Affianced
description: The engagement of Nancy Berkey Harrison to David William Drake has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Robert Drew Harrison of Haverford, Pa., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. William Raymond Drake of Pittsburgh.

title: Marriage Announcement 3  No Title
description: Drs. Tarshish, Koss Wed

title: North Sea Oil: Norway's and Britain's
description: The official word is finally outabout 2.4 billion barrels of oil can be economically extracted from the Ekofisk field, Norway's first big find in the North Sea oil sweepstakes. Wall Street investment counsellors had been using a figure close to that as a working hunch for nearly three years. But not until Norway issued a prospectus late last month for a $100 million note offering here were those earlier estimates confirmed.

title: Radio
description: 7:308 A.M., WNEWAM: Yale Reports. Privacy and National Security.

title: Dr. Patrick S. Nolan Marries Nancy Hood
description: Nancy Hood, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Moore Hood of Tucson, Ariz., was married yesterday to Dr. Patrick Sarsfield Nolan of Sausalito, Calif., a dentist. The Rev. Clement Davenport performed the Roman Catholic ceremony at the Presidio Chapel in San Francisco.

title: TORTURE BY NAVY CHARGED BY PILOT
description: SAN. DIEGO, March 6A controversy has arisen over the treatment of young officers and enlisted men at a simulated Navy prisonerofwar survival camp in an isolated mountain area near here.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Avon Associates, Inc., which is headed by Sol Goldman, has transferred four properties in midtown and on the East Side in lieu of foreclosure and sold another one.

title: Kissinger Cautions Communists Again On Military Moves
description: ATLANTA, March 6 (UPI) Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger today issued another sharp warning to Cuba and the Soviet Union that the United States will not accept any further Cuban military adventures in other parts of the world.

title: Headliners
description: A former engineer for the Mobil Oil Company, Norman John Rees, committed suicide last week after a Dallas newspaper disclosed that he had once sold oil industry secrets to the Soviet Union, and that he later served as a double agent for the Federal Bureau of Investigation. Officials at the Dallas Times Herald said Mr. Rees had cooperated fully in interviews prior to the publication of the story, and that he was aware he would be personally identified when the story was published. But shortly before the story went to press, Mr. Rees phoned from his Connecticut home and asked if the story was going to be printed. When told it was, he said the disclosure of his activities left him no alternative but suicide. The paper's story said Mr. Rees had collected $30,000 for information he provided Soviet agents from World War II through 1971. In 1971, the F.B.I. uncovered his espionage activities and, threatened with prosecution, he turned double agent.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Inner Circle Lampoons BeameCarey Tensions
description: Mayor Beame's and Governor Carey's political antagonisms over the city's fiscal problems were lampooned last night at the annual show of the Inner Circle, an organization of present and past New York political reporters.

title: Meeting Yeats was a momentous encounter for both
description: The very name Lady Gregory seems today, like Mrs. Gaskell or Mrs. Humphry Ward, to belong to a period when women regarded their talent as requiring connubial sanction. In fact, however, Lady Gregory did not become a serious writer until she became a widow.

title: Shoeshine Girl
description: Sarah Ida Becker, age 10, has been sent off to Aunt Claudia in placid Palmville for a summer away from her shoplifting friend Midge, a friendship that caused such family concern that all at once everything changed. Mother asked a million questions about everything I did. And my clothes weren't right, and my friends weren't right. I couldn't do thisi couldn't do that.

title: Elizabeth Bird, Social Worker, Fiancee of Rev. William Potter
description: The Venerable Samuel Bancroft Bird Jr., an archdeacon of the Episcopal Diocese of New York, and Mrs. Bird have announced the engagement of their daughter, Elizabeth Richardson Bird, to the Rev. William A. Potter, executive director of the Rectory Inc., a new residential and day treatment center for emotionally disturbed children in Newark.

title: Isabelle Tamalet Sets July Bridal
description: Dr. LouisJean Tamalet of Paris has announced the engagement of his daughter, Isabelle Fernande Christiane Tamalet, to Victor Marquissee Tilden, son of Mr. and Mrs. William T. Tilden 3d of New Verrron, N. J.

title: Bridgework as an Employee Benefit
description: Dental insurance is the fastest growing benefit provided by employers, according to the Conference Board, a business research organizetaion. Nearly one fifth of 1,600 banks, insurance companies, manufacturers and major corporations examined in a recent study now have such coverage. Nearly all the plans set a maximum for one person's annual dental expenses; and the most common maximums are $500, $750 and $1,000.

title: Moving Nuclear Waste
description: Brookhaven National Laboratory officials say they plan to resume their controversial shipments of nuclear waste materials within the the next few weeks, but not through New York City, which banned them last August

title: Juggling: Keep Your Eye On the Oranges!
description: The art of juggling has flourished over the centuries wherever people have gathered to be entertained. Frescoes and reliefs showing jugglers performing with balls, clubs and flaming torches have been found in ancient Egypt, in Greece, and in the ruins of preColumbian civilizations in South America.

title: Notes From The Highway
description: The following article was written by a New York City bank economist who owns a Citizens Band radio and goes by the handle of Crystal Ball.

title: RHODESIAN BLACK SCOFFS AT TALKS
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, March 6The leader of what is regarded as the majority faction in the divided black nationalist movement in Rhodesia today contended that negotiations between Prime Minister Ian D. Smith and the leader of another nationalist faction are a waste of time that will produce negative results.

title: Teachers Briefed on Economics
description: AHIGH  SCHOOL teacher and a student are talking. Who was Adam Smith?

title: This Week in Sports
description: Billy (Dynamite) Douglas and Tom (The Bomb) Bethea, light heavyweights, fight in the featured 10round bout at 8 P.M. tomorrow at Madison Square Garden. Other 10rounders match Eddie (Flame) Gregory and Hildo Silva, light neavyweights; Christy Elliott and Case Gacic, middleweights; Mike Rossman and Gene Wells, middleweights, and Domenico Monaco and Eduardo Santiago, lightweights.

title: Answers/Questions
description: A: POMEGRANATE PLANT (Feb. 22) B. P. Atkinson, an upstate college student, has been successful in germinating pomegranate seed, now he would like to know how to raise the plants. Eva Belefant, a Westchester County reader, has raised several miniature pomegranates from seed. The plants need a considerable amount of water and sunlight. Mine have done well in southern and eastern exposure.

title: Music in Review
description: There have been a few notable soloists of the string bass, but most of themlike Serge Koussevitskybecame more notable after they switched to another line of work. Like other bass instruments in the different instrumental families, the string bass sounds most comfortable sawing steadily away between the dominant and the tonic. To be effective as a solo instrument, it must be forced into its upper positions, where it tends to sound like a weak, shaky cello.

title: China Pottery Army
description: HONG KONG, March 6 (Agence FrancePress)  China is to stage one of its biggest archaeological exhibitions in an army of lifesize pottery figures from 2,000 years ago.

title: Papadopoulos Acquittal Plea
description: ATHENS, March 6 (Reuters) The public prosecutor today called for the acquittal of former President George Papadopoulos on charges of being morally responsible for the killing of a 15yearold boy on the first day of the army coup in 1967.

title: The Changing Spanish Politics
description: The laws of Spain are almost exactly as they were before the death three months ago of the dictator, Francisco Franco, but the national life has undergone pronounced changes.

title: Music: A Celebration
description: Celebration of Contemporary Music is the name of the festival that opened Friday night in the Juilliard Theater under the joint auspices of the New York Philharmonic, the Juilliard School and the Fromm Music Foundation. And celebration was a good word for the initial concert, which found the theater packed with musicians, including the all  important composers, who are interested in what is happening creatively now now, in its broadest sense.

title: DINING OUT
description: THIS is a pleasant restaurant and obviously a magnet in the locality but it can't be because of the food. The accent is German. A cheerful, woodpaneled dining room is decorated with hunting trophies,

title: Udall Given Top Rating By. Feminist Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, March 6An organization of feminist Democrats has rated the Democratic Presidential candidates on 16 issues, of importance to feminists and found that Representative Morris K. Udall of Arizona, among those still in the race, agrees with them on the largest number.

title: Lynne Bassett Betrothed
description: Capt. Donald R. Bassett, Dental Corps, U.S.N., retired, and Mrs. Bassett of Durham, N. H., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Lynne Louise Bassett of New London, Conn., to Lieut. George Conrad Giessing 3d of the Navy, a 1973 graduate of the United States Naval Academy, who is stationed aboard the submarine Pargo in New London. He is the son of Dr. Glessing Jr., a St. Louis dentist, and Mrs. Giessing. A wedding in August is planned.

title: Unemployment Up In 3 States
description: The January figures for unemployment show an increase for both New York City and State and are the highest since World War II. The jobless rate also went up for new Jersey and Connecticut.

title: J. R. Gillenson to Wed Sally Piermont
description: Mr. and Mrs. Donald Kenneth Piermont of Fair Lawn, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Sally Doris Piermont, to Joshua R. Gillenson of New York, who teaches emotionally disturbed children at the Lorge School here.

title: Nigeria Arrests Leader of Coup
description: LONDON, March 6 (Reuters) The leader of last month's attempted coup d'tat in Nigeria, Lieut. Col. B. S. Dimka, has been arrested after a threewkek nationwide manhunt, Laeos radio reported today.

title: Economic Indicators
description: WEEKLY COMPARISONS

title: A Theater at Middle Age, Or, Squaring the Circle
description: Tomorrow night, with a big benefit bash, the Circle in the Square will celebrate its 25th yeara ripe age for an American theater. Like some other institutions, and not a few people, the Circle is calmer now than in the days of Its hot youth, and more conventional; it has moved uptown to more comfortable quarters, and stopped making history. Nowadays, it offers stars in safe classics to subscription audiences: worthy work, tremendously exciting sometimes, but not like the old days.

title: Deborah Kayser Engaged to Wed Gordon Strauss
description: Mr. and Mrs. Leo Kayser Jr. of Birmingham, Ala., and Chilmark, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Deborah Kayser, to Gordon MacGregor Strauss, son of Dana Maher Strauss and Dr. Victor Bradford Strauss of Cincinnati.

title: Polyansky Retains Seat in Soviet Central Committee
description: MOSCOW, March 6Agriculture Minister Dmitri S. Polyansky, who was dismissed yesterday from the ruling Politburo in retaliation for last year's harvest failure, hasThe promotion of ranking bureaucrats seemed to favor the Kremlin's more pressing interests. Sergei F. Antonov, the Minister of the Meat and Dairy Industry; Voldemar P. Lein, the Minister of the Food Industry; Nikolai N. Tarasov, the Minister of. Light Industry, which includes consumer goods; and Vasily N. Doyenin, the Minister of Machine Building for Light and Food Industry, all became full members. stopped a significant step short of disgrace. He has been permitted to keep his seat on the party's Central Committee.

title: Zarley Still Leads
description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 6 Gary Player and Hale Irwin burst out of the pack today to assure a crowded finale tomorrow for the Florida Citrus Golf open.

title: Flowers for Shade
description: Save the sunny areas for vegetables, and grow flowers In the shade. Even earlyblooming hardy bulbs snowdrops and daffodilsand shrubs such as pinxter flower and mountain laurel will thrive.

title: Wake Forest Picks Aide
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., March 6 (AP)Eddie Wilson, a former professional football player, was named offensive coordinator today at Wake Forest University. Wilson replace Jim Larue, who left recently to join the Buffalo Bills of the National Football League.

title: The Dating Game on Videotape
description: HELLO. I'm Number 137, and I'm the spontaneous type. I'm Number 061, and I'm basically a nice guy.

title: HEARST CSAE JURY TO SCAN HER NOTES
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Calif., March 6When the jurors in the Patricia Hearst trial begin deliberations, they will have a number of documents, some in Miss Hearst's handwriting, that express strong feminist and revolutionary ideas, as well as notes on the inner workings of an underground revolutionary cell.

title: ART VIEW
description: The problem of growthand even more, perhaps, the corollary problem of nongrowththat is so vexing an issue for economists and demographers, for ecologists, city planners and political strategists, is now looming as a conundrum for American art museums as well. The last decade has seen an unprecedented boom in museum building all over the country. Collections, too, have been made and all the aberrations of taste and in what they arehas never been so high. The reasons for this historic growth are many, of course, and some of them are undeniably meretricious. Examples of buildings erected to house someone's ego, rather than to serve some serious artistic purpose, are not hard to find, and the unlovely scramble to acquire what is inregardless of its qualityis easy to ridicule. Yet, when all the criticisms have been made and all the admirations of taste and intelligence duly acknowledged, the fact remains that this museum boom is one of the glories of our cultural life. It has brought to many people a kind of pleasure, knowledge and spiritual splendor not to be found elsewhere, and only a fool would deny it.

title: Deaths
description: BECKETTAloise E., on March 5, 1976, retired general adjustment bureau. Beloved husband of Catherine, dear father of Edward. P. and Margaret A. Dam, nephew of David F. Stevenson, also survived by two grandchildren. Reposing at R. Stutzman and Son Funeral Home, 22439 Jamaica Ave.; Queens Village; L. I. Funeral Mass S. S. Joachiam and Anne R.C. Church, Tuesday, 9:45 A.M. Interment St. Bridget's Cemetery, Copake Falls, N. Y.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: Scoop

title: Deaths
description: FRIEDPal, world renowned artist, or March 6, 1976, beloved husband of the late Eva. Survived by niece Eva Vidor and many admiring and loving friends. Funeral arrangements private.

title: ALBANY FOCUSING ON BUDGET ISSUES
description: ALBANY, March 6After months of oratory, negotiations and staff work, the Legislature is preparing to consider next week two essential elements in the state's drive to overcome its fiscal crisisGovernor Ca rey's $10.76 billion budget and his $2.6 billion rescue package for the faltering state construction agencies.

title: Food
description: One of the best Indian cooks in Manhattan is Ismail Merchant, a 36yearold, Bombayborn movie producer whose credits include the critically acclaimed film Shakespeare Wallah. In the kitchen, Ismail Merchant offers working proof that there are scores of dishes from his homeland which are not in the least difficult to prepare. A complete Indian menu is offered herean easily made first course, shrimp with dill; an excellent, delectable, multiflavored pan roast of lamb as a main course; hot green beans with a tangy and tantalizing sauce of mustard; dal, the traditional lentil dish, inside special with lemon; and a seductive milk, almond and saffron dessert, sheer (milk) khorma (nuts and things). Of the dal, Ismail states, It is a rich man'spoor man's dish, and every household has its own version. It is must with any meal, and If you don't offer it, something is wrong

title: Moss Seeks to Be Whip
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (UPI) Senator Frank E. Moss. Democrat of Utah, announced yesterday that he would try to become majority whip, the job now held by Senator Robert C. Byrd of West Virginia, who is expected to try to succeed the retiring Mike Mansfield as Senate majority leader.

title: Miller: Kuhn to Rescue?
description: Commissioner Bowie Kuhn could rescue his bosses, baseball's club owners, by ordering them to open spring training camps, Marvin Miller suggested yesterday.

title: Mopping Up: A Lonely Night's Work
description: Because of her seniority, Olivia Thompson could have her pick of offices to work in, but she has no preference. Honey, she said, it doesn't matter what the view is, I dont have time to look at it.

title: Hidden Tax Is Called Unfair
description: WHEN Richard J. Hughes, now Chief Justice of the State Supreme Court, was Governor, he sought to have New Jersey enact an incometax law. His successor, William T. Cahill, spent months trying to have incometax legislation passed. and Governor Byrne has persistently urged that New Jersey adopt such a law.

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: The Silent $28 Million
description: Y. A. Tittle, Ollie Matson and Dick (Night Train) Lane are in the Pro Football Hail of Fame, which proves how talented they were as players. Now, as three of the eight former National Football League players receiving retirement benefits each month. they are proving that the N.F.L. pension fund lives, at least for row. Tittle, Mat son and Lane ?? to take earlyretirement bene??, beginning at age 45, along with Bill Wade, Fred Williams. Lee Elter sad George Hansen. Their monthly checks range from $247 to $120. Emlen Tunnel) also was receiving an early retirement monthly sum of nearly $180 when he died last year.

title: Spread of Rent Controls Spurs New Controversy
description: Rent control for apartments 1a benefit for tenants that is viewed as a bane by landlords has spread up and down the East Coast and has even skipped into Alaska from its onetime stronghold in New York.

title: Academic Decline in High Schools Can Be Explained, Theoretically
description: Evidence that the academic performance of American high school students is deteriorating has been building up for several years. Nobody knows why for sure, although there are several theories.

title: Downstairs, but not a comedown
description: In 1967, Ed Cabrini was employed as the financial officer for Colonial Leasing of New England, a firm situated on the Route 128 industrial arc near Boston. He was 45. The company leased trains, airplanes, computers, office furniturejust about anything you can think ofto other companies, and Cabrini, a graduate of Loyola University who had toyed briefly with the idea of entering the priesthood, managed the accounts receivable and the accounts payable. With responsibility for something like $20 million, he earned $18,000 a year. His wife, Mary, was doing well with her own hairdressing business; just the previous year, it had earned her a profit of $16,000. They lived in a quiet suburban community and were happy about the recent marriage of their daughter, Caron, 20, to an electronics teacher.

title: Indictments in Nassau County
description: Eight Republican officials, including the executive assistant to the Nassau County Republican chairman, have been indicted on charges concerning kickbacks allegedly coerced from county and town employees.

title: Andrea Sykes, William Foote Plan Marriage
description: Mr. and Mrs. Howard Calvin Sykes Jr. of Englewood, N. J., and Montebello, Quebec, have made known the engagement of their daughter, Andrea Marguerite Tracy Sykes, to William Chapin Foote, son of Mr. and Mrs. Peter C. Foote of Milwaukee and Ephraim, Wis.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: The large blackandwhite landscapes of Peter Mauss are far more like sentimental calendar art than one would expect to find at so resolutely avantgarde a gallery as Castelli Graphics. They are pretty pictures of picturesque country scenes: woodland roads, flowering fruit trees, quaint country cottages, purling brooks, ferns and and rock walls.

title: Sarah Brissenden Betrothed to William Kinlaw 3d
description: Mr. and Mrs. Hoke Brissenden of Mountain Lakes, N. J., have made known the engagemnent of their daughter, Sarah Hallock Brissenden, to William B. Kinlaw 3d, son of Dr. and Mrs. Kinlaw Jr. of Jenkintown, Pa. A September wedding is planned.

title: I Am The Audience In Action
description: Joseph Chaikin cast his inner directorial eye on the performance of actor Joseph Chaikin as the frenzied, doomed, semiautistic antihero of Woyzeck and concluded that there were still spots in need of development before opening night. The new production of Georg Buechner's difficult 1832 dra ma is now previewing at the Public Theater, with the official opening set for March 24.

title: Queens Women Top Immaculata
description: In a game played before a frenzied home crowd yesterday, Queens College upset Immaculata, 6564. Trailing, 3633, at halftime, the Queens women turned the game around at the start of the second half, holding the Macs scoreless for 4 minutes 31 seconds while taking a 9point lead, 4738. The Macs later rallied to tie the score, but a driving layup by Cynthia Garcia with 12 seconds remaining in the game gave the Knights the lead for good.

title: Benjamin Tuttle Fiance Of Barbara C. Abbott
description: Mr. and Mrs, Wilbur F. Abbott of Wallingford, Conn., have announced the engagement of Mr. Abbott's daughter, Barbara Carroll Abbott, to Benjamin Tuttle, son of Mr. and Mrs. Mark Tuttle, also of Wallingford.

title: Caren Fox Is Fiancee Of Dr. Robert Linden
description: Dr. and Mrs. Irving R. Fox of Union, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Caren Leslie Fox, to Dr. Robert Alan Linden, son of Dr. Benjamin. Linden of Rye, N.Y., and the late Mrs. Linden.

title: Two Scandals Later
description: When the present nursinghome scandal broke out a year and a half ago, many health officials predicted it would end no differently from all the other scandals that had preceded it for two decades. Today, with 65 nursing homes closed, a package of reform legislation on the books and scores of indictments in process, the pessimists say they were right: Nothing basic has changed.

title: Births
description: Manacker

title: Business Tunes In On Citizens and
description: In Tulsa, Okla., housewives trade tips on the best meat buys in town over their Citizens Band radios.

title: The Children of The Counterculture
description: In these modern times, when neither economic advantage nor the nation's good is wellserved by fecundity, we reproduce mainly to project ourselves, in some form, into the future not via time machine but by the transmission of our own values, culture and traditions. If the next generation rejects these in toto, we lose that rickety bridge to a kind of immortality that makes the often dreary business of childrearing worthwhile.

title: Strife in Ethiopia Strains Military Rule
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, March 2The jacaranda trees are in full bloom, colored lights line the main streets, Ethiopia is playing winning soccer and the largest hotel in town is offering a salute to the American Bicentennial by providing a menu of such wonders as Virginia Strawberries Romanoff and Chicken a la Ritz Old Poodle Dog.

title: Triumph Seals Playoff Spot
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Mar 6 With a systematic 63 victory over the Washington Capitals tonight, the New York Islanders clinched a berth in the National Hockey League playoffs with 14 games to spare. Last season the Islanders were not assured a playoff spot until the final two games.

title: EGYPTIANS BACK WOMEN'S DIVORCE
description: CAIRO, March 6A draft law giving an Egyptian woman, for the first time, the Tight to sue for divorce if her husband takes a second wife has been sent to the Ministry of Justice by a commission including the powerful head of Al Azhar, the conservative Islamic university, and other Moslem leaders.

title: End of Exile
description: This is a fresh, vigorous and altogether successful reworking of one of the classic themes of science fiction. A huge spaceship, bound for a distant star with a cargo of wouldbe colonists, suffers a terrible disaster en route. The leaders of the expedition are killed; much of the ship is wrecked. The survivors gather in those areas where the lifesupport systems are intact. Their minds benumbed by tragedy and by the struggle to stay alive, they gradually revert to a primitive existence. In time they forget about the original purpose of the voyage; they forget they are on a voyage at all; they come to think of the ship as the universe itself.

title: Spring Planning
description: Snowdrops are so eager to perform, they arch their graceful white blooms toward the sun long before any of the other bulbs. I had snowdrops in bloom on Jan. 27 this year on Cape Cod. I have even seen them flower in December. And in the New York region, they were starting to bloom in midFebruary. Gardeners who want to learn more about snowdrops should realize that there are many kinds to explore, often on hands and knees, the plants are so tiny. This is a good time of year to study snowdrops and make notes for bulb orders to be placed next fall for September planting. The rarer ones are hard to find in catalogs, but well worth the search.

title: Successor To Ramparts To Be Issued This Week
description: A successor publication was announced Friday night to the radical magazine Ramparts, which exposed covert activities of the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: A Flap That Became a Flop
description: Three years ago controversy raged over the question of car sales to Cuba for foreign units of American corporations. In Argentina, the subsidiaries sought permission to sell cars to Fidel Castro's island.

title: Pam Furer Is Married To Peter F. Edelman
description: Pain Jill Furer, daughter of Stanley Furer of Manhattan and the late Mrs. Furer, was married last night to Peter Franklin Edelman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold P. Edelman of Freeport, L. I. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Ronald Sobel at the Hampshire House.

title: Peter Schwartz Marries Laurel Whyte
description: Laurel Ann Whyte and Peter Damon Schwartz, both of New York, were married last night in Scarsdale, N. Y., at the home of the bride's brotherinlaw and sister, Mr. and Mrs. Chet Gould. Rabbi Robert Rothman performed the ceremony.

title: BRANDRETH SYMONDS Jr.
description: Brandreth Symonds Jr., a former real estate broker in New Canaan, Conn., and Middlebury, Vt., died yesterday in Hanover, N.H. He was 80 years old and lived in Bradford, Vt.

title: Epilogue
description: The Justice Department has dropped its civil antitrust suits against the Goodyear and Firestone tire companies. Officials said the department did not have enough evidence to prove a monopoly case. The department had contended that price cuts by Goodyear and Firestone in 1959 and 1960 were made at a time when their costs were rising. The suits said the companies were trying to increase their share of

title: New & Novel
description: Whip

title: Josephine Degener, Writer, a Bride
description: Josephine MarieChristina Degener, a writerreporter with Money magazine, was married here yesterday afternoon to Dr. John Edmonds David, an assistant professor of mathematics at the University of Campinas In Sao Paulo, Brazil. The Rev. Rene Fontaine performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Jean Baptiste.

title: South Africa Short of Power
description: CAPE TOWN, March 6 (Agence FrancePresse)South Africans face electricity shortages during the approaching winter months because of delays in bringing new supplies from the Cabora Bassa Dam in Mozambique, the Economy Minister, J. C. Heunis, said in Parliament. He said that rationing might have to be imposed.

title: STAMPS
description: The 18th annual edition of the International Philatelic Exhibition, INTERPEX 76, one of the two major yearly shows of the New York metropolitan area, is taking place this Friday through Sunday, March 1214 at the Americana Hotel, Seventh Avenue and 52d Street.

title: Contract Is Let to Install A Harbor Radar System
description: The Coast Guard has awarded a $3.7 million contract to the AIL division of CutlerHammer to provide the port with a radar surveillance system of all harbor traffic by

title: Rise in Remedial Work Taxing Colleges
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, March 6Plagued by increasing numbers of students who are unable to write coherent sentences or handle simple arithmetic, more and more colleges and universities are finding they have to offer remedial work in such basic skills.

title: Dr. Denise M. Nagel Bride of M. H. Wald
description: Dr. Denise Michelle Nagel. a pediatrician at the Duke University Hospital in Durham, N. C., was married there last evening to Michael H. Wald, a student at the Duke Law School. Rabbi Harry Jolt performed the ceremony at the Willowhaven Country Club.

title: CORNELL ASSAILS KY'S TREATMENT
description: ITHACA, N.Y.  A special faculty committee on academic freedom at Cornell University issued a report last week concluding that freedom of speech on the campus had been violated when Nguyen Cao Ky, the former vice president of South Vietnam, was booed off the stage here last December.

title: Moscow and Peking Take Different Roads to Influence
description: NAIROBI, KenyaWhen late last fall the Soviet Union sharply stepped up its assistance to the now victorious Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola, Bula Mandungu Nyati, then Foreign Minister of Zaire, called in the Soviet Ambassador in Kinshasa to express alarm.

title: Friends of Carole King Fill the Beacon Theater
description: The finest of Carole King's songs in recent years is called You've Got a Friend. It comes from her extraordinarily successful Tapestry album, and it was one of the high points in her concert Friday night at the Beacon Theaterthe first of three soldout nights there and part of her first tour in three years.

title: Some Surfers Never Give up
description: FOR most surfers, that perfect wave is surrounded by palm trees, blue skies, and 90degree weather. But for a small group of Long Islanders, the great wave has been coming in with white water that looks like snow and may well have been snow.

title: Maybe I'll Learn Someday, Dad, You Can't Win in This Game
description: Dillinger captured the imagination, Joe Pinkston says. I guess I wanted to be like him when I was a kid.

title: Virginia Victor In A.C.C. Upset
description: LANDOVER, Md., March 6 (UPI)Virginia, an underdog team that refused to quit, toppled the defending champion, North Carolina, 6772, in the final of the Atlantic Coast Conference tournament tonight. Billy Langloh of Virginia sank two tiebreaking free throws and fed an assist that set up the gameclinching basket in the final 34 seconds.

title: If You Go . . .
description: . . . to the Bosque del Apache National Wildlife Refuge, you will need a car, either your own or a rental. Arriving in Albuquerque by air, rail or bus, get onto Interstate 25 south and follow Belen and then Socorro and El Paso signs 87 miles to the junction with U. S. 380 at San Antonio, N. M. Take State Route 1 south from San Antonio four miles to the refuge border (big sign) and four miles farther to the refuge headquarters intersection (another big sign). Turn left to enter the tour, stopping at the information booth on the right to sign the guest register and pick up handouts. You will probably have no need to go to the headquarters building, which is now behind you, across the highway. Rest rooms Are still ahead, on the tour route.

title: Birds Will Come Where Berried Plants Grow
description: There is great satisfaction in feeding the birds, yet the feeling is but a fraction of what is possible by wise planting of trees and shrubs. Birds will be drawn to natural food and nesting sites, and show their appreciation in yearround song. The:r presence deepens sensitiviies to nature's way.

title: Will You Please Be Quiet, Please?
description: In Most of these 22 short fictions, the objects of Raymond Carver's close attention are men and women out of work, or between jobs, at loose ends, confused and often terrified. If they are kids, they play hooky. Husbands and wives lie beside each other in bed, touch cautiously, retreat, feign sleep, lie, each bewildered by what has just happened and by what might happen next. The stories themselves are not at all confused; they have been carefully shaped, shorn of ornamentation and directed away from anything that might mislead. They are brief stories but by no means stark: they imply complexities of action and motive and they are especially artful in their suggestion of repressed violence.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON. CONGRESS is nearing final action on legislation that has prompted an unusual show of unity in the Long Island delegationa bill to extend the existing 12mile United States fishing zone to 200 miles. It is a very con troversial plan that, in effect, has pitted Long Island against much of the rest of the state.

title: Belfast Airport Struck by Shells
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 6 (AP)Five shells from a homemade mortar landed in Belfast's Aldergrove Airport late tonight causing damage but no casualties, officials said.

title: A Driver Returns; His Wife Worries
description: Mike Mosley has decided to end his selfimposed retirement and will return to driving Indianapolis  type cars. His comeback race will be next Sunday in Phoenix. The United States Auto Club's Championship trail at Mosley will drive an Earle  Offenhauser owned by Jerry O'Connell and prepared by Jud Phillips. The same team produced a victory in a 200mile race in Milwaukee last Augustafter which Mosley said he was through.

title: Man Held in Threat to Hit Ford Freed in West Virginia
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., March 6 (AP)  Kenneth Ferrell, accused of threatening to hit President Ford in the mouth with a persimmon fired from a slingshot, has been released from Federal custody.

title: Memories of Chukkers Past
description: WHEN I first visited the Island four decades ago, it was a place that contrasted markedly with the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn, where I lived at the time. The farther we got from home, the more the brick houses and concrete streets were replaced with treelined open areas and dirt roads. And it took hours for my father to drive our Moon auto to our destinationthe polo fields along Jericho Turnpike in Nassau County.

title: Congress Acts To Watch Over Sales of Arms
description: Congress is nearing final approval of a bill dramatically strengthening Congressional oversight of the sales and gifts of military equipment to foreign countries. Because such transactions are an important aspect of American foreign policy, legislation represents a significant new assertion of Congress's desire to be involved in foreignaffairs decisionmaking

title: SoHo Group Tries To Buy Its Building
description: Sixteen tenants rented eight lofts In a sevenstory building on the eastern edge of SoHo between September, 1974 and January, 1975. Each tenant gave the landlord an $800 deposit, and paid rents of at least $350 a month until the following August.

title: Tom Paine and Revolutionary America
description: For a while, in this century, the story of our Revolution seemed to be all body and no souleconomic fact made idealistic protestations largely irrelevant when not positively misleading. But more recently the story is becoming all soul and no bodymere ideology, with no visible way of making such ghostly ideals work the machine.

title: Paper Back Talk
description: Cover story. You can't Judge a book by its cover. It's a truism for which the paperback business has little use. More than anything else it is the garb in which a new book is decked, many veteran publishers believe, that impels browsers to carry it to the checkout counter. (A classic case is the titillating cover in which New American Library draped Fear of Flying, the novel by a little known writer named Erica Jong that became one of 1974's top sellers.)

title: State Official Rules City Is Guilty of Improper Labor Practice in P.B.A. Case
description: A hearing officer of the State Public Employment Relations Board has ruled that the city was guilty of an improper labor practice when it agreed to me too clauses in fire and santitation contracts and then relied on the clauses to counter greater pay increases for police officers.

title: The Tennis Clinic
description: There is nothing more basic to success in tennis than the way a player holds the racquet. The grip determines the angle of the racquet face, where the ball is met and, most importantly, what happens when the strings make contact with the ball

title: Seller's 3 Baskets Near End Decisive
description: Rutgers remained unbeaten yesterday by defeating St. John's, 7067.

title: To Save the Economy Must We Spoil the Environment?
description: The following is adapted from a letter by Claire Stern, Executive Director of the Long island Environmental Council, to Governor Carey:

title: Motorboat Racing Gets New Professional Circuit
description: A new professional circuit motorboat racingthe American Motor Boat Racing Associationhas been formed under the direction of Rick Keller, who has been involved in the sport for the last 26 years as a driver, builder, owner and offi cial. Keller said the A.M.R.A. American Power Boat Aswill license race organizers, boat owners, drivers and crew members for a $300,000 annual 10race schedule of outboard tunnelboat races on 1mile closedcourse ovals at waterfronts throughout the country.

title: Chrysler Prunes Its Growth to Thicken Its Profits
description: DETROIT  The Chrysler Corporation's grand dream is being filed away. The vision of standing tall as one of The Big Three at home and a multinational globestraddler abroad is no more.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: ALTHOUGH the problem of windows sweating and fogging up in the winter is one that some homeowners have long been familiar with, the exceptionally cold weather we have recently experienced has brought a virtual flood of mail from homeowners (and apartment dwellers) who want to know what causes this condensation and what, if anything, they can do about it.

title: The Tale of the Impatient Diva
description: After a decade's sojourn in Germany, Tatiana Troyanos is making her Metropolitan Opera debut, this Monday, as Octavian in Der Rosenkavalier. Speaking of the decision, 10 years ago, to leave her native New York, where she was getting nowhere fast, Miss Troyanos's voice becomes loud and insistent: I had to do it, because I can get very impatient and I can't just wait for things to happen, I have to create the circumstances where I feel it's going to happen!

title: A Switch in The Politburo
description: Leonid Brezhnev, the Soviet party leader, and Prime Minister Aleksei Kosygin were able to report to the closing sessions of the 25th Communist Party Congress last week that Russian heavy industry had made significant advances.

title: The Lewis & Clark Highway: A Restorative
description: Between Missoula, Mont., and Lewiston, Idaho, stretches a jumble of mountains, rivers, lakes, hot springs and cold brilliant whitewater streams that almost stopped the explorers Lewis and Clark on their incredible journey from St. Louis to the Western sea more than 170 years ago. Today three passages thread that jumble: the old Indian Lolo foot trail; the blundering path that the Lewis and Clark expedition followed in 1805 in trying to find the snowcovered Lobo trail, and finally a constopped the explorers Lewis and Clark Highway.

title: Greed makes the world go round
description: In his brisk and opinionated way, Martin Mayer has in recent years conducted informative guided tours of our schools, banks and law offices, identifying error, venality, stupidity and professional hubris wherever he traveled. This small volume contains

title: No planet named George
description: We live in a time, largely unrecognized, of high scientific adventure and unparalleled discovery. This is the moment in history when the surface features on the planets will be discovered and named forever. A crater name represents a substantial memorial: The estimated lifetime of large lunar, Martian and Mercurian craters is measured in billions of years. How are craters and other features on the moon and planets named?

title: Editors' Choice
description: FAMILY FEELING, by Helen Yglesias. (Dial Press, $8.95.) Total portrait of a woman, her times present and past her family ties.

title: Happiness Is Too Much Trouble
description: Sandra Hochman's second novel is the latest installment in the continuing saga of the liberated New York divorcee. As followers of the genre already know, the heroine, after a privileged childhood and great success at high school (private, progressive) and college (same), moves on to analysis, the arts and a series of disastrous relationships with men. At least one lover is a certifiable lunatic, another is an incorrigible womanhater, and another is simply impossible. None of them pays her enough attention, even though, she is quick to tell us, she is sensational in bed and has a terrific sense of humor. Questions the reader is not supposed to ask: would any amount of attention satisfy this person? Are her men really so dreadful, or is she maybe not telling the whole story? Would the reader like to have her over for dinner?

title: Teterboro Cites Godfrey
description: AMONG those to be inducted into the Teterboro Aviation Hall of Fame on May 11 is Arthur Godfrey, the radioTV personality, who made Teterboro a household word back in 1952. It was then that the Federal Aviation Administration accused him of having purposely buzzed the Teterboro Airport control tower while taking off from the field.

title: SERVICE ACADEMIES HURT BY ATTRITION
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 UPI)  Students have been dropping out of the nation's service academies at nearrecord levels in recent years, according to a General Accounting Office study.

title: Linsley Price Wed To a Sabena Aide
description: Linsley Ann Price and JeanLouis Lindekens were married yesterday afternoon at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Forrest W. Price of West Hartford Conn. The Rev. Donald V. Emmel, a Presbyterian minister officiated.

title: ALBANY NOTEBOOK
description: AS Governor Carey's $10.76 billion budget inches toward its target date of March 15, Long Island legislators are waging a furious battle to restore much, if not all, of the deep cuts in suburban school aid the Governor has asked for.

title: Gail Morrison Fiancee
description: Mr. and Mrs. Bruce William Morrison of Newton Square, Pa., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Gail Thomas Morrison, to Charles Walter Rest. Mr. Rest, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Clarence E. Rest of Steubenville, Ohio, is the nephew of Mr. and Mrs. James Graham of Woodsfield, Ohio. The engaged couple are seniors at Muskingum College.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayCoach House, Kenilworth Road, Rye, N.Y. Limit, regular and children's working hunters; equitation, 8:30 A.M.

title: Pamela Griffith to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Henry Evans Griffith of Bedford Hills, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Pamela Evans Griffith, to William Trafton Simonds, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Langdon Simonds of Cambridge, Mass.

title: PALESTINIANS MOVE IN LEBANESE CLASH
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 6 Reinforcements from the Palestine Liberation Army were sent to the troubled Akkar region of northern Lebanon today, where three days of clashes were said to have left 13 people dead and 14 wounded.

title: C. NEWBOLD TAYLOR, NVESTMENT BROKER
description: C. Newbold Taylor, a former governor of the New York Stock Exchange and an investment broker for more than half ?? century, died Friday at his ??ome in Chestnut Hill, Philadel??hia. He was 82 years old.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: WHOLESALE PRICES DECLINED 0.5 PERCENT in February to 179.4 percent of the 1987 average, the Labor Department reported. It was the fourth consecutive monthly decline. Food prices dropped by 1.9 percent but industrial commodities rose by 0.3 percent ... Unemployment last month fell to 7.8 percent of the work force from 7.8 percent In January ... Orders received by manufacturers In January rose 1.9 percent to $88.4 billion, the biggest gain in the last five months.

title: Adlai Stevenson of Illinois
description: In the summer of 1952, not long after the Democratic Convention in Chicago had nominated Adlai Stevenson, a young Saturday Evening Post writer with an already established reputation for detailed, meticulous reporting showed up at the Stevenson campaign headquarters in Springfield, Ill. This was John Bartlow Martin. Presently he moved from the press office to a literary ghetto on top of the Springfield Elks Club and became one of Stevenson's best speechwriters and certainly his most reliable. His specialty was the short fiveor 10minute airport or whistlestop address; no one then, and I think none since, could make a point more succinctly, support it more sharply with evidence and then, of all things, stop. Martin repeated the performance in 1956; and, as late as 1972, while other, younger colleagues at campaign headquarters were resolving the difficult question of personnel and policy to be faced by their President in the months following the election, he was doing the same thing for George McGovern.

title: Substituting For Substitutes
