title: The inside is better than the outside
description: The Statue of Liberty is 90 this year. Since its unveiling in Octobet 1886, it has aroused more intense emotions in more people than any other work of art in America, perhaps any other work anywhere. Most of this feeling was concentrated in the first third of Liberty's existence, the decades when millions of immigrants sailed past her into the gateway of the New World. From slums, villages and ghettos, from poverty, ignorance and tyranny, the huddled masses of Europe found themselves saluted at the end of their journey across the sea by the upraised arm of Liberty Welcome to Freedom!

title: Tennis Permits on Sale Tomorrow
description: Tennis permits for the outdoor season go on sale tomortow, the Parks Department says. It previously announced the date as last Wednesday, The season on the city's 527 courts opens April 10. Adult permits are $27.50, Junior (18 years and under) $6 and senior (62 and older) $15. Permits may be obtained at all department borough offices. Passportsize photographs are required and proof of age for Juniors and seniors.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Continued from Page 12

title: Apples Are Delicious for Home Orchards
description: If you are going to plant even one apple tree, be sure to choose a variety that is ghod to eat. It is foolish to choose mediocrity. The northeastern section of North America, with a perfect climate for apples, has produced some of the best tasting apples in history.

title: No More Misunderstandings
description: Craig Claiborne's $4,000 dinner for two in Paris was an experience that will not be repeated, at least by American Express. Asked to donate a dinner for New York City's Channel 5 Lights! Camera! Auction! benefit, American Express agreed but this time, the sky is not the limit.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: Yet, from a practical point of view, all of these complex words can be ignored and the world of closeup photography can be an interesting and uncomplicated means of extending camera work for anyone. It can be done at one's leisure, indoors or out, by young or old and permits one to be as creative as he or she wishes.

title: Banker to Marry Caroline Campbell
description: Caroline Cary Campbell of Cambridge, Mass., an administrative assistant in the alumni office of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, and Peter B. Edwards of Dover, Mass., a loan analyst with the First National Bank of Boston, plan to be married June 19 at the Westover School in Middlebury, Conn.

title: Chirac Owens Drive for Giscard Against French Left
description: NICE, France, March 27Prime Minister Jacques Chirac, in his new official role as chief protagonist for the administration of President Valery CTiscard d'Estaing, opened a nationwide campaign today to convince the French that if the leftist opposition gained national power, the result would be permanent crisis.

title: At an Argentine Party After the Coup
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 27 This was the first weekend after the military coup, and the collapse of the threeyearold Peronist government gave a special glow to the sumptuous dinner parties that still make upperclass Argentines the social lions of Latin America.

title: letters to the editor
description: Dear Rosedale: Some years ago I planted a Lilac in my yard and it bloomed beautifully for the first few seasons, however in recent years It has very few or no flowers. What can I do to bring back the flowers?

title: Feminists Say Carey Reneged On Campaign Pledges to Women
description: A Democratic faction of the New York State Women's Political Caucus criticized Governor Carey yesterday for what it described as his failure to fulfill his campaign promises regarding women.

title: Neil Hazard Fianoe Of Lynne A Binder
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edward B. Binder of Eastchester, N.Y., and New Milford, Conn., have announced the engagement of the daughter, Lynne Ann Binder, to Neil Livingstone Hazard, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Sprague Hazard of Chevy Chase. Md.

title: Aviva Comet Plans Bridal
description: The engagement of Aviva Lynn Comet and. Robert Mark Murciano has been announced by their parents, Mr. and Mrs. Israel Comet of Beechwood, Ohio, and Rabbi and Mrs. M. Asher Murciano of the Bronx.

title: PEOPLE
description: Friends of Jane Englehard pay no attention to the calendar or the temperature to acknowledge the coming of spring. To them, that happy event is marked by the return of the widow of Charles W. Englehard, the millionaire industrialist, to her estate, Cragmore, in Far Hills. Any day now, she'll be back from wintering in Florida and plunge immediately into preparations for The Cliffhangers Ball, a gala benefit at the Newark Museum to finance restoration the first floor of the museum's annex, Ballantine House.

title: In Summary
description: The rapid disintegration of Lebanon, a multireligious state once an island of stability in the Middle East, continues. Syria still appears to be the only party able to influence events, but even that country's leaders have been unable to stop the bloodshed or to impose a ceasefire.

title: LISBON IS FINISHING ITS NEW CHARTER
description: LISBON, March 25Portuguese legislators are putting the finishing touches on the country's new constitution which, as it stands, is the most advanced charter in Western Europe in the defense of human rights and the economic and social rights of workers.

title: What's Doing in PARIS
description: OUTDOOR LIFEParis remains a moveable feast, in Hemingway's phrase, and the best way to enjoy it is to move around a lot. Walking is recommended; from a centrally located hotel you'll be able to make forays in all directions. Firsttime visitors needn't be ashamed to take a halfday tour of major sites for general orientation before going off on their own. For a quick, allencompassing look, try the $9 Cityrama tour or choose a tour of either historical Paris ($6.50), modern Paris (same prise) or Left Bank sites with a motorboat cruise along the Seine ($12.50). Departures are from 3 Boulevard des Capucines and other points; ask a travel agent or hotel porter. The newest feature of old Paris is that the (blighted) elm trees of the Place des Vosges have been removed. Controversy rages as to whether to replace them in the name of nature or keep the square without trees, as it was when Henri TV designed it as a formal promenade and tournament ground. For the moment, visitors can take advantage of the void to admire this extraordinary ensemble of townhouses as no one has been able to see them for generations. (Automobiles parked around the square look more out of place now than ever.

title: New Trial in Coast Slaying
description: SALINAS, Calif., March 27 (UPI)The second trial of Inez Garcia for slaying a man she said helped another man rape her is scheduled to start June 28. She was convicted of seconddegree murder Oct. 4, 1974, but won a reversal on appeal, and is free on bail.

title: Roth Wins $100,000 St. Louis Bowling
description: ST. LOUIS, March 27 (AP)Mark Roth captured his second title when he defeated Larry Laub today in the nationally televised championship of a $100,000 Professional Bowlers Association open tournament. The topseeded Staten Island, N.Y., bowler's 235202 victory over Laub earned him $14,000 in prize money. Roth, 24 years old, won a P.B.A. tournament in Kansas City a year ago.Roth clinched the victory when he threw strikes from the sixth frame into the first ball of the 10th frame. Laub of San Francisco won $8,000 for finishing second, Tim Harahan of Woodland Hills, Calif., earned $6,000 for third place, Earl Anthony of Tacoma, Wash., took $5,000 for fourth and 18yearold Randy Lightfoot of St. Charles, Mo., won $4,000 for fifth.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: The Asharoken village insignia portrayed on the shoulder patch shown in the Long Island Section on March 7 is, in fact, a typical Rube Goldberg illustration: the feather bonnet identified the figure on the patch as an 18th or 19thcentury Plains Indian a member of a culture distinct (as well as geographically and chronologically separate) from that of the eastern coastal Algonquians, the cultural division to which the Indian Asharoken and all coastal New York Indians of the 17th century belonged.

title: Lou Wyncia Hibbard Thenebe Fiancee of Warren W. Clute 3d
description: Mrs. H. Hibbard Thenebe of Little Moose Lake in Old Forge, N. Y., formerly of Bedford, N. Y., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Lou Wyncia Hibbard Thenebe, to Warren Wakeman Clute 3d, son of Mr. Clute Jr. of Rose Hill Farm, Watkins Glen, N. Y., and the late Elizabeth Johnston Clute.

description: Dr. Nancy Cooke, a resident in internal medicine at Barnes Hospital in St. Louis, was married last evening to Dr. Stephen A. Liebhaber who is doing cancer research at the Washington University Medical School in St. Louis under a grant from the National Institutes of Health.

Leonide Massine's Parade and Twvla Tharp's Deuce Coupe

title: Home Clinic
description: Q: The paint on the exterior of our cinder block and concrete house on the ocean is flaking and we plan to repaint. Should we use a primer, and what kind of paint should Nu_ use? Is there a best method of application? J. H. K., Bronx, N. Y.

title: Egypt Begins a Hurried Search To Add to Sources of Weapons
description: WASHINGTON, March 27The Egyptian Government has begun a hurried, almost frantic search for equipment to maintain its Sovietmade arms and for new weaponry to replace Russian materiel.

title: Scientists Discover Wreck of Ironclad Sunk in Civil War
description: HOUSTON, March 27Wan the help of a magnetometer, which helps scientists measure the fluctuation in the earth's magnetic field, a group of amateur explorers has located the wreck of a United States naval vessel sunk 113 years ago during the Civil War in the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Ox Ridge Show Set For June: 1620 Run
description: The Ox Ridge Hunt Club Horse Show, one of the leading events in the East each year has been scheduled for June 16 through 20. David M. Wright and Bill Williams have been named cochairmen of the show, and Richard Hodgson is the new presidebt of the club. In addition, there is a new manager, Sam Register.

title: Prostitutes to Be Jailed
description: FAIRBANKS, Alaska. March 27 (AP)The Fairbanks City Council has approved a measure requiring a mandatory jail sentence of 60 days for persons convicted of prostitution in this pipeline boom town. The new ordinance ruled out a suspended sentence, probation or parole until the term is served.

description: O Muses of Poetry and Prose! Has the spirit of right speaking departed from your domain?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: After reading East Side Porn Is Upwardly Mobile (Feb. 22], an inspired business enterprise took shape in my mind.

PHILADELPHIA, March 27When the Rutgers and Michigan starters gathered at the centerjump circle for the start of today's National Collegiate Atheletic Association championship game, Phil Sellers smiled and waved at the Rutgers loyalists on a nearby Spectrum slope among the 17,540 spectators. Nobody realized it then. but Phil Sellers might as well have been waving goodbye to what had been an undefeated basketball season for the Scarlet Knights, unbeaten in 31 previous games. As it turned out, Phil Sellers's wave was about the most coordinated effort that Rutgers produced in an 8670 loss to Michigan.

title: Forman: Casting Is Everything
description: Maybe his name is not yet being mispronounced over cocktails quite as often as Lina Wertmuller's, but undeniably Milos Forman has become, as critic Andrew Sarris puts it (speaking for the majority), important, very, a brilliant satirist who finds ircny in unfunny situations more precisely than anybody now directing. Of course Forman was doing that long before anybody was dropping his name, since his early films, made in his native Czechoslovakia in the early 60's, films like Loves of a Blonde and The Firemen's Ball, which acquired critical praise but no profits, and his first American movie, Taking Off, a wry tribute to flower children, which acquired neither.

title: Michigan Stops Rutgers, 8670, and Indiana Beats UC.L.A.
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 27 Rutgers attempt at a perfect basketball season ended abruptly and in shocking fashion today, but Indiana kept its record unblemished and moved to within one victory of the National Collegiate title.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: N a recent discussion, a New York economist ventured the opinion that 1976 was going to be a dull year for the simple reason that the American economy seemed certain to proceed steadily and solidly upward, with unemployment and inflation holding steady or tending slightly downward.

title: SeaLimit Pact Signed By India and Sri Lanka
description: NEW DELHI, March 27India and Sri Lanka signed this week an agreement on their maritime boundaries, making them, according to officials here, the first nations in the world to accept the concept of an economic zone of 200 miles from the coastline.

title: Britons Wrangle While They Ihch To Metric System
description: LONDON, March 27 (AP)A behindthescenes wrangle in Parliament indicates that Britons are clinging to their pounds, ounces, feet and inchesafraid of a planned conversion to the metric system.

title: Letters
description: The naming of the solar system's extraterrestrial features (No planet named George by Carl Sagan, March 7) is a prodigious moneymaking opportunity. Our lunar orbiter satellites have already photographed more craters, mountains, canyons and huge boulders than there are Americans. The most spectacular of these should, of course, honor mankind's great thinkers and doers. But after immortalizing everyone in Who's Who and Who Was Who, what do we do about naming the other hundreds of millions of features? Sell the naming rights! The proceeds could be used for any number of worthy projects: paying for the space program, aiding the underdeveloped world, trying to find a cure for cancer, etc. I'm sure the geopolitical problems of implementing this scheme are formidable, but it worth a try?

title: Polish Premier Predicts Some Food Price Increases
description: WARSAW, March 27 (AP)Prime Minister Piotr Jaroszewicz told the newly elected Parliament today that food price increases were in the offing.

title: Michael Sargent Fiance Of Jennifer C. Hoagland
description: Mrs, Joseph C. Hoagland Jr. of WEllshington has announced the engagement of their daughter, Jennifer C. Hoagland, to Michael D. Sargent, son of Mr. and Mrs. , George K. Sargent Jr. of iaridgehampton, L. I., and Greenwich, Conn. A wedding in June is planned.

title: Peru Ousts 6 Major Editors In Apparent Move on Far Left
description: LIMA, Peru, March 27 (Reuters)Peru's military Government has dismissed the editors of six national newspapers and told their replacements to print more balanced and less alarmist news.

title: West Siders March, Vow Rent Strikes Will Be Continued
description: Tenants and representatives of tenants groups on the West Side vowed at a march and rally yesterday to maintain and support current and incipient rent strikes in MitchellLama housing developments to block enforcement of rent increases that range from 40 percent to 119 percent.

title: DINING OUT
description: LA COQUILLE is a very subtle restaurant. It succeeds by paying careful attention to every detail. The atmosphere of quiet finesse is gracious and relaxing. Like the confident performer who underplays his rule there is no need to show off here.

title: TRENTON NOTEBOOK
description: STATE Assemblyman Carl A. Orechio of Nutley is proposing an annual twomonthlong hiatus in government. Under Assembly Bill 151which is one of more than 500 bills, resolutions and so forth that the 61yearold Republican is sponsoring this yearno public agency will be able to hold any hearings or meetings take any action during the months of July and August.

title: Sylvia Miles Doesn't Attend Every Party She Just Seems. To
description: It seems as if she is always there, at all of the openings and the parties and the screenings, her thick streaked blond lion's mane slightly disheveled, her dresses cut low, a handsome young escort at her side.

title: 101 Hounds to Race in Coursing Opener
description: The lure field trial, or coursing, season in the East gets under way next weekend, When 101 hounds will compete on the grounds of the Vale Vue Kennels in West Chester, Pa. The meet is being sponsored by the Delaware Valley Afghan Hound Club and the Borzoi Club of Delaware Valley we havg dogs corning frain states; saidl Ann Filetti of West Chester who Was eleeted a director of the Amercan Sighthound Field Assoeiation two weeks ago at its annual meeting in Las Vegas, Nev.

title: Pension Fund Risks for Public Employees
description: WASHINGTONIn a room in the Cannon building, one of the House office buildings on Capitol Hill, a small task force is quietly investigating the thousands of pension funds that cities and states have created for the benefit of millions of public employees.

title: Gulfstrearn Race To Step Forward
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., March 27 (AP)Step Forward, who set a track record two weeks ago in the Appleton Handicap, set another one today as he captured the $67,200 Canadian Turf Handicap at Gulfstream.

title: Anne Matheson DuBosque Fiancee
description: Mr. and Mrs. Hutchinson DuBosque of Laurel Hollow, Syosset, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Anne Matheson DuBosque, to Peter Deme of Silver Spring, Md. He is a son of Anna Sykora of Nove Zamky, Czechoslovakia, and of Dr. Alexander Deme, a federal judge in Czechoslovakia and also of Nove Zamkv.

description: When the Juilliard Quartet sits down to a session of woodshedding (which, as every string player knows, means a workout in which tact is not an overriding consideration), the conversational drift, between bursts of playing, runs as follows:

title: U.S. and Scotland Gain Curling Final
description: DULUTH. Minn., March 27 (UPI)  The United States, represented by the Bruce Roberts Rink of Hibbing, Minn., will meet Scotland tomorrow in the title game of the silver broom world curling championships at the Duluth Arena.

title: CAREY ASKS FUNDS FOR MORE AUDITORS
description: ALBANY, March 27Governor Carey yesterday formally asked the Legislature to restore a $2.2 million appropriation for a special team of nursinghome auditors that the two houses deleted from the budget last week.

title: Specs O'Keefe, Informant In Brink's Robbery, Dies
description: LOS ANGELES, March 27 (AP)  Joseph J. (Specs) O'Keefe, who led the Federal Bureau of Investigation to the other members of the gang in the widely publicized 1950 Brink's robbery in Boston, has died in a West Coast hospital under a false name. He was 67 years old.

title: ART
description: THE 20th Century has witnessed the assimilation of the artist into society. Although he was once an outsider living on the fringes of the social fabric as a strange romantic or curious bohemian. he is now as much a part of everyday activities as the businessman lawyer or doctor.

title: A Whole. Lot of Pickin
description: THE mall of the. MidIsland Shopping Plaza will be filled with the unaccustomed sounds of banjos, mandolins, fiddles and guitars on Saturday, when, musicians will gather from five states to lake part in what is billed as the First Annual Long Island Bluegrass and OldTime Country Music Band Contest. The bands will include two from Queensthe Yankee Rebels and Swamp Opera  and Groundspeed from Bethpage and the Foxfire Four from Northport.

title: Gargoyle Family Dying Out
description: Those ersatz gargoyles glaring down on Lexington Avenue and 49th Street from the Shelton Towers Hotel spout water and scare no passersby.

title: Guide to Basement Sump Pumps
description: When spring thaws, combined in many cases with heavy spring rains, causes a basement flooding problem, one of the most obvious solutions that occurs to many homeownersparticularly if the problem is a persistently recurring cneis the installation of a basement pump that will automatically pump water out as fast as it seeps in. Fortunately, a wide variety of these specialpurpose pumps are readily available, either for installation in a recessed sump (a paved or lined pit in the cellar floor), or merely on top of the basement floor at what seems to be its lowest point (where water tends to puddle or accumulate).

title: South Africa Withdraws Its Last Troops Froth Angola
description: RUACANA, Angola, March 27, (Reuters)South African troops completed their withdrawal from Angola today, pulling back into SouthWeit Africa after their Intervention in the Aneolan civil war.

title: FollowUp on The News
description: Two years ago, on March 22, 1974, Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state anticorruption prosecutor, announced the indictment of two Brooklyn lawyers on charges of conspiring to bribe an unnamed State Supreme Court justice to fix an attempted murder case.

title: 40 STUDENTS END BRIDGEPORTSITIN
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., March 27Forty black students protesting the costcutting dismissal of the University of Bridgeport's only AfroAmerican history instructor ended a 24hour occupation of the university president's office yesterday, but said they were looking into possible legal action to save the instructor's Job.

title: The Villain On Cuba TV: C.I.A. Man
description: HAVANA, March 27 (Reuters)The camera zooms in on a man on the run as he dives behind a palm tree for the final shootout while the music's tempo is stepped up and viewers hold their breath.

title: Music in Review
description: Mark Westcott, a pianist trained largely at Oberlin College and the Eastman School of Music in Rochester, ave his New York debut recital in Town Hall last Monday night. Obviously an experienced performer who has toured extensively and won awards, he took a quite individual view of the music he played. He had the technique to make his ideas clear, so that the result was an evening bf interpretations that were Intriguing if sometimes questionable.

description: P.G.A. GOLF.

title: Rangers Outscore Black Hawks, 6 to
description: CHICAGO, March 27 (AP) Steve Vickers goal late in the second period tonight proved to be the winner as the New York Rangers outlasted the slumping Chicago Black Hawks, 65, in a National Hockey League game.

Eve; since he left Overbrook High School, a few minutes away in North Philly, five years ago, when he was recruited by U.C.L.A. carrying the tag as the best prep guard in the entire country.

title: Fund Grants $20 Million To Wildlife Conservation
description: MORGES, Switzerland, March 27 (Reuters)The World Wildlife Fund has made grants worth $20 million to 1,448 projects in 80 couhtriesto establish wildlife conservation parks and finance training and research; the fund has announced.

title: CHESS
description: The sixth annual Louis D. Statham mastersplus tournament in Lone Pine, Calif., was notable this year for producing a great number of fighting games. With an $8,000 first prize at stakes, very few of the 36 entrants were charitable in offering or accepting draws.

title: the Death of Yury Galanskov
description: Not since the Paris of Hemingway. Pound and Joyce has so much talent been invested in small presses in every country of the world. The modern small presses publish because of enlightened individualism or in a few instances, sheer cussedness. They also answer a variety of situations, such as political oppressionthe Russian samizdat network that nourished Solzhenitsyn_ for instance or because of commercial exclusion: the American doityourself tradition that encouraged Ana;is Nin and Stewart Brand and small press immortals such as Thomas Paine, Edgar Allan Poe, Walt Whitman, Stephen Crane, Upton Sinclair, and Carl Sandburg.

title: David Young 4th Weds Lucille Braden
description: Lucille Frances Braden of Chatham, N.J., a teacher of special education in Jersey City, was married yesterday to David Young 4th of West Caldwell, N.J., a stockbroker with Kidder, Peabody & Company in Newark.

title: Lisa McWilliams Bride of Student
description: Liza Maria McWilliams, daughter of Mr, and Mrs. Gordon W. McWilliams, was married yesterday afternoon to Richard Stewart Reynolds, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clark L. Reynolds, Both families live in Mountain Lakes. N. J.

title: 3 Leffist Guerrillas, 2 Security Guards Killed in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 27 Five personsthree leftwing guerrillas and two security guards of a Ford Motor Company engineerwere killed in separate incidents of political violence, security forces announced today.

title: The Undefeated General
description: PARIS  Lord Montgomery was Britain's greatest general since Wellington but, unlike the Iron Duke, he was distinctly unpopularat least with his peers. Generals Patton and Bradley couldn't stand him; General Eisenhower resented his criticisms and didn't think much of his skill; Lieut. Gem Hans Speidel, Rommel's chief of staff, told me:

title: A Little World
description: CARLSTADT A PACKED Hudson & Northern Valley commuter train ran through an open switch in seine busy yards here and slammed into the side of a special freight train carrying the Super Jicaltic Circus. Elephants, lions, tigers and commuters were shaken. A bemused railroad toweiman admited that he had erred. such group in the united States.

title: Answers/Questions
description: A.N., Chatham, N. J., has a yard surrounded by large shade trees and asked what fruits or vegetables can be grown in full or part shade. Very little. Possibly leafy vegetables such as lettuce, chard and spinach might grow in partial shade but fruiting crop; such as tomatoes, berries, etc. require six to eight hours at sunlight. Also tree roots would rob the vegetables of needed soil moisture and nutrients. Ed.

title: DR. PHILIPP MANECKE JR.
description: Dr. Philipp Manecke Jr., chief of staff and a surgeon at Bethany Deaconess Hospital, Brooklyn, died Friday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home in Brookville, L.I. He was 75 years old.

title: R. C. Kemper 3d And Kate B. Gill To Be Married
description: Brendan Gill, novelist and theater critic for The New Yorker magazine, and Mrs. Gill have announced the engagement of their daughter, Kate Bowen Gill, to Rufus Crosby Kemper 3d of New York, a writer.

title: PORTUGAL LIVES IN UNEASY CALM
description: LISBON, March 27In the almost two years since it made a revolution, Portugal has never been so calm as it is now, but the country seems, unable to shed the uneasy feeling that if things can go wrong they will.

title: WITNESS RECANTS IN RACIAL KILLING
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 27An unusual racial murder case in a nearby Mississippi River town has aroused the interest of civil rights activists in the New Orleans area for the first time in several years.

title: Book Ends
description: Fiction conclave. Is fiction an endangered species? Recently a panel made up of editors. agents, library and bookstore buyers and authors was summoned by the Publishers Ad Club to shed some heat upon the matter; the question of the evening was framed in the following dire terms: The future of hardcover fictionis there one? and the discussion was lively, anarchic, even passionate.

title: Pondicherry Curb Extended
description: NEW DELHI, March 27 (Reuters)The Government has extended Presidential Rule for 12 more months in Pondicherry, the former French enclave in southern India, an official statement said The small coastal territory, whose status is less than that of a full state, was placed under Presidential Rule in 1974 after its government resigned.

title: Decline in Voter Turnout Held Less Than Expected
description: WASHINGTON, March 27Participation in Presidential primary elections so far this year has declined from that of four years ago, but not by nearly so much as political scientists and other analysts had predicted.

title: New York City's Costly Tax Exemptions
description: When the next round of budgetcutting hits New York's city university and its publicschool system, will the following item remain untouched, as it has been thus far?

title: U.S. Figures on Unemployment Challenged as Low by St.. Louis
description: ST. LOUIS, March 25Cities like St. Louis have complained for years that widespread undercounting by Federal agencies results in the loss of millions of dollars the municipalities would receive otherwise.

title: Stories And Plays
description: Brian O'Nolan (alias Flann O'Brien) died in Dublin in 1966 at the age of 55 and thereby simplified the work of Heaven and History to measure and name him. In the meantime, he had given himself two other names: first, Myles na Gopaleen, from the Gaelic, meaning Little Horses but possibly much more, for everything he felt or thought or said had more than two realities, sometimes more than four. Myles na Gopaleen was the name ha put above his column in the Irish Times, which made him famous throughout Ireland as a very young man come a short distance to Dublin. For 30 years or more the column also earned him his daily bread, not to mention his pint.

title: Shih Tzu, Bulldog Gain Final
description: CHICAGO, March 27A toy performer from the East and a bulldog from the MidWest won their groups at the International Kennel Club show tonight and advanced to the final to be decided tomorrow in the International Ampitheater.

title: The House As an Office, Or Tax Time In Suburbs
description: A taxpayer got some questions from the Internal Revenue Service last year when he wrote off a $500 color television set as a business expense.

title: Great Adventure: A Boon and a Problem
description: In less than two weeks, Great Adventure  New IJersey's largest entertainment park  will open for its third and biggest season, one expected to attract 3 million visitors, provide 2,200 seasonal jobs and pump more than $100million into the state's economy.

title: COLLEGES KEEPING MOST 60'S CHANGES
description: Many of the changes that grew out of the campus turmoil of the 1960's have had lasting effects on the curriculums of American cdlleges and universities, but other academic changes have begun to fade.

title: Green Lead Rises To 4 Shots on 201
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., March 27  Hubert Green extended his lead to four strokes today in the third round of the Heritage Golf Classic, but he and his pursuers agreed the tournament was still not in the bag.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Moslem and leftist forces in Lebanon were on the move yesterday on the steep, rocky slopes of the mountains east of Beirut. Though slowmoving, this was a crucial battle that might be more important than the fighting in Beirut because it was providing the leverage that Kamal Jumblat, the Moslem leftist leader, was using in Damascus as he sought to obtain the resignation of President Suleiman Franjieh. Mr. Jumblat was also seeking much more farreaching constitutional reforms than the Chris; tian conservatives have been willing to concede. [Page 1, Column 3.] .

title: Winning at All Costs: The Fun of Games Is Fading
description: I was talking with some colleagues recently, discussing the plight of the New York Rangers, the firing of Emile Francis, etc., when one of them said, The only measure of success in hockey is winning the Stanley Cup, and since Francis couldn't win it, he should have been fired.

title: Sarah Duncan Plans Nuptials
description: Sarah Lucy Duncan and. Peter Finn, seniors at Brown University, plan to be married in June.

title: Dash Mark Again Tied By Williams
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., March 27 (AP) Steve Williams matched his worldrecord time of 9.9 seconds in the 100meter dash today despite sporadic rain that left the track wet and slippery at the Florida Relays.

title: Epilogue
description: Ruder Finn, a public relations company, has resigned the account of the Iranian national airline. The relationship has been tenuous since the disclosure earlier this year thatMarion Javits, the wife of Senator Jacob K. Javits of New York, had been hired by the agency at $67,500 a year and was working on the Iranian account.

title: Democrats Delegate Races Could Shift Power in State
description: In the Bronx, two prominent Puerto Rican politicians are matched against each other in a race to be delegates to the Democratic National Convention. In Rochester, the Mayor heads one slate, the Vice Mayor a second, and a wellregarded Assemblyman a third. Daniel Patrick Moynihan, the former United States representative to the United Nations, is on the Bronx ballot against his old friend, Representative Jonathan Bingham.

title: POLITICS
description: IT seemed like a perfect compromise to Webster B. Todd, the peaceatany price Republican state chairman: Send to the Republican National Convention an atlarge New Jersey delegation proportionally divided between supporters of President Ford and former GOV. Ronald Reagan of California. But the only problem was that Mr. Todd forgot to ask Senator Clifford P. Case if he thought it was a good idea, too.

title: Nigerian Request to Britain
description: LONDON, March 27 (Reuters)Nigria has officially asked Britain to return its former head of state, Gen. Yakubu Gowon, to answer charges of involvement in the country's recent abortive coup. A Lagos broadcast said the External Affairs Minister, Col. Joseph Garba, announced the formal request at a press conference on his return today from talks in Britain.

title: Issues for 76
description: After years of war, corrosive inflation and political scandal, the national political campaign now under way offers an opportunity of unusual importance. Americans are eager for new, inspiring leadership and for a reinvigorated sense of confidence in the nation's public policies.

title: Walter Brewster Jr., a Lawyer, And Joanne Terenzio Are Wed
description: Joanne Terenzio and Walter Rice Brewster Jr. were married yesterday afternoon in St. Patrick's Cathedral, where Terence Cardinal Cooke performed the ceremony at the main altar.

description: THEATER

title: The First Real Test Is Wednesday
description: What kind of year 1976 will be for labor negotiations may be determined at midnight this Wednesday when the nationwide master agreement covering 450,000 truck drivers expires. A strike or an expensive settlement could upset the Ford Administration's hopes, high only a few days ago, for relative amity and no inflationary wage explosion in the crowded collective bargaining schedule for this Presidential year.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: The article by Lee Dembart on the Holiday House food at Garden State Parkway service areas (Feb. 1) got me hot under the palate, since it raised suppressed memories.

title: $2 Million in Wines Sold
description: LONDON, March 27 (UPI)The greatest sale of vintage, Bordeaux wines of this century netted almost $2 million at its close yesterday, with 360,0001 bottles changing hinds in two days.

title: Milburn, Oldfield Triumph
description: IRVING, Tex., March 27Rod Milburn return to his winning ways iri the high hurdles and Brian Oldfield continued to dominate the shotput at an International Track Association meet held under difficult conditions tonight at Texas Stadium.

description: The accuracy of tests performed for doctors and hospitals by some clinical laboratories has been called into question by evidence presented to support legislation to extend Federal regulation of such laboratories.

title: New Twist On Tornadoes
description: HIGHTSTOWP THE Weather Bureau said there were no tornadoes in New Jersey last Sunday. A lot of the bureau reported, just like there is almost every year at the time of the vernal equinox, but no twisters.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Feed roses and evergreens, especially rhododendrons, azaleas, and young fruit trees.  Rake mat of winter debris from lawns, feed and lime if needed.  Indoors start tomatoes, marigolds and zinnias.  Outdoors, plant peas, lettuce, spinach, radish.

title: LEO STRAUSS
description: Leo Strauss, who formerly operated Strauss Quality Toys on Fifth Avenue, died Friday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 90 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: House Leader Bids Ford Explain Intentions on Cuba
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (AP)The House majority leader, Representative Thomas P. O'Neill, said today that President Ford either is threatening Cuba for partisan purposes or is leading this nation into a military showdown that he has neither explained nor justified.

title: Here's Your Hat, What's. Your Hurry?
description: WE went over to Lawrence the other Saturday night to visit with friends and relatives. It was a delightful night out until it came time to go home. That's where I and my wife had our usual difference of opinion.

title: 2 Boeings Bought by Angola Are Delivered After Delay
description: LUANDA, Angola, March 27 Two 737 jet airliners pur(Agence FrancePresse)  Two 737 jet airliners purchased by the Angolan Government were delivered here this week.

title: SHOP TALK
description: HAND  EMBROIDERED linen handkerchiefs from the Madeira Islands and colorful straw baskets from the Philippines are just a few of the aroundtheworld offerings at Stone's Linen Shop in Princeton.

title: Udall Defends Humphrey Against Carter
description: MADISON, Wis., March 27Representative Morris K. Udall sought today to use against Jimmy Carter an attack by Mr. Carter on Senator Hubert H. Humphrey.

title: Shaw, Montgomery Naber Swim to Second Titles
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., March 27Tim Shaw, Jim Montgomery and John Naber are favored to win Olympic swimming titles four months from now in Montreal. Tonight, they moved toward that goal by winning their second titles in the 53d annual National Collegiate championships.

title: Suits Take On a Vested Interest
description: Zeke Rose, a partner in a small business in New York, is in his early 40's. Earlier this year, he bought the first suit he has ever owned that came with a vest. It was strictly by chance.

title: Hunt Glad to Drive For McLaren Team
description: Based on what has already happened this, season, today's historymaking Grand Prix race through the streets of Long Beach, Calif., shapes up as a battle between reigning world champion Niki Lauda of Austria and James. Hunt of England. Hunt feels that Ferrarishod Lauda is the man to beat. The course is designed to suit Ferrari, with a slow corners and tremendous acceleration areas after the corners, said Hunt. Given a car that is working well, Niki will be tough because he is driving so well. Its that hardtofind combination of a car that is working well and a driver who is going well.

title: Ski Ballet to Miss Post
description: TELLURIDE,. Colo., March 27 (UPI)Marion Post of Averill Park, N.Y., increased her season's winnings to $23,280 with firstplace finish in the ballet event of the world trophy freestyle ski meet today. Tony Sgro of Medford, Mass., won the men's ballet.

title: Getting out
description: Anyone who's lived in the cityreally lived in it, that is not just visited, or done a stintknows New York is a special place. Since the day my plane set down at LaGuardia, having sped me fresh from college, and the cherry blossoms of Washington, I was sure I could live nowhere else. New York made promises of grandeur. I would be a writer. Like others before me, I would splash in the waters of the Plaza fountain at 5 A.M. New York would be my kingdom and I its princess and its pauper both. Gifted, idealistic, I would live like an artist and also drink champagne. New York seemed big enough to allow for contradictions.

description: DURING me late 1960's and early 1970's, many homes in suburban New Jersey were built alumiJersey were num electric wiring instead of the traditional copper, primarily because of the skyrocketing costs of copper. Although this is completely legal and does not violate any code or building regulation, some homes wired in this manner have had problems with connections that have worked loose at wall outlets and switches.

title: Photos of Women in Prison Exhibited
description: Photographers, visitors and former prisoners crowded into a purple houseboat to sip wine, greet friends and admire an exhibition of photographs from a women's orison.

title: Knicks Top Celtics,105103
description: Earl Monroe, with his magic moves in full splendor last night, scored on a driving 12foot baseline jump shot with 44 seconds left as the Knicks edged the Boston Celtics, 105103, at Madison Square Garden.

title: This Week in Sports
description: The Harlem Globetrotters will play an exhibition at the Nassau Coliseum today at 2 o'clock. The Nets are at the Coliseum at 8 P.M. Friday against the Kentucky Colonels. The Knicks play two games in Madison Square Garden, Tuesday night at 7;30 against the Phoenix Suns and Sunday night at 8 o'clock against the Kansas City Kings.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Quail Shooting in Georgia
description: ARLINGTON, Ga. Have you ever shot with a preacher? asked Bobby Newberry, a guide, as we drove through a portion of the 1,000acre Quail Country preserve operated by his uncle, Tommy Newberry.

title: Auto Dealer's Fund Will Sort Friends From Enemies
description: The day is not too terribly far off, says Ed Mullane, a Ford dealer from Bergenfield, N.J., when we'll start rewarding our political friendsand taking care of the worst of the rest.

title: Nancy Mitford
description: If every literate Englishmanand many Americanscan tell you exactly what happened to the seven Mitford children, this is largely through the efforts of Nancy, the eldest child, who immortalized the family in her fifth novel, The Pursuit of Love, which sold a million copies. In England, at any rate, it is common knowledge that Unity became a Nazi, fell in love with Hitler and shot herself at the outbreak of war, dying in a confused state with a bullet still in her brain in 1948; that Jessica became a Communist and ran away to fight the Spanish Civil War with Esmond Romilly, a nephew of Winston Churchill; that Debo became the Duchess of Devonshire, and Diana spent the war in prison after marrying Britain's top Fascist, Sir Oswald Mosley.

title: GARDENING
description: THE earliest of the indispensable little species of tulips, tulipa kaufmanniana, joined snowdrops and all the other prespring bloomers among the hardy bulbs that began to poke up out of the ground during that midFebruary rehearsal for spring. All together, with the addition of a very few early daffodils, they make quite a show at the very beginning of spring, a time when most New Jersey gardens are still bare.

title: Alou's Son, 17, Drowns
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, March 27 (AP) A son of former major league baseball player, Felipe Alou, drowned Iast night in a swimming pool here. The 17yearold, apparently suffered stomach congestion while swimming. His body was found by a group of schoolmates.

title: Neal Sher Fiance Of Anne Masters
description: Mr. and Mrs. Peter F. Masters of Bethesda. Md., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Anne Masters, to Neal M. Sher, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Sher of Queens Village, Queens. The wedding is Planned for next month.

title: Vote Increases Gandhi Majority To TwoThirds in Upper House
description: NEW DELHI, March 27Prime Minister In'ira Gandhi's Congress Party regained its twothirds majority in the upper house of Parliament today, thus, giving her the longneeded legislative support to push through constitutional changes.

title: Beams Appoints 2 to Bench
description: State Senator A. Frederick Meyerson, a Brooklyn Democrat, has been appointed by Mayor Beame to the city's Criminal Court and Anthony M. Petrosini of Staten Island, a lawyer in private practice, to Family Court. Both judges, filling unexpired terms, will be paid $42,451 A year. Governor Carey has ordered a special election April 27 to fill the vacancy caused by Mr. Meyerson's appointment.

title: Benefit to Aid Retarded
description: Proceeds from a fashion show and dinner on Saturday aboard a United Airlines 747 jet liner at John F. Kennedy International Airport will go to the Association for the Help of Retarded Children. Tickets to the event, sponsored by Clipped Wings, an organization of former United stewardesses, are $20 each. They can be obtained from Mrs. Alvin Napack, 885 Park Avenue.

title: PANEL CRITICIZES 3 GATEWAY PLANS
description: The Gateway Citizens Coin mittee, a private group of civic leaders and organizations, has assailed three recent alternative proposals for the development of the $92 million Gateway National Recreation Area advanced by the National Park Service.

title: Guild in a Tentative Pact With Press Wire Service
description: United Press International and the Wire Service Guild reached tentative agreement on a contract early yesterday, The Associated Press, reported., The guild said it would recommend that the contract be rejected because of what it called deficiencies in union security and pension provisions.

title: Headliners
description: Daniel J. Evans, the Governor of the state of Washington, will not seek a fourth term. He says he is leaving political life because I love my family more. Governor Evans has a reputation as a political maverick, originally earned when he ran for Governor on the Republican ticket in 1964 and won by disassociating himself from the campaign of the party's Presidential nominee, Barry Goldwater. Mr. Evans nonetheless served as keynote speaker at the 1968 Republican national convention. Last January President Ford named him one of eight qualified potential running mates, but Governor Evans says he will probably not make himself available as a VicePresidential candidate.

title: Delta State Takes 2d A.I.A..W. Title
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., March 27A severe thunderstorm warning did not deter 6,200 spectators from attending the final of the Association of Intercollegiate Athletics for Women championships last night at the Penn State University Recreation Center.

title: Paying for Prime Time
description: Pay Television, which has always been long on promise and short on fulfillment, may be making some strides.

title: 45 India Wedding Guests Die
description: PUNE, India, March 27 (AP) A wedding turned into tragedy when a tractordrawn wagon jammed with revelers plunged into a canal, killing at least 45 persons last night.

title: Into the Ring, and Just About Out
description: MONTGOMERY, AlaIt might be a bit premature to pronounce for all time the end of Gov. George C. Wallace as a political force, but his most passionate supporter would find it frustrating to argue that Mr. Wallace's political fortunes have not been severely modified by his losses in the Florida and North Carolina Presidential primaries, losses made more wounding for having been inflicted by another Southerner, Jimmy Carter.

title: The Advisors
description: One year before the Cuban Missile Crisis erupted, before those 14 days in October, 1962, when Soviet and American policymakers led us to the brink of thermonuclear war, President Kennedy described the ironic reality of scientific progress to the General Assembly of the United Nations: Every man, woman, and child lives under a nuclear sword of Damocles, hanging by the slenderest of threads, capable of being cut at any moment by accident, miscalculation, or madness.

title: DINING OUT
description: IT'S such an obvious fact that a lot of people, including reviewers, tend to forget it: One's opinion of a restaurant is colored considerably by the distance required to get there. For example, take the Seafarer. For someone who lives nearby, it's not too bad; informal, corny nautical decor, soso food, take it cr leave it.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's televition programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Engagements
description: Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Levine of Douglastnn, N.Y., announce the engagement of their daughter Andrea Ellen to Barry J. Bloomfield, son or Mr. and Mrs. S. Bloomfield of Brooklyn, N.Y. An August wedding is planned.

title: Susan Chaffee Bride in Bryn Mawr
description: Susan Chaffee, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Howard Chaffee of Telford, Pa., and Spencer V. Silverthorne 3d, son of Mrs. Spencer V. Silverthorne of Haverford, Pa., and the late Mr. Silverthorne Jr. of Scarsdale and Beaver Falls, N. Y., were married yesterday at noon.

title: MaryJo Romeo to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Louis R. Romeo of New Hyde Park, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, MaryJo Romeo, to Thomas Patrick Joyce, a junior at St. John's University and son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Paul Joyce of Williston Park, L. 1. Miss Romeo, a graduate of the Katharine Gibbs School here, is a secretary at the National Bank of North America in Wit Hempstead, L. I.

title: SADAT URGES DRIVE TO BUILD ECONOMY
description: CAIRO, March 27 (Reuters)President Anwar elSadat today predicted five more lean years for Egypt and urged his people to copy the Germans after World War II in rebuilding the economy.

title: Just Who Visits the Metropolitan Museum
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, a cultural mainstay for New York City residents, is a formidable tourist attraction as well. According to a recent survey by an opinion research firm, half of the 85,000 people who visit the Metropolitan weekly are from outside the city's five boroughs. These visitors are about equally divided between those from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, and those from the rest of the United States or abroad:

title: The Theodore White of the interim
description: In the current era of political reform, Presidential nomination campaigns begin early. At one time it was a confession of weakness for candidates to go out on the hustings too regularly or too soon. Now, two years of continual work is not enough, and even four years of advance politicking, the equivalent of one full term in office, is not remarkable. And where Presidential politics goes, can books about Presidential politics be far behind? In the days of the old politics, reanalyses of the past year's events could be expected to appear about six to nine months after the November election. Under the new politics. they come six to nine months beforehand.

title: 3YearOlds at Work
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., March 27This Florida, this sceptered saridspit, this is where old crocks retire to soak their bones in sunshine, where ballplayers come to sweat illgotten gains off the waistline, where young horses are taught the lessons they must learn before setting out to seek the Holy Grail in Kentucky, Maryland and New York. There are horses of all ages here at Gulfstream Park; but the ones that command attention at this season are those that turned 3 on New Year's Day, for only 3yearolds are eligible . for the Kentucky Derby, the Preakpess and the Belmont Stakes, the series a horie must win to earn the Triple Crown.

title: The end of CloudCuckooLand
description: The direct route from Angola to Rhodesiathe new battlefield in southern Africaruns through Zambia, which today lies at the most dangerous crossroads on the continent. Its southern border, the Zambezi River, forms a kind of MasonDixon line between blackruled and whiteruled Africathe free north and the unfree south. The crossing of the Zambezi below the famous Victoria Fallsknown to Africans as the smoke that thundersmarks the penultimate stage of the march of free Africa: first Rhodesia and then, finally, South Africa.

title: Step Right Up, Folks, and Hire Yourselves a Lawyer
description: IN merry old England, wealthy young men entered the practice of law more out of a sense of public duty than as a means of earning a livelihood. As a result, many of the mores of upperclass British society permeated the lawyer's code of conduct in both his professional and personal life.

title: Fear Over a Loss of Privileges Said to Have Hurt E. R. A Vote
description: Fears that the equal rights amendment might take away privileges women now have and might force men and women to share public toilets were believed by opponents of the measure to have influenced their vote most during the last statewide election.

description: Today  Greater N.Y. Bullmastiff Society specialty match, Holiday Inn, Route 303, Orangeburg. N.Y.: entries from 11 A.M. judging noon.

description: The city's welfare union, has offered proposals to redeploy staff members and reorganize operations. These changes, the union's president estimated conservatively, could cut the number of ineligible people on the relief rolls from 14 to 4 percent.

title: PedalingFun on 2 Wheels
description: BICYCLING is as popular a pastime and sport as ever, but sales are down to half of their 1973 peak, when 15.3 milliorr new bikes hit the roads, half of them expensive 10speed jobs.

title: Deane Ungerleider to Be Bride Of Timothy A. Springer in May

title: CAPITAL'S SUBWAY JAMMED IN DEBUT
description: WASHINGTON, March 27Washingtonians lined up by the thousands today for free rides on a short inaugural stretch of the Metro, the city's new subway system. By afternoon, the unexpected throng was overloading the cars and causing delays throughout the system.

title: Messersmith Is Market Key
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 27None of them can make the double play or hit to right field, but they are probably the three most strategic men In baseball. And, less than two weeks from the start of this season, they were busy this weekend promoting the players revolt, which was triggering the most sweeping economic changes in the game's 150year history.

title: The Yearning
description: The yearning for a succession of mild days, for the fresh look and feel of spring, is as natural to man when April is at hand as is the urgency of a wild goose fly north. That is why we watch so eagerly for daffodils, once crocuses are in bloom. That is why we stop and listen to a brook rushing down a hillside and across a  meadow. Brooks chatter of springtime and of fullleafed trees and of nesting birds.

title: Holmgren Has Surgery
description: BOSTON, March 27 (AP)Paul Holmgren, injured in a fight during an American Hockey League game, was reported in satisfactory condition today following eye surgery. The minor league player suffered the injury last night in a game against the Nighthawks at New Haven.

title: Investigator Says Scientist Sold Cell Specimens Owned by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, March 27A leading figure in the science of growing living human cells in the laboratory has been accused in a Government investigator's report of selling valuable cell specimens that were the property of the Federal Government.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Parallel moves are not exceptionally uncommon the equity and credit markets. And last week saw both of these marketplaces going in the same direction, up.

title: Bottles, And How to Collect Them
description: EVERYONE relates to history in a personal way. Some choose to ignore it, others memorialize it. In this Bicentennial year, many towns in New Jersey have decided to paint park benches, parking meters and trash receptacles in a splatter of red, white and blue, History, however garish, seems more than ever to be all around.

title: Hudson's PCB Waves Buffet East End
description: LAST August Peter Kromer of Amagansett had a ifisherman's dream day, a full catch on a Thursday followed by a stormy sea that sharply reduced the catches of other boats. The market was his. His previous catch of striped bass sold for 80 cents a pound. He was incredulous when he learned his fish got only 50 ??? in the New York wholesale market.

title: Recent Incidents Are, as Usual, Both Political and Religious
description: JERUSALEMRecent unrest in occupied territories on the West Bank of the Jordan River has revived the historic and political debate on the status of Jerusalem and reminded Israel that its annexation of the eastern part of the city in 1967 haS not been internationally sanctioned.

title: Environmental Groups Query U.S. Exemptions for 8 Steel Plants
description: WASHINGTON, March 27When the Environmental Protection Agency issued new regulations on March 15, limiting the pollutants that the iron and steel industry can dump in lakes and rivers, it exempted eight plants along a 24mite stretch of the Mahoning River in Ohio.

title: Travesty
description: pulousness the geography of their journey and the various stages his plan will go through. Pending the final flash of panic and the achievement of the perfectly contrived accident in which invention quite defies interpretation, the narrator, with patient meticulousness, explains his reasons for doing what he is doing, while his daughter vomits in the back seat and the poet, we infer (but never hear) tries every kind of appeal to his sanity and insanity to dissuade him from his plan. The narrator's calm, unhurried implacable monotone only intensifies the sense of speed in the book. It moves very quickly, for something of the same reason that Macbeth moves very quicklywe are moving towards and through horror with a madman, locked up within the sealedoff acceleration of his mania, incapable of interrupting or deflecting the suave nihilism of his resolve.

title: New Alp Tunnel Cleared
description: GOESCHENEN, Switzerland, March 27 (AP)The last seven feet of granite between the two sections of what will he the world's longest highway tunnel have been blasted away under the Gotthard massif. The tunnel, nearly 10 miles long, will connect Switzerland and Italy. It is scheduled to open for traffic in 1980.

title: Thelonious Monk Is in Fine Fettle With a Quintet
description: Thelonious Monk, whose melodies seemed strangely angular and lopsided to many jazz listeners in the 1940's, has since firmly established himself as one of the most distinctively original composers and pianists in jazz. Even more than in the case of Duke Ellington, from whom he is a musical descendant, Mr. Monk's tunes are immediately recognizable as his, and his style as a pianist is so personal that it is beyond imitation.

title: HEARING DEBATES LEGALIZED GAMING
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., March 27A bill that would bring statecontrolled casino gainbling to New York in 1978 was defended and attacked here today by speakers who testified at the second hearing on the proposal.

title: Rally Round the Stars and Stripes, Pinetrees and Rattlesnakes
description: The United States is in the middle of a flag boom, according to Dr. Whitney Smith, one of this country's leading trexillologists (a person who studies flags) and head of the Flag Research Center, in Winchester, Mass., an organization of flag historians devoted to coordinating and promoting the study of flags. People are collecting modern and historical American flags, in unprecedented numbers, and even the Postal Service is offering a special set of commemorative stamps featuring the flags of the 50 states (tlje set sells for steep $70).

title: Nordic Lands Ask Britain To End Patrols Off Iceland
description: STOCKHOLM, March 27 (Routers)Foreign Ministers of the five Nordic countries have called on Britain to pull its warships out of Icelandic waters to assist a peaceful solution of a fishing dispute.

title: BACKTALK
description: By and large, Julius Novick's article was perceptive of the history of Circle in the Square. However, Mr. Novick exhibited a lack of understanding of what the Circle is and what it isn't. The Circle in the Square is an instrument (a public stage) for the continuity of art. It is and always has been an actors theater. Our greatest gratitude goes to those artists who have made the classics come blazingly alive, made them new plays with interpretations in harmony with, or far beyond, the authors original concepts. Twentyfive years after Death of a Salesman was originally produced, Arthur Miller said that Martin Sheen's last scene speech as Happy [in the Circle's revival] was the first time he had heard it as he had conceived it. That is what the Circle isthe actor/ artist challenging the tradition of the classics and bringing to them his intuitive, highly personal vision of the role.

title: Opera: Aida Is Recast
description: There are six principal singers in any cast of Aida, and five of the six at the Metropolitan Opera Friday night were different from those in the premiere of the new production on Feb. 3. The only holdover was Richard T. Gill as the King; he was as solidly authoritative as could have been wished.

title: Uphill Victory Over Seals Bolsters Islanders Hopes

title: Woe to the Republicans
description: What had come to be the general assumption that the Republican nomination would go to Gerald R. Ford can no longer be so easily made. In last week's North Carolina primary, Ronald Reagan received 52 percent of the popular vote, the President, 46 percent. When taken with the other close contests between them so far, the result says clearly that the voters of Mr. Ford's own party do not automatically accept him as their leader even though he is their President.

title: ART
description: C OLLAGE is one of the most fanciful forms of art. Offering appreciable latitude as a medium, it lends itself generously to the most delightful and amusing flights of the imagination. Artists who might work in a very sober fashion in oil or marble often become more poetically adventurous with collage.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: The 20th annual Metropolitan New York Numismatic Convention, traditionally one of the top events on the spring show calendar in this area, opens at noon Thursday for a fourday run in the Barbizon Plaza Hotel on Central Park South. Thursday's closing hour is 9 P.M. On Friday, the show will be open from 10 A.M. to 9 P.M.; on Saturday from 10 A.M. to 6 P.M., and next Sunday (April 4) from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. Admission is free.

title: A Slice of Gingerbread
description: ??? more than 100 years ago, the high sandy bluff off Hempstead Harbor was green farm country. Winding dirt roads linked it to nearby communities and an Indian trail, clearly defined, stretched from its water's edge, up through steep ravines and over gently rolling land to famed Piping Rock, the limit of Colonial New England and before that an historic Indian place of peace. An idyllic site it wasand still is.

title: CANADA DEBATES MORALITY LAWS

title: ECONOMIC DESPAIR DEEPENS IN ULSTER

His son was moving to Britain in several months; some neighbors had just purchased homes in Dublin and were leaving Belfast; his wife was taking sedatives and urging him to pack up the family and depart.

description: Dr. Julian Scott Butterworth, a past president of the American Heart Association, died Friday night in an auto collision on Route 3, near North Bergen, N.J. He was 65 years old and had his office at 104 East 40 Street. He lived here land at Lake Mohawk, N.J.

title: ways of the patriciate
description: Louis Auchincloss's idea of a Bicentennial celebration is to write a series of stories tracing, as he puts it, the rise and fall of the puritan ethic in New York and New England. One can think of no more suitable project for a writer whose career demonstrates the continuing ability of that ethic to animate human activity. The fact that for a ong time now Auchincloss has averaged close to a book a rear while holding a partnerhip in a good downtown law irm and pursuing numberless good civic works suggests that like the characters in these itoriesis possessed by a reoccupying sense  of a mission.

title: Reaian's Upset Victory in North Carolina Attributed to Impact of LastMinute TV Speech

The only viewers who watch, the strategists insist, are those already committed to the candidate.

title: Jordan's King Resurgent

He set out with the reputation of being a playboyprince like so many others and, worse, a cat'spaw of the British Government. His accession to the throne in 1953 was followed by 20 years of struggle for his own and his country's survival through internal and external strife assassination attempts, intrigues and chaos.

Carew, who has won the league batting title the last four years, received $120,000 in the 1975 season and reportedly was unhappy about an offer from the club of a $10,000 raise eariler this year.

title: Arab Part of Oil Imported by U. S. More Than in 73
description: Although oil imports into the United States have declined slightly since 1973, the percentage of these imports coming from Arab sources has soared, according to a study released yesterday by the Petroleum Industry Research Foundation.

title: Udall States He Would Accept Role as Carter's Running Mate
description: Representative Morris K. Udall said yesterday that he would not refuse a request to run for Vice President with Jimmy Carter if the former Georgia Governor won the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Wealthy, Limited by Curbs on Campaign Gifts, Are Holding Fewer MoneyRaising Parties in Homes
description: The new campaign fundraising law, widely consiered an advance for society at large, has dealt high society, a blow this Presidential primary season.

title: Pride of Rutgers Fans Won't Die After Defeat
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., March 28For a town whose heroes had fallen, basketballcrazy New Brunswick was surprisingly upbeat today.

title: Valdes Retains His Title, Stopping Cohen in the 4th
description: PARIS, March 28Rodrigo Valdes continuously tested his onceshattered right hand on Max Cohen's face tonight as he easily retained his World Boxing Council middleweight title when his opponent gave up in the fourth round.

title: PATURSE ARMY PLANS A NEW ROLE
description: LISBON, March 28  After initiating a revolution and participating in the political disorders that followed, Portugal's armed forces are beginning to plan a reorganization destined to make them a small professional group obedient to democratic civilian rule and to popular will.

title: Wallace Hints a Defeat Would End His Career
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)Gov. George C. Wallace indicated today that this year's Presidential race may be his last political contest.

title: PRICE STRENGTH SHOWN BY BONDS
description: The bond market last week made its strongest advance this year, and the consensus in Wall Street seems to be that fixedincome securities will continue to move toward higher prices and lower yields. Many bond analysts, adopting the natural skepticism that follows any substantial move in the securities market, caution that the bond market could easily falter as soon as traders nail down some profits from the lengthy advance in prices during most of March.

title: Hilda Slautterback Burns, A Writer and Teacher, 53
description: Hilda Slautterback Burns, a former writer, teacher, magazine editor and publicrelations executiv, died Saturday in Memorial Hospital. She was 53 years old and lived at 310 West 11th Street.

title: RollsRoyce, Unflattered by Imitation, Sues
description: Its promoters say it fulfills a car owner's inner need for a sense of European luxury at a fraction of the COst.

title: Scali Fears Investigative News May Lose Perspective
description: John A. Scali, former United States representative to the United Nations who last year, returned to ABC News as senior correspondent, says he believes that postWatergate journalism is in danger of losing its perspective because of the glamour, that now surrounds investigalive reporting.

title: Lockheed CoverUp?
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.Is the United States Government covering up the full story behind Lockheed's $12 million payoffs in Japan?

title: SHOP TALK
description: One of the latest developments in the Tshirt is sophisticated line based on famous works of art. Such things as the Rosetta Stone, a rhinoceros woodcut by Albrecht Diirer, designs from an ancient Greek vase or from a wall painting in Thebes and an example of 18thcentury Turkish calligraphy have been silkscreened on French cotton shirts.

title: French and British to Meet Today on Concorde Future
description: PARIS, March 28 (Reuters)Officials of the French and British Governments meet here tomorrow to discuss the future of the Corlcorde supersonic airliner, endangered by New York's refusal to grant it landing rights.

title: Impact of Stiff Drug Law Is in Dispute After 2 Years
description: In the first two years of the state's tougher narcotics law, 891 persons were sentenced to prison terms, but only 31 drew the maximum penalty of 15 years to life.

title: Lolich, Apodaca Shelled as Mets Lose 5th Straight, 90
description: VERO BEACH, Fla., March 28The New York Mets spring training skid continued here today. The Los Angeles Dodgers welcomed Mickey Lolich to the National League with a threerun first inning and posted a 90 victory that sent Manager Joe Frazier's club to its fifth straight defeat.

title: SLURS ARE CHARGED TO ISAIAH ROBINSON
description: The presidents of two organizations representing educators said yesterday they would ask for a public apology for remarks made by Isaiah E. Robinson, president of the City Board of Education, at a convention of educators at the Commodore Hotel on Friday. They said the remarks wero antiSemitic.

title: RELIGIOUS LEADERS URGERIGHT TO FOOD
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (UPI)  Declaring hunger no longer acceptable, 27 Protestant, Roman Catholic, Jewish and Orthodox religious leaders called on Congress today to establish the right to food as a basic element of American policy and action.

title: GOING Guide
description: MAGYAR MERGER Listening to the cocktailhour keyboard of Peter Vamos from the bar at Jacques, it seems appropriate that this restaurant at 210 East 58th Street (near Third Avenue), has finally added a native Hungarian entertainer to its Hungarian fare. The piano is toward the front of the room, close to the atmospheric brick wall that faces the long bar leading to the main dining area.

title: Carter Suing to Upset Results In Areas Ousting His Delegates
description: Jimmy Carter's New York campaign organization said yesterday that it would sue in Federal District Court to invalidate results of the state primary here next month in 10 Congressional districts where the Democratic Presidential aspirant's name had been stricken from the ballot because of technical irregularities.

title: Suspect Accused of Killing Puerto Rico Leader's Son
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., March 28 (UPI)A former mental patient was accused today of murdering the son of one of Puerto Rico's independence leaders.

title: 2 Filipinos Trapped in Mine Are Rescued After 24 Days
description: PLACER, The Philippines, March 28 (UPI)Two miners trapped 116 feet underground for 24 days in a collapsed gold mine were rescued today.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article about mock arbitration at the Association of the Bar of the City of New York in The New York Times last Thursday stated that Otto Preminger had consumed three martinis. He did not drink any liquor.

title: Cyprus Gets New Influx Of Lebanese Christians
description: LARNACA, Cyprus, March 28 (AP)Packed into yachts and cargo boats, hundreds of Christian refugees from Lebanon arrived here by sea over the weekend.

title: Soccer Results
description: Soccer Results

title: Sache Opens 13th Store
description: Sachs New York Inc., a furniture retailer, opened Its 13th and largest branch yesterday at 15 West 34th Street. The store occupies 10 floors.

title: Albert A. DuPont, Lawyer, Led Queens County Bar Unit
description: Albert A. DuPont, senior partner in the law firm of Austin & DuPont of Mineola, L.I., and Jamaica, Queens, and a past president of the Queens County Bar Association, died Tuesday of a heart attack while on vacation in Inverrary, Fla. He was 72 years old and lived in Long Beach. L.I.

title: Benefit Revue May 9 Set By Arts Research Center
description: The Performing Arts Research Center, part of the New York Public Library at Lincoln Center, will present the StarSpangled Gala. a massive benefit revue, May 9 on the stage of the Metropolitan Opera House to raise money to pay for the research center's operating expenses.

title: Marriages
description: Marriages

title: experts Dispute Contention That Device Can Extract Cheap Energy From Water
description: LOS ANGELES, March 28A machine that its developers contend can extract cheap energy from water has been tested here and has touched off a flurry of speculation on Wall Street a Federal investigation of possible stock manipulation, and virtually unanimous skepticism from scientists who say the machine cannot do what its inventors say it can.

title: TRANSIT WORKERS AUTHORIZE STRIKE AS TALKS CONTINUE
description: More than 4,000 members of the Transport Workers Union voted at a turbulent meeting yesterday to strike the city's subway and bus lines next Thursday morning if they did not obtain a satisfactory contract with the Transit Authority.

title: Dr. Clewans Weds Miss Goldsmith
description: Bonnie Dale Goldsmith, a nurse at the Kingsbrook Jewish Medical Center in Brooklyn, was married yesterday to Dr. Harvey William Clewans, who will start a residency in orthopedic surgery there in July. Rabbi Daniel Mehlman performed the ceremony at the Washington Hotel in Belle Harbor, Queens.

title: Connors Wins Final By 64, 64
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif. March 28In one of those windy sandstorms that hit the Palm Springs area a little more often than resident boosters like to admit, Jimmy Connors scored another major victory today by beating Roscoe Tanner, 64, 64, for the $35,000 first prize in the American Airlines Tennis Games.

title: Durable Goods Recovery Lifts Earnings for Sears
description: CHICAGOMajor household durable goods, the one significant sector of consumer products that has lagged in sales the last two years, continued to sell well in March alter three consecutive months of favorable business, Arthur M. Wood, chairman and chief executive officer of Sears, 1,3ebuck & Company, said in an interview last week.

title: 1,000 Basque Priests Back Workers, Denounce Madrid
description: BILBAO, Spain, March 28More than 1,000 Roman Catholic priests from the Basque region today declared their strong support for Basque workers struggle to organize unions.

title: State Aide Says City May Err on Revenue
description: The state fiscal expert monitoring the city's threeyear budgetbalancing plan reported yesterday that his office believed that the city's latest revenue forecast might be overstated by as much as $129 million.

title: Freed American Tells of Torture In Argentine Jail
description: A 27yearold Californian, flown here yesterday after her release from an Argentine prison, charged that she had been tortured by the Argentine federal police for two days tintil she falsely confessed to having taken part in subversive acts against the now defunct Peronist Government.

title: A Cointel Story
description: BOSTON, March 28William Albertion was a leading figure in the Corninunist Party of the U.S.A. until 1964. That year, a document reading like secret informant's report to the F.B.I. Was found in a car he had used was signed Bill, appeared to be in his handwriting and ended by asking for a raise in expenses.

title: Supplementary OverCounter Listings
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: 7Magazine Discount Is Offered
description: The former ad directors of National Review and Natural History magazines have joined forces to create the Leadership Network, which will offer advertisers discounts for group buys.

title: Bombing in London Brings Police Appeal for Alertness
description: LONDON, March 28 (Reuters)  The police tightened security in London today after a bomb attack yesterday that injured 85 people at the huge Olympia exhibition hall.

title: ARGENTINE JUNTA NAMES A CABINET
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 28 (Reuters) Argentina's mintary junta today named eight Cabinet ministers to be sworn in tomorrow with the new President, Lieut. Gen. Jorge Rafael Videla.

title: Swiss Driver Wins
description: Clay Regazzoni of Switzerland drove a Ferrari to victory in the first United States Grand Prix West at Long Beach, Calif. Page 41.

title: Stilwell Is One of Opera's Unsung Heroes
description: The singers who make the biggest noise in opera get the most attention. Among baritones, the Leonard Warrens, the Robert Merrills the Cornell MacNeils, the Sherill Milneses have been able to electrify audiences with the sheer splendor of their voices. They can, if they want to, make a career singing the great and rewarding roles for them in the Verdi repertory. The breed of baritones with lighter voices is just as valuable, but it has to make its impact on an audience in different ways. As good an example as any is Richard Stilwell, who this season consolidated his success on the local operatic scene.

title: Book Series Weaving Tapestry of States
description: E Pluribus Unum, the national motto, is taking the bodily shape of a shelf full of histories tracing the evolution of each state with its own distinct traits and its contributions to the amalgam that is the United States of America.

title: Quality and Equality
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn.This university is an equal opportunity employer such an assurance appears in the advertisements and announcements with which we now solicit nominations and applications for faculty positions.

title: BEAME JOINS FIGHT ON STAVISKY BILL
description: ALBANY, March 28Mayor Beame will join Governor Carey here tomorrow in a final round of negotiations with legislators and their leaders aimed at stopping the Legislature from overriding Mr. Carey's veto of the Stavisky bill, which would earmark a fixed proportion of the city's expense budget for schools.

title: Free Action Services a Help To Consumers Well, to Some
description: After you've complained to the manager, written to the chairman of the board, contacted the Better Business Bureau, made carbons of your letter and sent them to the attorney general, the local consumer affairs department, Ralph Nader and President Ford's consumer adviserafter you've done all these things and still your problem is unresolved, where can you turn?
