title: INE TALK
description: It is time for the Champagne Festival in New York once again. Last year, worried by a serious slump in sales in this country, the French champagne producers and their local promoters came up with a plan. They would get several restaurants to feature champagne and food that can accompany champagne, and they would see to it that the price was reasonable. They tried at Le Marmiton on East 49th Street and at the Brasserie on East 53d.

title: Issues 76: Environment
description: Any candidate for the Presidency in 1976 will brush off at his political peril the issue of environmental protection. Too much has happened since the first Earth Day, close to six years ago, to permit the easy belief that Americans care about the air, water and land of this country only incidentally and after all their other problems have been solved.

title: Prosecutor Plans to Fight HearstHarris Severance
description: LOS ANGELES, March 30The chief prosecutor in Patricia Hearst's second trial said today that he would oppose her move to separate her case from that of her codefendants, William and Emily Harris, all indicted together for kidnapping, assault and robbery.

title: Deference to Whites A Habit in Rhodesia
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, March 30Nelson Mpango is 26 years old, the grandson of a chief, a university graduate and, in contemporary Rhodesian terms, a militant. He works and socializes with whites, drives his own car and has traveled within the limitations of a Rhodesian passport in southern Africa.

title: Sollberger Plays Works Requiring Aggressive Flute
description: The Group for Contemporary Music sponsored Harvey Sollberger's explorations of the contemporary flute at Alice Tully Hall on Monday night.

title: TV: A Night for Politics, Sinatra and the Oscars
description: What can be seen on television on a single evening is downright astonishing. There is Senator Henry, M. Jackson on a political panel insisting that a family with six or seven children cannot be raised properly on the 10th floor of an apartment building. There, on a 60minute spread, is a middleaged, overweight singer named Frank Sinatra demonstrating to a young, boyishly handsome singer named John Denver the meaning of superb style. And there, to conclude the 48th annual presentation of the Academy Awards, was Elizabeth Taylor asking the audience of chic celebrities to rise and sing America the Beautiful and then clearly showing the world that she didn't know the words. It all happened Monday night.

title: BankTax Shortfall Will Unbalance the State Budget
description: ALBANY, March 30 The State Budget Division announced today that an unanticipated shortfall in receipts from the newly imposed bank tax would throw the state's budget out of balance by as much as $180 million next year.

title: City College Delays Action on Opening Campus Beer Hall
description: A City College committee yesterday postponed a vote on a proposed on campus beer hall, after a college investigation concluded that a hall; should not be established until steps were taken to curb the use of drugs on campus.

title: Firmer Control Shown in Cambodia
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 30The Cambodian Government appears to be rapidly consolidating its control, more rapidly than seemed possible la few months ago. For the first time, some of this new sense of order is believed to be filtering out of Phnom Penh to the rural reaches of the country.

title: F.T.C. IS STUDYING 14 TRADE GROUPS
description: The Federal Trade Commission began a detailed pricefixing investigation in January of 14 of the country's major industry trade associations to find whether their rules and practices are restricting competition, it became known today.

title: WELFARE CENTERS TOLD TO SPEEDUP
description: A Federal judge ruled yesterday that long lines at the city's welfare centers did not unlawfully prevent people from applying for benefits, but he ordered welfare officials to speed up some of the procedures.

title: Carter Says He Opposes 'Special Favors to Aid City
description: Former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia thinks it would be inappropriate for the Federal Government to single out New York City for special favors.

title: MRS. ALBERT GALLAGHER
description: Marian Green Gallagher, the wife of former State Supreme Court Justice Albert T. Gallagher, died Monday at her home in Chappaqua, N. Y. She was 70 years old. Besides her husband, she leaves a brother, Arthur L. Green.

title: Serpico, at $29.60, First in Rich Pace
description: YONKERS, March 30Before the $73,000added final of the Hopeful Pacing Series for 3yearold colts and geldings at Yonkers Raceway tonight there was a lot of fretting in Bret John's paddock, but not among the bettors.

title: La Scarsdale du Foie Gras
description: PARIS, March 30 (AP)A $150millionayear golden egg, hidden under a mountain of Israeli and Bulgarian goose liver, is at the bottom of what a French goosebreeder is calling an international foie gras scandal.

title: Greece Summons Two Envoys For Talks on U.S.Turkey Pact
description: ATHENS, March 30 (UPI)The Greek Government has recalled for consultations its delegation to talks in Washington on the status of United States bases in Greece upon announcement of the United StatesTurkish aid pact, a Government spokesman said today.

title: ALBANY EXPECTING SCHWARTZ REBUFF
description: ALBANY, March 30  The Senate Finance Committee was voting privately today on the controversial nomination of Herman Schwartz to head the Commission of Correction and was expected to recommend to the full Senate tomorrow that Mr. Schwartz not be confirmed.

title: CHILDREN'S HOE DENIES CENSORING
description: Seeking to prevent WABCTV from showing its account of conditions in a children's home on Staten Island, a lawyer for the home argued at an Appellate Division hearing yesterday that freedom of the press was being used as a guise to invade the children's constitutional right to privacy.

title: Canada Southern's Stock Is Up by 40
description: Stock prices fell again yesterday as trading continued at its slowest pace since this year's opening session.

title: OILRESERVE DECLINE OF 4% IN 1975 SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, March 30 (AP)Petroleumindustry trade associations estimated today that United States reserves of oil and natural gas dropped lf again last year by some 4 to 5 percent.

title: Productivity Issue Snarls City Transit Negotiations
description: Productivity remained the, key stumbling block yesterday between the Transit Authority and the Transport Workers Union as they strove to reach an agreement prevent a bus and subway strike tomorrow morning.

title: RECOVERED VEHICLE LINKED TO SOLIAH
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., March 30 (UPI)The Federal Bureau of Investigation disclosed today the recovery of a station wagon that, agents said, was involved in the fatal robbery of a suburban bank for which a companion of Patricia Hearst is being tried.

title: SYRIANS PRESSING LEFTISTS IN BEIRUT TO ACCEPT TRUCE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Wednesday, March 31 Syrian mediators increased pressure on recalcitrant Lebanese factions yesterday, demanding that Moslem leaders and their leftist allies agree at once to a weeklong truce in Lebanon's civil war.

title: Leadership of House: Struggle Involves Ideology and Legislation
description: WASHINGTON, March 30While the organization of the 95th Congress is nine months away, the Democratic leadership in the House of Representatives Is embroiled in power struggle that transcends the Nevacommonplace game of political musical chairs. Involved is Democratic ideology, current legislative efforts and in the longer run the ability to carry out the expressed desire of most Congressmen to exert a stronger role in both domestic and torelgn affairs.

title: Jets Are Not His Universe
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.i., March 30The Jets must be molding a fearful powerhouseeven Mr. Universe flunked a tryout today.

title: SHIFT ON TRANSIT VEXES CLEVELAND
description: CLEVELANDThis city and its suburbs, more accustomed in the past to bickering than to sweet harmony, surprised the local leaders last summer, and brought off a political coup admired by urban experts around the nation.

title: Abigail Adams And the Pill
description: PARISToday commemorates modern history's unfinished revolution. On March 31, 1776, Abigail Adams, wife of the second United States Piesident, wrote to her husband, then member of the Continental Congress: In the new code of laws which suppose it will be necessary for you to make I desire you would remember the ladies and be more generous and favorable to them than your ancestors.

title: HUMPHREY EFFORT TO BLOCK CARTER IN WISCONSIN SEEN
description: MADISON, Wis., March 30Senator Hubert H. Humphrey has intervened in the Democratic Presidential contest for the first time, growing evidence indicates, by attempting to head off a victory by Jimmy Carter in the Wisconsin primary.

title: Beame Urges Public to Act To Stop SchoolBudget Bill
description: With blackboard and chalk and some of his strongest woods since he took office, Mayor Beame yesterday urged the public to press the Legislature to stop the Stavisky bill, or face the certain destruction of vital city services.

title: U. S. Aide on Air Force Flight to Callaway Resort
description: WASHINGTON, March 30 (GPI)The Air Force released a passenger list today showing that Deputy Defense Secretary William P. Clements traveled on an Air Force plane in January 1975 to visit Howard H. Callaway's ski resort in ColoIrado.

title: The Fading Cufflink
description: LONDON, March 30 (UPI)Long after the Americans killed the shirtsleeve cufflink, its death knell is sounding in Britain. Shirtmakers here are no longer producing shirts with holes for cufflinks but are switching to the plastic button.

title: For Passover Season, Some Symbolic Foods Enhanced by an Expert
description: While many religious holidays have some traditiofial foods as part of their celebrations, Passover, the Jewish spring festival of deliverance, seems unique in that the Seder, the main portion of the ceremonial observance, takes place around the dinner table. There the story of the Israelites flight from Egyptian bondage is told, to a great extent, through symbolic foods and wine.

title: Hockey, Basketball Standinas
description: Hockey, Basketball Standinas

title: CONGRESS APPROVES 200MILE FISH ZONE
description: WASHINGTON, March 30 (Reuters)Congress today enacted a bill that gives the United States control of fishing rights within 200 miles of its coastline. The measure then went to President Ford for his expected signature.

title: S.E.C. DROPS PLANS FOR FORECAST RULE
description: WASHINGTON, March 30The Securities and Exchange Commission has given up plans Ito require companies making profit forecasts to meet detailed reporting standards, according to senior staff officials.

title: Dynasty Is Looming at Indiana
description: When John Wooden coached the University of California, Los Angeles, to its first two National Collegiate Athetic Association basketball championships in 1964 and 1965, he had all the prestige needed to attract the best high school players.

title: CARTER ACCUSED ON U.S. SUBSIDIES
description: WASHINGTON, March 30 (AP)  Ford Administration agriculture officials are hoping, that Jimmy Carter's connection with the Government's $150 million peanut subsidy program will provide the kind of public and political pressure needed for Congress to kill or radically change the subsidies.

title: I.B.M., BURROUGHS ADDING SMALL LINES
description: Two of the most important manufacturers of largescale data  processing systems announced yesterday major product entries in the smaller computer spectrum, while the leading maker of smaller computers added to its capability with a lamescale system.

title: Books of The Times
description: Of Lydia Chukovskaya's first novel, The Deserted House, The New York Times Book Review wrote: It promises to take its place with Ivan Denisovich as one of the most impressive examples of the genre of Russian purge literature  The Times Literary Supplement said: Remarkable and superbly written. Of all the purge books that have come to our knowledge The Deserted House is the most moving of all.

title: Mets Lose 7th in Row As Yanks Win in 10th
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 30And on the seventh day Rick Dempsey will rest.

title: Sill Restricting Abortions Passed by Senate in Albany
description: ALBANY, March 30 The State Senate, by a vote of 35 to 22, passed a bill to require a pregnant, unmarried girl under 18 to get parental permission before obtaining a legal abortion.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Syrian mediators raised pressure on recalcitrant Lebanese factions to agree to week's truce in the civil war. But as Moslem forces continued to advance in downtown Beirut, Kemal Jumblat, the Lebanese Druse leader who is titular head of the Moslemleftist alliance, again rejected the idea as being of advantage to the Christian rightists. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Investors Resisting California Issue
description: The monthlong rise in taxexempt bond prices, an advance that reduced municipal) bond yields to their lowest levels in a year, faltered yesterday as California sold $100 million of triplebonds. Yields on the bonds were as much as 40 basis points lower than the yields on similarly rated Georgia bonds marketed March 9, and investors apparently balked at acceptinE that much of a drop. About $15 million remained unsold at the end of the afternoon,

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of an error in reference material, an article in The New York Times on Monday incorrectly identified John S. Bowles as president of Benton & Bowles and erroneously reported that he had attended a $250aperson function for Jimmy Carter. The president of the firm is John S. Bowen, a Republican, and he did not attend. John Bowles, vice president of Kidder Peabody & Co. Inc., was present.

title: BIDS BY CARTER IN 72 REPORTED
description: ATLANTA, March 30Jimmy Carter, then Governor of Georgia, apparently wanted to he George McGovern's running mate in the 1972 Presidential election, a spokesman for the South Dakota Senator acknowledged under questioning today.

title: PACIFIC BOARD GETS OPTIONS CLEARANCE
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission has given the Pacific Stock Exchange permission to begin call options trading. Lee Pickard, the agency's director of market regulations, said yesterday at an optionstrading seminar held by the American Stock Exchange.

title: Sadat Meets Schmidt in Bonn, Gets Kind Words but Little Else
description: BONN, March 30 (Reuters)President Anwar elSadat of Egypt appeared to have obItained moral encouragement for his Middle East policiesbut little elsefrom Chancellor Helmut Schmidt in talks here today.

title: The Turkish Agreement
description: The Ford Administration's agreement to provide a billion dollars in aid to Turkey in return for restoration of American access to military bases in that country is in serious trouble on Capitol Hill and elsewhere, even before the enabling legislation has been written.

title: Drug and Eyeglass Price Ads Are Urged
description: TRENTON, March 30Consumer advocates and representatives of elderly people's groups today strongly endorsed legislation that would permit the advertising of drug prices and the prices of eyeglasses.

title: U.S. Judge Thomas Madden Of New Jersey District Court
description: Federal Court Judge Thomas M. Madden died Monday at his home in Collingswood, N.J. He was 69 years old.

title: PAYMENTS STUDIED BY CONTROL DATA
description: The Control Data Corporation said yesterday that its directors I had authorized an investigation to determine the nature and lextent of certain payments made by its international subsidiaries to foreign government officials.

title: LEBANESE THREAT SEEN BY WALDHEIM
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 30 Secretary General Kurt Waldheim, in an unusual move, warned the Security Council today that further deterioration of the situation in Lebanon carried implications extending well beyond the boundaries of that country.

title: Crash Kills 27 in India
description: NEW DELHI, March 30 (Reuters)  Twentyseven people were killed when a bus on the JatnmuDelhl highway lost a wheel and crashed into a tree yesterday, the police said.

title: Jersey Leader for Carter
description: TRENTON. March 30State Senator Anne C. Martindell, of Mercer County, who served as chairman of the state delegation to the 1974 Democratic National Convention, today announced that she would run as a delegate pledged to Jimmy Carter at the April 10 Democratic district miniconvention: in New Jersey.

title: Contest in Britain Is Narrowed to 2
description: LONDON, March 30The contest to succeed Harold Wilson as Britain's Prime Minister was narrowed today to two men: James Callaghan, the Foreign Secretary, and Michael Foot, the Secretary for Employment.

title: Richardson Finds Iggins A Lovely Change of Pace
description: Ian Richardson, one of the world's leading classical actors, asked the waiter for a glass of club soda. Misunderstanding the request, the waiter, absurdly, returned with a plate of pumpernickel. Club soda? Pumpernickel? What was the point of clipped, elegant diction? Why can't Americans learn to listen? Mr. Richardson laughed and remembered that someone had recently referred to his having a thick foreign accent.

title: Salem Witch Hunts in 1692 Linked to LSDLike Agent
description: The witches of Salem in 1692 may have been nothing more than the hallucinations of young girls who fell ill from eating some contaminated bread, according to a new study.

title: NKOMOKAUNDA TALK IN LUSAKA REPORTED
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, March 30 (Reuters)President Kenneth D. Kaunda of Zambia and Joshua Nkomo, a Rhodesian nationalist leader, held talks here to day, informed sources said.

title: Daniel Sullivan, 67, Official Of the Stamford Yacht Club
description: Daniel M. Sullivan, harbor master for the last 20 years at the Stamford (Conn.) Yacht Club, died Friday at St. Joseph Hospital in Stamford. He was 67 years old and lived in Darien, Conn.

title: A Matching System
description: When Congress set to work to deal with the consequences of the Supreme Court's complex decision on the constitutionality of the Federal Election Campaign Act, it decided to reconsider most of the major issues. President Ford insisted, however, that Congress confine itself to the narrow question of reconstituting the Federal Election Commission.

title: Pan Am Is Proposing an Exchange of Debentures
description: Pan American World Airways said yesterday it had filed registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission covering two new debenture issues that it proposes to exchange for two outstanding issues.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 24hour takeover of a Queens College building by more than 40 students ended after a member of the Board of Higher Education agreed to discuss their demands. The students, who were protesting budget cuts and a proposal to impose tuition, agreed to leave the Academic II Tower after Franklin Williams, the vice chairman, went to the Flushing campus to meet with them.

title: Open Interest
description: Tuesday, March 30, 1976

title: People in Sports
description: Michigan Republicans were paying off bets to Indiana Democrats yesterday as a result of Indiana's National Collegiate basketball championship victory over Michigan Monday night.

title: Salem Witch Hunts in 1692 Linked to LSDLike Agent
description: The witches of Salem in 1692 may have been nothing more than the hallucinations of young girls who fell ill from eating some contaminated bread, according to a new study.

description: Special Fund, Board of Governors10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Carter Says He Opposes  Special Favors to Aid City
description: Former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia thinks it would he inappropriate for the Federal Government to single out New York City for special favors.

title: TRUST IS FORMED TO PRESERVE LAND
description: A private twoyear, $200 mil,lion landacquisition project to preserve naturalarea jewels in all of the nation's 50 states was announced here yesterday.

title: Senators Approve Bribe Data for Japan.
description: WASHINGTON, March 30 (AP)The Senate Foreign Relations Committee today voted to turn over information on alleged bribes paid overseas by the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation to the Justice Department for transfer to Japan and other countries.

title: VICTOR H. LOGAN
description: CHICAGO, March 30 (UPI)Victor H. Logan, a retired editor of The Chicago SunTimes, died yesterday in Bowling Green, Ky. He was 76 years old.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: America Through Baseball, by David Q. Voigt (NelsonHall, Chicago, $9.95). The myths and legends of organized baseball.

title: Young Cooks Whipping Up Gourmet Meals for $2.75
description: WESTBURY, L.I., March 30Anybody who loves good food is always searching for that ultimate restaurant with low prices that the rest of the world has not yet discovered.

title: New Building Dedicated At Psychiatric Hospital
description: MORRIS PLAINS, March 30 A $5 million medicalservices building was dedicated today by Governor Byrne and Ann Klein, Commissioner of Institutions and Agencies, at Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THEIR TURN For some time, a song here and there on the local cabaret scene has indicated the shaping up of a new musical based on Shakespeare's The Tempest. Hence Dreamstuff, starting previews tonight at o'clock and officially opening on Sunday at the WPA Theater, 333 Bowery, near Second Street.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: HIGH FLYING ROMANCE: King Kong doing a rerun of famous scene atop Empire State Building with Carol Sos of Bayshore, L.I., playing Fay Wray. Empire State Building management went ape when they learned that a remake of the film would put King Kong atop World Trade Center towers: Rights: real reel history.

title: Iraq Is Said to Be Threatening Armed Intervention in Lebanon
description: PARIS, March 30Western intelligence reports reaching Paris today said that Iraq had threatened to intervene minterily in Lebanon if Syria exerted heavy pressure on Moslem forces there to restore a cease fire.

title: Italians Hail Return of 3 Stolen Renaissance Works
description: ROME, March 30  The Umbrian hill city of Urbino, whose Ducal Palace houses some of Italy's bestknown works of art, was rejoicing today following the return of three Renaissance naintines.

title: 5 Israeli Arabs Killed in Protest Riots
description: NAZARETH, Israel, March 30 A general strike by Israel's Arab citizens erupted today into violent clashes with security forces in more than a dozen villages in the northern half of the country that left at least five Arabs dead and about 70 people wounded.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, March 30 (Reuters)The House Ways and Means Committee approved today a 35 percent Federal subsidy for interest payments by municipalities that choose to issue bonds subject to Federal taxation. The bill, which now goes to the House of Representatives, would have the Federal Government pay 35 percent of the city interest costs for taxable municipal bonds issued after June 30, 1977.

title: Civil Employees End Walkout in Orange Without a Pay Rise
description: GOSHEN, N.Y., March 30 (AP) The Orange County Civil Service Employees Association voted tonight to end its 14day strike, a spokesman for the group said.

title: Events Today
description: Events Today

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold prices Tuesday.

title: He Speaks the Language Of African Violets Cousins
description: What do you grow when African violets are a bore? Their cousins. Though it would be easy to be put off by these delightful plants because of their namesstreptocarpus, sinningia, kohleria and episcia, etc.their beguiling flowers and velvety leaves can win you over.

title: Other City Unions Watch Transit Talks for Trends
description: Leaders of major city unions with labor contracts expiring at the end of June are closely watching the transit negotiations, which may set a pattern that they will try to match.

title: Radio
description: Radio

title: Rent Control Is Extended For 640,000 Apartments.
description: The City Council voted yesterday to extend rent control covering 640,000 apartments until May 31, 1979.

title: Any Resemblance Is Coincidental
description: MIAMI, March 30Michael Dokes climbed into the ring wearing a hooded robe of devil's red that came down to the toes of his high white shoes. He danced backward toward midring, danced forward into the corner and posed, gazing into the night with his gloved hands out in front him, palms up, like Portia saying, It droppeth like the gentle rain from heaven. He didn't look like Portia, and although he has been called an amateur counterpart of Muhammad Ali, he didn't look like Ali, either. Fle looked like Mephistopheles under a thundercloud. Woody Clark climbed into the corner diagonally opposite and Dokes turned lo regard his adversary. Clark is 5 feet 10 and weighs 198 pounds. Much of the weight is in his thighs. He wore green trunks and a green Jersey with block letters on the chest spelling Florida. Because he lives here, the Miami crowd welcomed him noisily and Dokes joined the applause, beating his gloves together. Then Dokes warmed up by punching his own face with short hooks, left and right. Ali never thought of that.

title: CANADA REJECTS WCI'S SECOND BID
description: The Canadian Government's Foreign Investment Review Agency yesterday rejected a second bid by WCI Canada Ltd. to take over the appliance division of Westinghouse Canada, Ltd. The rejection opens the way for GWS Ltd. of Toronto, the largest Canadian owned appliance company, to reopen talks with Westinghouse Canada for its own takeover bid.

title: House Democrats to Split Banking Bill Into 3 Parts
description: WASHINGTON, March 30In a move that substantially improves the chance that the House will pass the most farreaching banking legislation since the 1930's, Democrats on the Banking Committee decided this afternoon to split the bulky package under consideration into three parts to be taken up separately.

title: N.F.L. Veterans Drafted
description: J. K. McKay was taken by his father, John McKay, coach of the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, and Mike Curtis, Baltimore Colts linebacker, was picked by the Seattle Seahawks yesterday as the National Football League's two expansion teams selected 39 players each from the 26 other teams.

title: JALLAWAY QUTTS AS CAMP AIGN HEAD
description: WASHINGTON, March 30President Ford replaced Howard H. Callaway today as chairman of the President's campaign organization, naming Rogers C. B. Morton to succeed him.

title: Levi to Order Notification Of Citizens F.B.I. Harried
description: WASHINGTON, March 30Attorney General Edward H. Levi will soon order the Federal Bureau of Investigation to notify unwitting American citizens that they were targets of a 17year F.B.I. program of harassment and disruption, informed Justice Department sources said today.

title: PUPIL FREE CHOICE URGED FOR BUSING
description: BOSTON, March 30  Dr. James S. Coleman told a joint session of the Massachusetts legislature today that courtordered school desegregation was drivine whites out of the cities.

title: Food Prices: Stable
description: Retail food prices in the New York area were virtually unchanged again last week and the cost of feeding a family of four in New York City was estimated by the City Department of Consumer Affairs at $71.78 for the 38item market basket, only 3 cents higher than the week before.

title: L.I. School Superintendent Assails Removal of Books
description: LEVITTOWN, L. I., March 30 Dr. Richard G. Morrow, the Superintendent of the Island Trees school district, told a tense crowd of 500 residents tonight that he believed the district's school board was wrong in removing 11 titles from the school library a month ago.

title: Colora do Town cool Campaign
description: YUMA, Colo.The weather has been hot but the political temperature is still tepid these days in Yuma, a small, relatively prosperous, relatively conservative rural community on the prairie of northeast Colorado.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MILWAUKEE, March 30 (AP) The Atlanta Hawks, mired in last place in the National Basketball Association's Central Division, dismissed Cotton Fitzsimmons as coach today. Gene Tormohlen, Fitzsimmon's assistant, was named interim coach. Before playing Milwaukee tonight, Atlanta had a 10game losing streak and a 2846 wonlost record. Fitzsimmons became coach in 1972 after having coached the Phoenix Suns for two years. Atlanta's best finish under him was second in 197273.

title: The Right of Privacy
description: The decision of the United States Supreme Court that in effect upheld the constitutionality of an ancient Virginia statute on private sexual practices was retrogressive enough;  but it was made worse by the way in which the Court chose to reach that conclusion. Without hearing oral argument, without writing an opinion, the Court summarily affirmed the findings of a lower Federal courtwhich was of course its legal right to do, but not its social obligation.

title: Extra Ingredient Turns Birthday Into a Mirthday
description: Somebody apparently used the Alice B. Toklas Cookbook to bake brownies for a secretary's birthday party last week at the Sperry Company in Lake Success, LI., making some of the partygoers extremely happy. Some felt a tingling sensation in their extremities as they nibbled on the brownies. For a few others, things got blurry and one woman, driving later, observed that the road ahead was expanding and contracting.

title: Floating Afom Plant Decried in Jersey
description: ATLANTIC CITY, March 30Witnesses at a Federal hearing here today expressed concern about the safety of a plan to put the world's first floating nuclear power plants 2.8 miles off the coast near here.

title: Dividends
description: Dividends

title: HOUSE VOTES EASING OF HATCH ACT CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, March 30 (AP)The House today approved a measure to allow Government employees to participate in partisan political activities.

title: NEW YORK LABOR SEEKS DELEGATES
description: The trade union movement in this city and state is making a strong bid for an influential) role on the 274member New York delegation to the Democratic National Convention in July.

title: Judge Gives Instructions To Jury in Kapp Trial
description: SAN FRANCISCO. March 30A key legal point apparently favorable to Joe Kapp emerged from the instructions given the jury today by Judge William T. Sweigert as a twoday summing up process began in the former quarterback's antitrust suit against the National Football League. The case is expected to go to the jury tomorrow or Thursday.

title: HUMPHREY EFFORT TO BLOCK CARTER IN WISCONSIN SEEN
description: MADISON, Wis., March 30Senator Hubert H. Humphrey has intervened in the Democratic Presidential contest for the first time, a rapidly growing array of evidence indicates, by attempting to head off a victory by Jimmy Carter in the Wisconsin primary.

title: Second Avenue Pizzeria Sign Due for Smithsonian Display
description: WASHINGTON, March 30 A new neon sign hangs outside Goldberg's Pizzeria in Second Avenue in Manhattan now. The old one has found a place in history.

title: The Art of Music Meets the Craft of InstrumentMaking
description: There is a particular kind of craftsman who may work long hours and yet take months to finish one object. You can't make much of a living from your work, say the artisans involved, because there's just so much you can charge for one thing.

title: In Plains. Ga., Carter Is a Hero and Butz a Villain
description: PLAINS, Ga.The mind of Plains is on three men this spring, two villains and a hero.

title: Excerpts From an Interview With Jimmy Carter on Urban Affairs
description: Q. Do you believe that the New York City fiscal crisis is a harbinger of crises in other cities, and if so, what specific steps do you think should he taken to avert that?

title: RHODESIAN TORTURE IS CALLED ROUTINE
description: LONDON, March 30 (AP)Torture is a routine practice of both the police and armed forces in Rhodesia, Amnesty international contends in a pamphlet published here.

title: Soviet, in U.N., Defends Its Angola Intervention
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 30The Soviet Union declared today that its intervention in Angola could be reconciled with an overall policy of detente because lessening of international tensions doesn't mean freedom of activity for aggressors or neocolonialists.

title: How to Put a Washer on a Faucet
description: WASHINGTONThe recent spate of Congressional leaks has raised serious questions whether leaking is criminal and whether leakers can be held in contempt of Congress.

title: Why Make The Rubble Bounce?
description: WASHINGTON, March 30President Ford went to the Pentagon this week and issued one of those vague warnings to the Congress that make more votes than common sense.

title: Concert: Gyorgy Sandor
description: Gyorgy Sandor loves the music of Bart6k with a love that is allembracing. Six years ago he performed all three Bart6k piano concertos at one Carnegie Hall concert, and on Monday night he gave the first of two Town Hall recitals in which he will traverse the entire six volumes of the 153piece set known as Mikrokosmos.

title: Educator in Assembly
description: ALBANY, March 30There is a certain appropriateness in the fact that Assemblyman Leonard P. Stavisky is leading the attempt to override the Governor's veto of the AssemblyMan man's bill to earmark a fixed proin the portion of the News city's expense budget for the school's budget. His professional ties, after all, are as close to the educational and academic world as to the realm of state politics. A college professor, and a Doctor of Philosophy, with an active role in intellectual and academic organizations, Mr. Stavisky would seem as at home in the classroom as on the floor of the Assembly.

title: Suspension of Hurwitz Is Modified by Anker
description: School Chancellor Irving Anker yesterday modified his suspension of Dr. Howard L. Hurwitz to permit Dr. Hurwitz to resume his duties as principal of Long Island City High School in Queens.

title: 2 Sculptors Seek To Withdraw Work From Whitney Show
description: Two wellknown sculptors are seeking to withdraw their works from the Whitney Museum show 200 Years of American Sculpture, contending that the museum is presenting their art incorrectly.

title: Warsaw Begins Spy Trial Of Olympic Gold Medalist
description: WARSAW, March 30 (UPI)A national sports idol and Olympic champion is on trial In secret on charges of having spied for the West and could be sentenced to death, It was announced today.

title: Market Place
description: Some investors are so cautious these days that they have been selling stock during the rising market, relieved to have recovered some of the capital that they have lost and anxious to avoid new setbacks.

title: Currency Crisis Threatens Europe's Unity
description: PARIS, March 30There are, still optimists as well as pessimists among top European officials, but the conviction is spreading that Europe is at: another crucial crossroads on its tortuous path to unity and is about to take the wrong fork. The currency crisis, with the French, franc abandoning the effort to keep up with the West German mark and joining the anchorless Italian lira and British and Irish pounds in their decline, has provided the drama time.

title: In Plains, Ga., Carter Is a Hero and Butz a Villain
description: PLAINS, Ga.The mind of Plains is on three men this spring, two villains and a hero.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Syrian mediators raised pressure on recalcitrant Lebanese factions to agree to week's truce in the civil war. But as Moslem forces continued to advance in downtown Beirut, Kama! Jumblat, the Lebanese Druse leader who is titular head of the Moslemleftist alliance, again rejected the idea as being of advantage to the Christian rightists. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: 2D BOMB. SCARE AT U.S. EMBASSY
description: MOSCOW, March 30The secand bomb scare in five days at the American Embassy here forced diplomats and children from a nursery school in the building into chilly weather today as United States marines searched the building for explosives. None were found.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SLRESOURCE (SeaLand), Rotterdam April 10,  Havre 11, Bremen 12 and Felixstowe 13; sails from Elizabeth, N.J.

title: HOUSE PANEL BACKS FORD FLU PROGRAM
description: WASHINGTON, March 30 (UPI)President Ford's $135 million plan for a nationwide inoculation program to prevent a swine flu epidemic this fall and winter passed its first Congressional test today without opposition.

title: Names of Kennedy And Humphrey Kept On Nebraska Ballot
description: LINCOLN, Neb., March 30 (AP)A judge ruled today that the names of Senators Edward NI. Kennedy of Massachusetts and Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota will appear on Nebraska's May II Democratic Presidential primary ballot.

title: A Bomb Threat Cuts Short Speech by Syrian at N.Y.U.
description: A telephoned bomb threat last night cut short a speech by the Syrian delegate to the United Nations, Mouaffak elAllaf, to the Arab Student Club of New York University.

title: Kofi Awoonor's Fate
description: Kofi Awoonor, a poet and novelist known throughout Africa and the world, remains under arrest today in his native Ghana. He had returned to teach at the University of Cape Coast for one year. Military police took him into custody at his home on Dec. 31.

title: Knicks Out of Playoffs After Defeat
description: At 9:35 last night by the Madison Square Garden clock, a Knick era ended.

title: Jackson, in Wisconsin, Assails Carter and Udall Records on the RighttoWork Legislation
description: LA CROSSE, Wis., March 30 Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington barnstormed across a rainy Wisconsin today, with a pair of propellerdriven DC3's, challenging the labor records of Jimmy Carter and Representative Morris K. Udall.

title: Brinks Truck Robbed By Montreal Gunmen
description: MONTREAL, March 30 (UPI) Five armed men hijacked a Brinks truck and its, guards in the heart of Montreal's financial district today and escaped with $1.6 million in cash, a Brinks company spokesman said. An earlier estimate had put the amount, stolen at $2 million to $3 million.

title: FORD AND HUSSEIN ASK BEIRUT TRUCE
description: WASHINGTON, March 30President Ford and King Hussein of Jordan issued today a joint appeal for a ceasefire and a political solution in Lebanon as American diplomats stepped up efforts behind the scenes to help arrange an end to the fighting.

title: What's This? Platform Tennis Comes to Forest Hills
description: What's going on at Forest Hills? Don't ask.

title: Democratic Primary Campaign In New York Is EconomySizedi
description: Confronted with depleted campaign coffers and the likelihood of a low turnout in next Tuesday's primary, Democratic Presidential candidates are concentrating on localized, grassroots campaigns rather than the expensive massmedia appeals that are a hallmark of New York politics.

title: About Real Estate
description: The recession is ending for Just Plastics Inc. and just in time.

title: CAHN TO DEFEND AT TRIAL
description: MINEOLA, L. I., March 30William Cahn, the former Nassau County District Attorney, said today that he would defend himself at his Federal trial on mailfraud charges and charges of filing false statements because he could no longer afford a lawyer.

title: Building Contracts Rise
description: Construction contracts last month totaled $6.14 billion, 22 percent above the level in February 1975, the F. W. Dodge division of McGrawHill Information. Systems Company reported yesterday.

title: People and Business
description: A program to help the city's smaller businesses get into exporting was endorsed yesterday by Mayor Beame. served as president, chairman and chief executive officer of the cosmetics concern until 1973, when it merged into Faberge Inc.

title: Pro Transactions
description: Pro Transactions

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: Around the country buyers of airconditioners have to take into account the E. E. R.'senergy efficiency ratios to make sure they get the most efficient machine. This tells them how many thermal units of cooling power the machine delivers per watt of power used. But in New York City it's much simpler.

title: Bridge:
description: For almost a decade, Hugh Kelsey, a Scotsman has been producing highquality books on play and defense, designed to help a good player become an expert.

title: Ulster Bomb Kills Soldier
description: BELFAST, March 30 (Reuters) A British soldier was killed when a bomb exploded today outside a Protestant hall near; Lurgan in Northern Ireland today. He was the second soldier to die in the province this year.

title: New Orders Surge 2.5%; Inventories Rise Slightly
description: WASHINGTON, March 30Manufacturers new orders surged in February, and inventories showed a small increase, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: STAY IS RETAINED IN CURARE INQUIRY
description: JERSEY CITY, March 30A Superior Court judge here refused today to vacate an order temporarily restraining Christ Hospitgl from suspending the surgical privileges of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich, who is under investigation in connection with the possible murder of nine or more patients with curare at another hospital a decade ago.

title: Preseason Baseball
description: Preseason Baseball

title: Officials Feverishly Devise Travel Plans for a Strike
description: With a possible citywide transit strike less than two days away, operators of commuter railroads, suburban buses and taxi companies and city and corporate officials worked feverishly yesterday to devise plans to move hundreds of thousands of people into and out of the city.

title: About New York.
description: Seeing Harriet Wolper standing there in front of Saks Fifth Avenue, most people look away and hurry their steps. Others, moved to pity by the sight of this sadly crippled woman, place a coin or two in the cannister she holds.

title: Court Limits Voting Rights Act In Changes lo Assist Minorities
description: WASHINGTON, March 30 (AP)The Supreme Court today narrowed the applicability of the Federal Voting Rights Act of 1965 as a tool to protect the political power of racial minorities in redistricting cases.

title: AUDITOR SUIT LOST BY FRAUD VICTIMS
description: WASHINGTON, March 30 (AP)The Supreme Court ruled today that the Federal law against securities fraud does not entitle fraud victims to collect damages from auditors who allegedly were negligent in not detecting the scheme.

title: Ford Rejects $1,500 From Contractors Unit
description: WASHINGTON, March 30 (UPI)  After having said three weeks ago that the money would be given to charity, the White House said today that President Ford had changed plans and would not accept a $1,500 cash prize from the Associated General Contractors of America.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Tuesday.

title: Ashe Gains In Opener At Caracas
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 30 (AP)Topseeded ARrthur Ashe defeated Vijay Amritraj, 36, 63, 76, in firstround play of the 21st Altamira Cup tennis tournament tonight.

title: Julian A. Black Is Dead at 79; Former Manager of Joe Louis
description: CHICAGO, March 30 (AP) Julian A. Black, comanager of the former world heavyweight boxing champion Joe Louis, died yesterday at Northwestern Memorial Hospital of complications from a fall in his apartment. He was 79 years old.

title: Shopping While Supping and Sipping
description: This is about takeout restaurants. Not the ones where you take out the food, but the ones where you take out the dcor.

title: JOSEPH A. DANILEK
description: Joseph A. Danilek, a retired cosmetics and fragrance industry executive died Sunday at St. Mary's Hospital in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 71 years old and lived in Garden City, L. I., and Palm Beach, Fla.

title: WHITE MOTOR PROXY LISTS DIFFICULTIES
description: Preparing for its planned acquisition by White Consolidated Industries Inc., the White Motor Corporation told shareholders yesterday that financial difficulties had led to buyer resistance and deterioration of its dealer network.

title: Does Work Ethic Pay?
description: The 1976 Presidential campaign has scarcely begun to reach the issueseconomic, social or foreign policy. In a sense, the campaign thus far has been a drama of six charactersFord, Reagan, Carter, Jackson, Udall and Humphrey (in the wings)in search of an issue. Will the election outcome turn on a true issue or a false one?

title: WHEAT PRICES UP AFTER 5DAY DROP
description: After five sessions of declining prices, wheat futures rose yesterday as those covering short positions bought to cover their positions on the Chicago Board of Trade. July, a new crop wheat month, closed at $3.59 a bushel, up from $3.52.

title: Sculptors Seek To Withdraw Work From Whitney Show
description: Two wellknown sculptors are seeking to withdraw their works from the Whitney Museum show 200 Years of American Sculpture, contending that the museum is present inn their art incorrectly.

title: College, School Results
description: College, School Results

title: 931 Hold Rail Pass For Use in Jersey
description: TRENTON, March 30Secretary of State J. Edward Crabiel reported today that 931 officials and employees of the state had passes for 1976 to travel free within New Jersey on the Penn Central railroad. This marks the 73d consecutive year that such passes have been distributed.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: 1976 by Triangle a Publications. Inc. (The Daily Racing Form) Tuesday, March 30. 71st day. Weather clear, track fast.

title: CONGRESS BACKING FORD ON DEFENSE
description: WASHINGTON, March 30President Ford won today significant victories in both thc House and Senate Budget Cornmittces, where attempts by liberal Democrats to force major reductions in the President's military budget were defeated.

title: Amex and OTC Show Price Drops; Trading Moderate
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthe counter market declined yesterday in moderate trading.

title: Today's Entries at Aqueduct
description: Iturscs listed In order or post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: HEALTH OFFICIAL SCORED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, March 30Assemblyman Alan G. Hevesi, a sponsor of reform legislation on Medicaid and nursing homes, today assailed the State Health Commissioner, Robert P. Whalen, for what he said was an attempt to destroy nursinghome reform in New York State.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Harold Prince Stages His First Opera
description: Josef Tal's Ashmedai, which will be given its American premiere tomorrow night by the New York City Opera, is almost certainly the first Israeli opera to be performed in this country. That might seem newsworthy enough, but the production will boast perhaps an even more striking distinction Ashmedai is the first opera that Harold Prince has ever directed.

title: Editor to Resign
description: NORTH ADAMS, March 30 (AP)Alfred B. G. Edmonds said today that he would resign as managing editor of The Transcript in North Adams, effective April 30. No successor has been named.

title: Television
description: 10:00 A.M. Magazine (2)

title: Article 1  No Title
description: SOLITUDE IN THE CITY: Carol McGarvey writing a letter in Brooklyn Botanic Garden yesterday. Unemployed since last Friday, she said this was her last day of freedom before starting the rounds of jobseeking.

title: Justices Hearing Views on Death Penalty
description: WASHINGTON, March 30The Supreme Court began its reexamination of the death penalty today by listening to an emotional appeal for its abolition on behalf of hundreds of prisoners on Death Row.

title: Dance: Limon Troupe at 92d St. Y
description: Tits Jose Limon Dance Company opened a weeklong season at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. last night. It is the resident dance company of the 92d Street Y, and this season is dedicated to the late Dr. William Kolodney who, until his retirement in 1969, was educational director of the Y for 35 years.

title: Gap of $1.40 an Hour Separates Negotiators in Teamster Talks
description: ARLINGTON HEIGHTS, Ill., March 30A gap of about $1.40 an hour in wages, in addition to cost  of  living protection and benefits, separates negotiators for the International Brotherhood of Teamstets and the trucking industry, who are seeking to reach a settlement before midnight tomotrow.

title: 2 Cyclists Fatally Shot On a Houston Freeway
description: HOUSTON. March 30 (AP)Two motorcyclists were killed early today by shots fired from a van as they rode along the Gulf Freeway, the police said.

title: Levi to Order Notification Of Citizens F.B.I. Harried
description: WASHINGTON, March 30Attorney General Edward H. Levi will soon order the Federal Bureau of Investigation to notify unwitting American citizens that they were targets of a 17year F.B.I. program of harassment and disruption, informed Justice Department sources said today.

title: CONGRESS BACKING FORD ON DEFENSE
description: WASHINGTON, March 30President Ford won today significant victories in both the House and Senate Budget Committees, where attempts by liberal Democrats to force major reductions in the President's military budget were defeated.

title: ARGENTINE CHIEF URGES SACRIFICE
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 30 Lieut. Gen. Jorge Rafael Videla, Argentina's new President, called tonight for. sacrifice, work and austerity as the only answer to the nation's economic crisis.

title: Folger's Coffee Prices Up on Ground, Instant
description: The Fogler's Coffee Company, the nation's second largest coffee wholesaler, after General Foods Maxwell House, yesterday raised the price of its ground coffee by 15 cents a pound and by 2 cents an ounce on its instant brand.

title: Conservation Group Gives High Ratings To Carter and Udall
description: WASHINGTON, March 30The League of Conservation Voters today rated Jimmy Carter and Representative Morris K. Udall, Democrats, as the outstanding prospects for President because of their records on environmental questions.

title: Ford Against ForeignAid Rise for Israel
description: WASHINGTON, March 30President Ford told Congressional conferees today that he strongly opposed a plan to increase the foreignaid package so that Israel could receive $500 million additional this year.

title: Associated Dry Goods Quarter Net Up by 29.9%
description: The Associated Dry Goods Corporation, which operates the Lord & Taylor stores in its chain of more than 170 units, reported yesterday profit increases of 29.9 percent for the fourth quarter and 15.31 percent for the fiscal year ended Jan. 31.

title: Passover Buying
description: A complete line of packaged groceries, soaps, paper goods and such unexpected products as toothpante, mouthwash, aspirin and candies, all kosher for Passover, are available at Leibel Bistritzky's kosher gourmet grocery store, at 27 Essex Street, near Grand, and at his special Passover warehouse around the corner at 48 Hester Street.

title: About Education
description: The symptoms are restlessness, anxiety over the future, inability to concentrate, apathy and lack of motivation. The ailment, which afflicts students in the final year of high school, is known as 12th grade lassitude or, most commonly, senioritis.

title: Japan Says It Will Close Its Saigon Embassy Today
description: TOKYO, March 30, (AP)The Japanese Embassy in Saigon will close tomorrow in anticipation of the unification of North Vietnam and South Vietnam next month, a spokesman tar the Foreign Ministry said today.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of an error in reference material, an article in NOV Y011( Ti Ines on Monday incorrectly identified John S. Bowles as president of Benton & Bowles and erroneously reported that he hod at iended a $250aperson function for Jimmy Carter. The president of the firm is John S. Bowen, a Repuhlicon, and he did not Mend. John snwlos, vice president of Kidder Peabody & Co. Inc., Was present.

title: A CANCER PATIENT HAS SOCIAL WOES
description: ST. PETERSBURG BEACH, Fla., March 30Orville E. Kelly is 45 years old, the father of four, and a former newspaper editor from Burlington, Iowa. He is also a cancer patient who may be dying of his disease.

title: Advertising
description: Since the beginning of the recession our business has increased very very extensively.

title: Productivity Issue Snarls City Transit Negotiations
description: Productivity remained the key stumbling block yesterday between the Transit Authority and the Transport Workers Union as they strove to reach an agreement prevent a bus and subway strike tomorrow morning.

title: Syracuse School Chief Quits
description: SYRACUSE, March 30 (AP)Edwin Weeks, Superintendent of Schools here, notified the school board today that he would resign from his $40,214ayear post next January. Mr. Weeks has been superintendent of the state's fifth largest school district for the last three years.

title: Coble TV to Show The Folies Bergere From Las Vegas
description: Home Box Office, the payeleyision service operating on cable systems around the country, has arranged for the presentation of the Folies Bergre in Las Vegas as a 90minute special for its subscribers. The program will be taped during a performance at the Tropicana Hotel, where the United States edition of the Paris Folies Ben gre has been running for 15 years

title: Contract Award
description: The Northrop Corporation announced yesterday that the Swiss Government had signed contracts with the Department of Defense and the company for 72 Northrop F5E and F5F tactical fighter aircraft. The Swiss Parliament approved the purchase and voted $450 million cover the program which includes spare parts and support and ground equipment.

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. Indiana Pacers, at Indianapolis. (TelevisionChannel 9, 8 P.M.)

title: Traditional Dishes Of Passover (Cont'd); Haroset
description: 2 large apples, preferably McIntosh  cup raisins  cup pitted dates cup shelled, unblanched almonds  cup shelled walnuts 1 teaspoon powdered ginger 1 teaspoon cinnamon  to 1/3 cup sweet red wine.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Department of Health has certified projects worth $84.5 million at 57 health facilities in the state. The department said 14 proposed projects with an estimated cost of $11.3 million had been rejected. The certifications were made by the state Health Planning Council and Dr. Joanne E. Finley, Commissioner of Health.

title: Kesey, at Oregon Farm, Mulls Over Screen Rights
description: PLEASANT HILLS, Ore., March 30Ken, Kesey, his family and 15 friends and neighbors watched the Academy Awards here on television last night at his blueberry farm southeast of Eugene with a resigned sense of the absurd as the movie adaptation of his novel One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest, won five Oscars.

title: 2 ATTICA JURIES ARE DISMISSED
description: On a motion by the special Attica prosecutor, a State Supreme court justice in upstate Warsaw yesterday discharged two grand juries impaneled in 1971 and 1974 to investigate the 1971 uprising at the state prison. The revolt took the lives of 29 inmates and 10 guardhostages.

title: Callaway Quits Post
description: WASHINGTON, March 30President Ford replaced Howard H. Callaway today as chairman of the President's campaign organization, naming Rogers C. B. Morton to succeed him.

title: Penney's Dividend Raised To 32c From 29c a Share
description: Directors of the J. C. Penney Company Inc., yesterday increased the quarterly dividend to 32 cents a share from 29 cents, lifting the annual rate on the common stock to $1.28 a share. Payable May 1 to holders of record April 10, it is the first increase in two years.

title: Bill Evans Serves A Dance of Tennis With Precise Wit
description: Bill Evans's perception of character in his solo dance portraits is witty, economical and precise, while his largerscaled works are frequently blurred and ungainly. They ramble along, quite pleasantly at times, but lack the quick decisiveness of the solo characterizations. He presented half a dozen dances Monday evening at the American Theater Laboratory.

title: Leader of Alliance Refecit DemandSays Damascus Acts to Cut Arms Supply
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Wednesday, March 31  Syrian mediators increased pressure an recalcitrant Lebanese factions yesterday, demanding that Moslem leaders and their leftist allies agree at once to a weeklong truce in Lebanon's civil war.

title: GOVERNOR VETOES SCHOOL AID BILL
description: ALBANY. Wednesday, March 31Governor Carey last night abruptly vetoed a budget bill to dispense $3 billion in education assistance to localities, charging that the bill's complicated aid formulas  approved by the Legislature 10 days ago would cost the state $40 million more than the lawmakers had appropriated.

title: Transit Talks at a Glance
description: The public agencies involved in the contract negotiations are the New York City Transit Authority and its subsidiary, the Manhattan and Bronx Surface Transit Operating Authority. They operate the city's subways and publicly owned bus lines. Both are under the direction of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, a slate agency.

title: REV. JOSEPH P. SHINE
description: The Rev. Joseph P. Shine, pastor of Holy Name Roman Catholic Church, 245 Prospect Park West, Brooklyn, died Saturday evening in the church rectory. He was 64 years old.

title: Work Stoppage Causes TieUps, in Japan
description: TOKYO, March 30Nationwide strikes by more than two million transportation, communications, medical, mining and harbor workers virtually paralyzed Japan today as organized labor opened the second phase of its current contract negotiations under the cloud of this country's continuing recession.

title: Nadjari's Motives Questioned in Court
description: ALBANY, March 30  The lawyer for Patrick J. Cunningham, Democratic state chairman, told the State Court of Appeals today that Maurice H. Nadjari, special state prosecutor, only wanted to embarrass Mr. Cunningham, who is also Bronx county chairman, and really did not intend to question him before a special grand jury.

title: RACE TO SUCCEED WILSON DOWN TO 2
description: LONDON, March 30The contest to succeed Harold Wilson as Britain's Prime Minister was narrowed today to two men: James Callaghan, the Foreign Secretary, and Michael Foot, the Secretary for Employment.

title: Bus Terminal Expansion Is Pushed
description: The $160 million expansion and modernization of the Port Authority Midtown Bus Terminal, intended to ease rushhour crushes on the loading platforms, is going ahead rapidly although bus traffic there has been declining steadily, if slowly, since 1968.

title: ItemPricing May Get Reprieve in Supermarkets With Electronic CheckOut
description: A supermarket industry subcommittee has recommended that individual item pricing be voluntarily retained by stores that install electronic checkout systems.

title: Seaver Alters Demands, Raising Hope for Accord
description: ST. PETERSBURG,. Fla., March 30Tom Seaver revised his salary demands today as his struggle with the New York Mots continued. Both sides expressed hope that the struggle would result in a contract and not a trade.

title: Ford Weighs Modest Postal Subsidy
description: WASHINGTON, March 30 (UPI)President Ford has a panel studying the United States Postal Service's financial problems and will consider at least a modest Federal subsidy to asist it, his press secretary. Ron Nesen said today.

title: Lockheed Starts $500 Million WriteOff
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation announced yesterday that, because its overseas payments scandal and the airline industry's recession had increased uncertainty about its jumbo jet investments, it was beginning a 10year writeoff of $500 million in past costs.

title: RUBE BLOOM DIES; COMPOSER WAS 73
description: Rube Bloom, the composer whose hits over nearly half a century included Give Me the Simple Life, Penthouse Serenade and Don't Worry Bout Me, died last evening at his home in the Consulate Hotel, 224 West 49th Street. He was 73 years old.

title: Notes on People
description: Representative F. Edward Hbert, the Louisiana Democrat who is fourth in the House in seniority, said yesterday that he would retire at the end of this session.

title: Iraq Is Said to Be Threatening Armed Intervention in Lebanon
description: PARIS, March 30Western intelligence reports reaching Paris today said that Iraq had threatened to intervene militarily in Lebanon if Syria exerted heavy pressure on Moslem forces there to restore a ceasefire.

title: 5 Israeli Arabs Killed in Protest Riots
description: NAZARETH, Israel, March 30 A general strike by Israel's Arab citizens erupted today into violent clashes with security forces in more than a dozen villages in the northern half of the country that left at least five Arabs dead and about 70 people wounded.

title: Film and Book Rights To Life Sold by Reilly
description: CANAAN, Conn., March 30 (UPI)Peter A. Reilly, whose successful appeal fo a new trial on a manslaughter conviction drew national attention, has signed over publishing and movie rights to his life to a local author, it was disclosed today.

title: Soviet Rock May Be Oldest
description: MOSCOW, March 30 (Reuters)Soviet geologists have discovered what they believe to be the oldest rock in the world, the press agency Tass reports. The granite rock, which covers several acres of the Kola peninsula in northwestern Russia, is more than nine billion years old, according to Tass.
